-6htEh10EXQMPqx4xajT7Q.text: I wish I could only give a half star for this place. As they say, "You never have a second chance to make a first impression!" From the moment we met our waitress, she had the personality of a door knob and completely ruined our mood as we were just looking to have a pleasant time and enjoy ourselves. We don't expect her to flirt with us but at least try to interact with your customers and make them feel welcome. We like to feel good about spending our money and having a nice time. Aside from from that, the food was average at best and the drinks are as weak as circus kool-aid. Luckily there are many other possibilities in a town like Las Vegas. gdHBAvvPc3wWp2fEa_Z9QQ.text: I've been stopping for breakfast during my Sunday morning bike rides and I decided to give PKWY Tavern a try.  I had been here several times when it was the Roadrunner Saloon and this was on my planned route.  I walked in and stopped at the podium but there was no one in sight.  I walked down the ramp into the bar area and again not a soul in sight.  After a short wait, a woman came to the bar area and I asked about breakfast.  They do have breakfast and I could sit anywhere I wanted.  I was the only customer at about 8:30 AM.  The server brought me a menu and then brought a hot cup of coffee.  The menu is sparse for breakfast--there are only 7 items.  This is a young person's beer drinking, pong playing kind of place and breakfast would not be a big draw.  Regardless, I chose the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich the menu describes as "griddled Texas toast with American cheese, bacon, tomato and fried eggs served with tater tots."  Within a short time, my plate was brought.  The tater tots were standard ones that had not been deep fried again but were most likely heated in a microwave.  The sandwich was good with crispy bacon.  The interplay of tomato, cheese, and egg was good.  The server came back and refilled my coffee.  She was a very pleasant woman and her service was excellent.  After paying, I took the opportunity to check out the changes since I had been there before.  The cowboy/Western theme is pretty much gone.  Where there had been booths on the south side secondary eating area, there are now large window doors to open the place up to the patio that's enclosed with a fence.  It also has artificial grass which is a plus for our water use.  I'm sure this is a great place to enjoy some of their large selection of beers and socialize.   It was also in this area where I locked my bike.  It was inside the main door but before the second set of doors into the restaurant.  That gave some security by not having the bike outside facing Flamingo Road.  I'd come back again.  For Sunday breakfast while others are sleeping in or sleeping it off, it was a quiet place.

vUkZ5mD9ifVUQkr_QZXfmw.text: Horrible experience. First time walking in, went with a friend who's visiting from California. We sat to eat, only ordered water before the "ID checker" came to our table and scanned our IDs, as he scanned my friends he looked at it a million times before asking to have someone else check it. We asked what was wrong with it & he said nothing. He had someone else take my friends ID in the back and look at it and came out and asked to talk to him. So we followed , and then they told him " we can't take it here." They didn't give reasoning, so we left. They stood outside as we left which was very annoying. It's like they had never seen a California ID before. Very horrible experience.

YY7H7pYX1DtPe9Ko8yTtKg.text: I really wanted to love this place because I loved Roadrunner. Went here on a Monday late afternoon. It was not busy at all. First impression not good. I hate when I sit down and the booth is dirty and table sticky. Why?? The place was not busy.   We ordered 2 beers. I asked the girl if they had Peroni (they have about 500 beers) she told me no. I asked her to check and she seemed to get mad. Of course when she came back they had my beer. No need to get mad when you work in a bar that is focused mainly on it's beer selection.  Ordered the steak nachos for an app. and that was not a good choice. Usually nachos have cheese on them. Hmm-- maybe they were mad about me asking about the beer so they decided to skip the cheese on my nachos. =) Oh well.  We ordered 2 of the regular burgers. Nothing special. One med and one well done. Of course when they brought those out they were both pink inside. Are you kidding me? How hard is it to cook a well done burger? I had to send it back and of course the girl was getting angrier. They came out to inform me it would be an additional 20 minutes for my burger. I did not have time for these games. So I told them to just take the old patty and put it back on the grill. They did and brought it out. Half of it was still pink. I let the angry girl take it away. She did not apologize or offer to take it off my bill. Shame on her.  I could understand these things happening if this place was slammed, but there were only like 5 other customers in the whole place and maybe 2 of us were eating. Seems like there might be some problems in this place. What a waste of a meal and money. I will not be back until they change management.

uhTBB8_KxlLKj2uqG4laCA.text: Passed this place a couple of times and decided to stop in for a quick bite to eat and a nice ice cold beer. Waitress was quick to greet us and told us to sit wherever we would like. Got menus and beer list to us and asked if we wanted anything in particular. Hubby asked what were her favorites and she said the philly sandwich was one of her favorites. We asked for water and she went to go get it while we looked at the beer list. So many choices but I decided on a strawberry beer as I like the fruity ales and hubby got a blonde of some sort. She brought the water and took our order. Beers came and they were nice and cold and food followed shortly after. Nice area with pool tables, big bar area and a little two lane bowling alley, also had a nice outdoor area with lots of tvs. Booths also had tvs as well. We can't wait to come in and catch a game during football season with the family. As we were checking out the different areas the Manager came and talked to us and we chatted for a while. Nice guy, might turn into a regular hang out spot for us.

Sk8CgGqBlTsRSBK6ra-u7w.text: 5 stars for terrific bar food, kickass music, and a sick selection of craft beers on tap.  The last time I was here, I told the bartender I normally drink Saizons and he introduced me to the Sierra Nevada Raspberry Sundae Ale. Only thing I drank all night.  For food, I recommend their giant pretzels, either with beer cheese or in their Barcuterie Plate. They are HUGE, soft and mealy inside, and clearly fresh from the oven. Easily the best pretzel I've ever had.  I also love the spinach dip, which comes with these incredible handmade pita chips. Out of this world.  The venue is pretty big with bowling, darts, and arcade games indoors, and a huge outdoor area with giant versions of Jenga, Cornhole, etc.  Fantastic spot for a chill night with a group of friends, or to make some new ones. 100% would come again!

IOQpyBhz8iQZKomnhJ9Rvg.text: My review is in reference to my visit with family on 8/28/17 at 5:30 pm. Firstly, I would like to express that as of yet I have not written many negative reviews. However, the service that was received by staff at this location was so disappointing that management and ownership of this location should be aware. The hostess was friendly and accommodating with seating for my kids on this visit. Our meals were appetizing, including the fried chicken for 2 and fish and chips. Our server took our order and when it arrived another guy brought our meals out. When we said politely please put our dishes down out of our kids' reach because they were hot he said, "Obviously." Our orders did not come with sauce such as ketchup for fries or tartar sauce for fish and chips. Also, my husband's grandma was given someone else's meal and my little one's grilled cheese did not arrive with the order. Our server came by and said that she put the order in and something was wrong with their system very rudely. When the order was ready thirty minutes later, she threw it on the table with a sarcastic remark. No apologies given, carelessness, and overall very regrettable experience. If you are contemplating on dining here with family or friends and would like awful service, this is the place for you. One star for nice hostess and another for appetizing fish and chips.

0-jnAm5daHrZXdD8DBCZJQ.text: Not sure what all the fuss is about. My brother and I stopped in for a drink during an uncharacteristically slower time one night during the week and from the moment we sat down it was less than a pleasant experience. There was no greeting. Despite a server being present, she was unable to let us know that we would only receive service if we went to the bar. Nor did any of the bartenders. If the venue had been wall-to-wall people the way I've seen it in the past, I would understand the unresponsive staff, but this was by no means a busy night for them.   Disappointing. I live in the neighborhood. Pass by it daily. It would have been nice to have a new spot to frequent. I won't be returning.

GqrrTzsR9QxqkG5qf6mFyg.text: There are definitely pros and cons about PKWY. The two top pros is as said by Mr.David V. One of the pros about PKWY is the large draft beer list. And the number of games you can play here just like bowling, corn hole, beer pong, jenga, and so on.   My boyfriend and I live only a street down on Fort Apache and so this is one of our go-to places when we want to hang out with friends. It is definitely a fun place to hang out. There is always lots of people here, especially on the weekends.   The drinks are sadly overpriced! And every bar I gamble in comps your drinks but do not expect that from this place at all! Bartenders never pay attention to you, so service is not the best here. You always have to hail someone to ask for a menu, to order food, and to even get a refill on your drinks. Like I said, if you sit there and gamble for 2 hours and have two beers, they sometimes won't even comp you one drink. You would be lucky to get one of them comped. So if you want to gamble, do not go here!  Food is aight. I've had both good and bad experiences with it. It's regular bar food.   Surprisingly, the security here is a lot more friendlier than the bartenders. They remember you if you're a regular.   Three stars for beer list, games, and cool security staff.

lzkLhEiNajK1YYC34Io4sw.text: Worst bartender service EVER! The bartenders are extremely rude, and look like they hate their job. The waitresses aren't bad, I've have a good experience with them. They've been polite, and professional. It's just the bartenders, man. They're terrible.   I went to Parkway on Flamingo & 215 last night, and I've been to the establishment a couple other times. The few times I've been I usually try to get a different bartender to provide service to see if they're all crappy, and most are, except Nial (I think that's his name, he's at the inside bar.) I hate going to the inside bar because it's usually extremely packed. Therefore, I resort to the outside bar. Which I hate resorting to because there is one particular bartender that takes the cake on worst customer service. He's a tall, older looking, thin guy that has "I hate my job" written across his face. The last two visits I've had to go to him and it's been terrible! He makes no conversation, you can't ask a question because it's like you're asking for a million dollars, and everything just seems to be a bother to him. So avoid the outside bar unless his partner which is a shorter thin guy with tattoos helps you, he's a lot nicer.   Besides the crappy bartenders the food is not so bad, and the music is hit and miss. All depends on the night you go, and which DJ is spinning.

EIPg3JdrNVty0dURbJkHAw.text: PKWY tavern has this phenomenon going on where the end of the week gets extremely packed, Thursday and peek nights Fri and Sat are so bad they have you wearing a wrist band to get in. Be warned if you're 28 and older, you are too old to be there. I mean it's fun, it reminds me of a smaller version of Gold Spike- games, board games, ping pong, bowling, darts, shuffle board, pool tables, slot machines - shit- everything you need to entertain yourself or friends. It's essentially suburbia's  neighborhood party on the weekends.   The vibe? 20-year old Hipster/horny muscle packed, crop-top, too much make up wearing, pretty boy/girl individuals. It's annoying. Most people are there to get laid and show off. But if you're like me, you just enjoy the drunk people watching and entertainment.   The bartenders are alright, kinda slow, and they talk too much when it's busy. I've never had the food. Beer is in abundance and pricey except for their happy hour which is recommended. 82XAxEgkTVxxGWBhvhWl8Q.text: A friend of mine had told me about this place and said it was worth a check out because of the cool bartenders and fabulous beer selection, so my wife and I went to check it out last night.    Pros:  Friendly staff (hostess, busboy), large beer selection (on paper at least), nice outdoor patio area  Cons:  SLOW Service, Food 1 1/2  start at best, beer list not quite accurate  We met the hostess on our way in, and told her we were interested in sitting in the bar area, which is open seating.  After we picked out a table she brought us our menus and told us our server would be right with us.  At the time there were about 10 people at the bar and only a table of 3 guys in the whole bar area.  We sat our table for approximately 10 minutes before our server (who looked at us at least 5 times, but was too busy flirting with the table of 3 guys) made it to our table. Upon taking our drink order, it took her another 5 minutes to get back with our drinks - a martini and and ice tea.    A few more minutes passed and she came back to get our food order, at which time I placed my first attempt at a bottled beer listed on the beer menu.  After looking at me with confusion and verifying that I was actually reading a beer off the menu, she went back to place our orders.  A few minutes later she returned telling me they were out of the that beer.  I ordered another beer, and after a few minutes received the same response that they were out.  Well at this point I just went for the old standby - Corona.    My wife ordered the Prime Rib Melt.  The sandwich came out with a side of fries.  Upon reviewing the menu again as I write this, it states all sandwiches come with a choice of side, no choice was given.  However, besides being a little greasy, she like the sandwich and commented that the fries were nice and crispy without being overcooked.    I ordered the Blackened Shrimp and Grits.  I really was looking forward to this dish, but when it came out I immediately sensed I would be in for utter disappointment, and I was not wrong.  The grits had  congealed to a point that the whole top layer had made a smooth mold.  In the mold of grits I had 5 shrimp.  I cut into the first shrimp and realized there was no way these were fresh, but definitely frozen, or had been extremely overcooked.  All five shrimp were so tough and rubbery, that I could have used them in a game of racquetball.  Additionally, the flavor was very bland, which in a "blackened" dish; you would not expect to be the case.  Also, our server did not offer me a side, so for $15.95, all I received was 5 tasteless rubbery shrimp and a mold of cheese flavored grits.  Very, very disappointing.   While we were eating our server came over over once, about 15 minutes after we received our food (food was brought out by bus boy, who gave us way better service), and pushed the check on us because she was "getting off shortly and wanted to close out."  I used to work in the service industry as both a bartender and bar manager, this is definitely not the training I would have provided my staff, when it come to customer service.    All in all, as much I would really like to enjoy this place, it falls short on so many levels.  Needless to say with all of the other dinning options in Vegas available to locals, we won't be going back.

HyZSt1wfZbFf0JyxskQImw.text: Get more or better staff! I finally was asked if I wanted a drink 20 minutes after I was sitting at the Bar. I had spent 100 on keno. 3fT50hgWU6M3x2x5IED_Ew.text: Reminiscent of GoldSpike, but in the west side of town, closer to where I live, which is in Spring Valley. Came here with a group of 8 friends last night around 8:30 and didn't head out till 12:00. LOUD bar with a lot of young people usually twenty- somethings and bros, which isn't my scene. I'd rather hang out at a dive bar, receive more attentive service and have my drinks served in a more timely manner .  Long story short, you have to be in the mood for this atmosphere, because the crowd can get really annoying and if you don't mind waiting 5-10 minutes for drinks; then this is your go-to bar. Maybe I'm getting older and over the Vegas basic bar scene . They have over 200 beers on tap, but not all of them are available at the same time. If you sign up for the PKWY card you receive deals and a shirt .

V0qpdO0hDR_BhfAUfed1gQ.text: 5 stars not really.  Not part of the yelp mafia that puts company's out of business.  Third time at this place and we won't be coming back. Great idea for a bar but the service is bad and the food is just ok. We played somee shuffle board and we were  timed out both times. A flat fee would be better. Corporate nickel dimeing is what most of us don't come to the bar for. Played some darts after and asked for multiple IDs for two sets of darts for the same party. I guess the place gets alot of dart thieves. We would have stayed a bit longer but the ac wasn't working and the misters were down for the night.  Maybe just a lame night but the place is new and shouldn't be going through so many issues.  The five stars goes to our waitress.  She was helpful and attentive.  The rest was bad..

uxDMPyGFwZ8_kcRiEHeJIw.text: If you love beer, and you love trying new beers, this place is a must visit. With more than enough on draft and a huge selection in bottles/cans, you can't go wrong giving this place a try.  I've been here a few times, and I have to say I've only order food once so overall my experiences are strictly with beer and service.  The service tends to be hit or miss (especially if they are super busy, which is pretty often on the weekends). Even if your own server isn't great I've noticed that other servers are typically happy to help you out. This is much appreciated as typically most places it's hard to get other servers' attention. I also highly recommend downloading their app, as it gives you the most up-to-date list of beers they currently have in stock! Super convenient.  The place is very casual, with live music/DJs from time to time and they always have music playing. They also have PLENTY to do while you're there. This is one of the main reasons we love coming here. They have bowling, shuffle board, pool, darts, giant Jenga, giant Connect Four, and of course beer pong. Their out door seating is perfect for many of these things, and there is also a separate bar outside (perfect for ordering another great beer and enjoying the weather when it's nice).   This last time I finally gave their giant pretzel and beer cheese a try. IT. Was. Amazing! The pretezel was as big as a dinner plate, and came out super hot/fresh. Outside of the pretzel crisp while the inside was super soft. To top it off, the beer cheese was a perfect pair.   Above all else, this place is always open is you know you can always grab a great beer and decent food!

WH-SHBLJH0uiIlhYBGmbtQ.text: 2 stars only because sometime atmosphere is good and have a good beer selection, first they were charging $15 a can for New England Ipas Or select sours which is absurd, yes those beers aren't cheap but $15 a can is ridiculous. Second I had to ask the bartender about happy hour, it was running for an hour and a half and they didn't tell one customer about it, bartender was awful, place is run by a bunch of people who seem to have no idea whats goin on and some bad attitudes. R_5KzTflenrTX9_rMtPY7w.text: I've driven by so many times but never went in until recently. This place is great! It used to be a Roadrunner Saloon but they've done a great job enhancing it. The outdoor area is cool with all the games and TVs. Inside there's plenty of comfortable seating, TVs everywhere, a 2 lane bowling alley, and pool tables.   If you're looking for deals, their happy hour specials consist of $3 drinks and $5 and $6 appetizers. The beer list is long and the food is surprisingly good for a sports bar/gaming tavern. The chicken and waffle sliders, in particular, are amazing. They come two per order, the waffles held up fairly well, maintaining their crispness and sandwiching lightly breaded chicken. Pour some syrup on it and you'll be in heaven. If you want a burger, go for the Belly burger -- a half pound burger topped with  seared pork belly glazed with BBQ sauce.  Don't forget to check out the restroom. They've got cool urinals made out of kegs.

4BxzCYtcePFTtYtLuFatOw.text: Wish I could give 0 stars. The security guards here have no respect. They deny you entrance even though you have a real ID. Hawaii IDs have a hologram on it, if there's no hologram it's fake! MINE HAD A HOLOGRAM. You can google it too or call the Hawaii DMV and ask about it, they'll tell you the same thing. But bc they "felt it was fake" and didn't even scan it they denied entrance. I showed all my debit/credit cards.. even my TAM( ALCOHOL SERVING CARD) card and they still said my ID was fake. Again, prior to the menu change this place had great french fries, I think they may have even been home made. These wtf fries were disgusting, soggy cheap fries drenched in even cheaper nacho cheese with fake guacamole.  Besides the food being bad, the service sucked as well. I had to physically track down the waitress a couple times just to get our check and pay. We won't be back again.

jcH70G5OsvX4qdgNe9DzmA.text: Decided to come here NOT during the night when I usually do and still enjoyed my time! Went here on a Saturday afternoon to get some food and beer in our stomachs after my cousins had gotten off a flight and we were definitely not disappointed!   Although there were happy hour items, we decided to divulge in different beers, appetizers, and food. Let me just say, yes, those chicken fingers really are good (Thanks Rey for making us eat here!) and the beer selection was amazing. However, my mainnnnn goes to the "PB&J" sandwich!   BUT WHY?! It's not peanut butter...its PORK BELLY!  with a JALAPENO JELLY SAUCE  I'm just saying, if you're okay with heat/spice and want that savory taste, this is the best! The cites of pork belly are pretty thick, buuuut fairly soft. This dish made it for me, honestly.  So yes, this place is more than just an adult playground/fun spot at night. You CAN get good food, good drinks, and a chill afternoon here. (But if you don't like flies, don't sit near the outter side by the garage doors. You will be annoyed )

iUK-L0iBXBcd8luDq-QjAA.text: First time going to this place and it'll also be the last time until they get their customer service together and can control the idiots who go there.   After having dinner at another local restaurant, we thought we'd check out this place since our friend from out of town wanted to hang out. The night started off pretty good. We got there before the crowd really picked up. And that's when it started to go down hill.  By the third round of drinks, my vodka sprite became just a sprite. I'm not sure if the bartender didn't hear us or he forgot but it was disappointing which killed my buzzed. To be fair, he was trying to multi-task and making drinks for these other girls who came after us.   Three hours in, our friends wanted to order some chili cheese fries. After trying to flag a waitress for about 10-15mins, they placed their order and told the waitress to omit the chili because they're vegetarians. About 30mins later the fries show up and it was plain chili cheese fries. My friend had to flag down the waitress again for another 10-15mins to replace the order. The food was mediocre at best. Reminded me of cafeteria food the way it was presented. Another 15-20mins and the fries finally came out.   As they were enjoying their food, my bf and I were in a deep conversation, when he gets hit on his thigh by something. He brushed it off. Then a coaster came flying at our table and falls right into the food. Some drunk idiots were throwing around coasters to other customers around them and hit our table three times as well. Seeing the coaster, in her fries, after about an hr wait didn't sit well with my friend so she throw something back at them. She calls security to let them know, and after going back and forth between the idiots who started it and our table, we were kicked out of the restaurant. There were other customers who had our back and tried to talk to them but at that point they just wanted us gone. When my bf asked at why the other party wasn't being held accountable, all the security guy and the manager said was, "they've been drinking and are being idiots..." So that means, it's ok for people to go into your establishment, throw stuff at other customers, but it's ok because they've been drinking and being idiots but it's not ok for us to "retaliate" by throwing stuff back at them? We're just suppose to sit here and take it? They had no answer...   If you like shitty customer service, mediocre food, and want to relive your college days at a frat party then come here. Waste of a 25mins drive...

q5BmCZ76pDv_uBp66oAAzw.text: Negative First- drinks are a bit pricey and the music is way too loud which makes it hard to converse with people, at least outside. We didn't go into the main bar area.  Orders the fries and mini corn dogs, delicious. Interesting sweet/spicy twist on the fries. My rum and coke was super strong so they def don't skimp on the alcohol which probably why drinks are a bit more. The waitress was friendly and attentive, which is impressive since we were outside playing games and kept moving around.  It being half indoor/outdoor makes a nice ambience since you can play games outside without feeling you're shoulder to shoulder with people like most bars. At some point at night they have a curfew where children or the underage can't be permitted which is awesome. I didn't really hear all the details but it's a nice rule they have implemented. It's annoying when my husband go out and its late at night and you have screaming children hanging around. Sorry parents but get a babysitter, seriously.  Overall, the tavern is enjoyable and good place to hang out with people but like i said before, conversation can be difficult due to music. The Tavern is is always busy, I've gone to the gym at 3am (even on weekday nights) and it will still be packed with cars.

o5qewSEZPg-et8BvvX_DjQ.text: If I was still in college  this place would be my dope spot fo sho! lol great food great music & great staff - love it - used to come here when it was roadrunner but it's way better now

6glMJI5uXmodTLDmFyU4pw.text: We came in for an afternoon lunch on the patio. I'm sure this place has a totally different vibe at night. It was surprisingly kid friendly and suited out needs nicely!  Our 2 little ones were entertained by the games and sights while we got to enjoy a nice beer al fresco! Win win! There's a jenga game and very large connect four.  I had a scrumptious grapefruit Hefeweizen.  We shared some fried pickles and a French dip type sandwich. It was good - typical bar food.  Our service was lacking. The table was sticky but the busser kindly cleaned it up when I asked. Unfortunately, this was after I got sticky red stuff all over my pants and sleeve.  Regardless, I'd certainly return for good beer options and a fun time on the patio.

JOL7lhaj21JNDrC6MBjP3w.text: We came here for a party. The inside was nice. The chandeliers are made out of beer bottles. They claim to have 1000 beers. The bartender told me while gambling they only can comp the front tap beers which was about 30 different drafts.   The food was decent. Our pepperoni pizza was just ok. The boneless chicken fingers were pretty good. We ordered sweet potato tots, but they never came out so we had the waitress remove them from the bill.    The bar was pretty busy for a Monday. The crowd seemed to be a late 20s early 30s crowd. The patio was pretty cool. They have corn hole, janga, 4 square, board games, and shuffle board.   It's a good place for a large group to meet up. I don't know if I'd go there alone or for a date though.

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The men&#39;s urinals.

Vfy0s9ObvMfCFE_X1bs-PA.text: Food: the food is pretty good, typical bar food of burgers, fries, and other fried stuffs. Nothing remarkable regarding the food.  Atmosphere: Ehhhh it's definitely trying. The attempt at indoor/outdoor is pretty lame. The astro turf outside makes it feel sooo cheap. That combined with the effort to contain costs is really making this place difficult to enjoy. I'm pretty sure the bearded owner that hovers over everything means well, but the desperation of this place is thick. I do appreciate the hiring managers affinity to DDs, thanks for that bro ;)  Throw in some weekend live entertainment and this place may have a chance, otherwise tik-tok!

HFOdibeE-yaT3D4giGfzlw.text: I always have fun here. Per usual wish there were more bathroom stalls. But any food or drinks I've had have been great and the servers and bar tenders have always been fun and friendly

vA7rzmYyc8cy9GH6knloLw.text: Stopped by for lunch... menu is a bit strange but ended up choosing skinny chicken which is chicken cooked in garlic and lemon with an arugula salad. Hubby got chicken wings. My hubby loves salt and i always give him grief about it... but in this instance even he thought the food was waaay too salty. My dish was almost inedible due to the garlic salt and salt on it. They even salted the salad! The waitress did offer to send it back but im always afraid of what they will do to my food so i declined. We wont be back.

9Md3FJ93b8y31eUQ3ZZQ9w.text: I love this place!!! Always fun to come over n drink beers , play billiard  Definitely recommend

7wzNc5jEIRcRYaG6uncngA.text: We've had some less than stellar experiences here, but gave it another try because of their beer selection and games. We sat down at the patio and were never acknowledged. After 15 minutes we left. It wasn't busy and there were several staff in the area. I would have appreciated at least someone stopping by and saying "we'll be right with you." With so many bars in the area we just don't have time for inferior service.

Yqe_2USeUz3vuFUIBLFCOQ.text: Despite the crappiest service this side of the Mississippi, the food is good and the beer selection is awesome.  I'm pretty sure this place wouldn't be so popular if it weren't for the food, beer club, and HUGE beer selection.  My personal favorite is the Pineapple Cider!  The staff is friendly, too, but soooooooooooooo slow.    They have a great happy hour selection- appetizers are half off, $3 cocktails, and beer specials.  For the most part, I've never met a PKWY app that I haven't liked!  There are also a lot of games, but I've never played because they've been busy every time I've visited.  One other thing- if you are sensitive to heat, you should know that they frequently open the bar up (they have glass garage doors) to the gaming area outside... It's an indoor-outdoor bar and it gets pretty hot in the summertime.

C2JwuaHcR25xK3Uy7KQXJg.text: Went to this restaurant on a Friday night. I haven't been here since it used to be the Road Runner, it looks different now including a very enticing  misted patio that I want to try to sit at next time I go. I probably wouldn't sit on the patio unless it was hair washing night because humidity and my lovely locks do not mix well, but still. The hostesses were nice and tried to help me find my party, but I ended up seeing my friend waving from the corner of my eye and we sat at a giant wooden table. It was high off the ground and could seat eight people so it felt pretty epic to me.   This place is known for their beer club which is totally free to join. I don't like beer, so I didn't join, but if you like beer I think they carry all of them here. Lol. They have a leaderboard of who is drinking the most beers and there are perks and prizes at every level. The club also works between all of their locations which is neat.   I had a pineapple cider which was amazing. I also had a greek salad, which I thought was delicious but probably is not a PKWY Tavern specialty. My boyfriend just had the nachos as his entree and he said he could take them or leave them, but he did think they were better than Nacho Daddy. That isn't a super high bar in my opinion but take what you will from it.   Didn't blow my mind but satisfied my basic needs. I like it! I would probably return less for the food and more for the atmosphere. This seems like a convenient, casual place to chill back with friends and have a few drinks - especially if you like beer! Will be back when I'm in the neighborhood.

SPxTOuFqvHZNbuTOHBcOQg.text: LOVE this place.  I just wish it wasn't so far from me, otherwise I'd visit more often.  This location used to be a Roadrunner. PKWY has taken over and while they've kept some things the same (mini bowling), they've made some great changes too (corn hole, beer pong, giant Jenga, etc).   If you like craft beer, this is the place for you. They have a HUGE selection. They also have a great app for their "TEAM," which will track the beers you've tried and also issue you points, which can earn you gift certificates and stuff.  The staff are all friendly and helpful. It gets super crowded on weekends....almost like a frat party, but it's definitely a good time.

nAFLW8yO8THhmZhwcLk-0A.text: Awesome beer and fun food! The jaleopeno poppers with grape jelly are a must! Download the app to keep track of the beers you try and like (or don't like). The bartenders are friendly and made great suggestions. There are eve games to play while you wait. Children are welcomed (during the day at least). This is def one of our new favorite places to go!

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño egg rolls with grape jelly. So good I couldn&#39;t even get a pic before it was halfway gone!

wYn16lfXKWuawBEKye9YfQ.text: This place is horrendous. We called in advance to ensure that we could bring our daughter on the patio for a friend's birthday celebration. Upon arrival, we were told we had to leave by 9 pm as there is a "new rule" in Nevada that prohibits children on patios after 9 pm (although they could not specify the rule). When we left (after the rude bouncer Sean was literally about to physically remove us from the premises because we were a couple minutes after 9), NO ONE was smoking on the patio.    In addition to the foregoing, the food was awful, they were out of beer on the menu and their bar could not handle serving customers when another event was going on.   Bottom line: DO NOT GO HERE.

oJeRl_1KD8-dmHKR87lotw.text: So guys I came to pkwy tavern for the first time tonight, and I met the guards, at bars normally suck! But dude these guards Raymond and Sean are freakin awesome!! Pkwy tavern is a must go! From the bartenders nick and Nile to everything else everything was perfect !!!

E_czHXQgg2Wuf6-hIq0Pzg.text: My lady friends and I came here for the first time to watch the Sunday football. First off, SO many TVs. It didn't matter where you sat, you have view of at least two screens. It was real busy but raining like hell so we decided to sit outside in a covered spot with only a few drips from above until a table inside opened up. Mark was our server outside who produced an extensive beer menu which we perused at our leisure. The food is better than your average bar food and the drinks were plentiful. The best thing about our experience, however, was Mark. He positioned three heaters around our table to keep us warm. He was by our side the entire time replenishing drinks without being asked, recommending drinks and food, and just generally being a fantastic, considerate, attentive server. We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretzel sundae

MVaLP79pdzisS0mE4dOlLw.text: My first visit & I loved it. Happy hour from 4-7pm selected drink & all appetizers half off! The food was delicious! We had loaded fries, buffalo wings & fingers, loaded tots, mini corn dogs & nachos.. Everything was delicious!!   A huge variety of beers to chose from and games to play, including bowling, corn hole & a giant jenga. Fun place to visit with friends and have fun.

WqsKastyJSQW7Dq8vyAsMw.text: Servers are slow as fuck!! My grandma moves faster than them! Bartenders are rude! Dumbasses!!

D14e7WtSTZhlrFRSI40tLw.text: PkwyTavern is very nice and is accommodating to varies parties. I.e. Family, groups and small get togethers. It has outside siting and water mysters.  Inside, well they need to turn up the A/C a bit cooler....  With. 109 degrees outside. A place cool comfortable can make a big difference!    I was greeted by a very friendly hostess. Asked if I was with a party or will be sitting at bye bar. I chose the bar.  I was then greeted by another friendly young lady. Took my drink order and asked if I was interested in looking at a menu.  I said , "Yes please".    Menu looked pretty good. They offer a 24/7 breakfast menu.  Very good! I ordered the Beer Battered Mushroom Burger, medium and was cooked to perfection! Only problem I did have was my meal was served in a small deep frying basket.  It was challenging for me to navigate. I needed a little more space on or in my basket to eat. The handle on the basket was in my way.   All in all. Pkwy Tavern is a pretty nice place to watch every type of sporting event. All the employees are friendly and attentive.   I will come back again.  When it cools down outside....

fGbk1LR2oEZwBsrfy1Nztg.text: I used to love coming to this place, so when my friends asked to hang out here I was more than happy to drive here. Parking has always been a pain, but it was way too packed yesterday. The security has become more strict, so bag searches were included in entering. Long waits at the bar for one drink, rude bartenders, dirty bathrooms, and just a bunch of drunkies being ignorant. This place has gone down.

aQ9rpl_zxLi8byyhSudfzw.text: I love the UFC nights and that the place is not packed and you can still find seats but at 12.95 for a ground beef burger with from frozen sides I can't give place more then 3 stars.  Good for seating, good for alcohol , not good for food.

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KLqemapA08YvdtZIJ4AVVA.text: My old stopping grounds!   I used to come here after WAKA games when it was Road Runner and really like that they opened the place up more. A full open courtyard with larger tables and more space to play flip cup, hang by the fire and they added grass.   We were seated at a booth a little bit further inside and were greeted right away by Marissa. She was a great server. We picked a couple beers off the extensive list, put in an order of food and people watched. She was friendly, knowledgeable, she kept the refills coming, got our order correct and cleared our plates all in a timely manner.  We loved the beer selection and the food was good too. We ordered the chicken and waffle sliders, a burger, the fried pickles, potato skins and the buffalo chicken fingers. The sliders were so good! Mini waffle sandwiches with crunchy fried chicken, bacon because of course all topped with as much syrup as your heart desires. The fried pickles were also tasty. Crunchy batter on dill wedges instead of chips. The food all came out promptly with several servers bringing it at once, which I really appreciated. We also ordered the chocolate chip cookie skillet because we didn't feel fat enough. It was delicious. Warm cookie, ice cream and whip cream on top. Get it.   The only negative, which is a pretty big one, is that I noticed when we sat down a small girl under the age of 6 sitting alone in the booth next to us coloring. Our server tried to track down who she belonged to and offered her a water and it turned out she belonged to a woman gambling and drinking AT THE BAR. this woman had left her small child unattended at a booth so she could drink and gamble across the way. Horrible parenting but shame on PKWY for allowing this to happen. This woman knew the hostess because she came over to "check on" her daughter and made small talk with the hostess once she saw her daughter was ok. I don't know if she was a family member, manager or just a patron of this place, but to me this was completely unacceptable and I felt terrible for the child. A manager should have noticed and stepped in and if they did know about it and allowed it to happen, that is against the law.

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chocolate chip cookie skillet. Do it.
Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The American burger.
Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle sliders. Yasss!

hgONB4kat6N_no1fXbmNhQ.text: I get it. PKWY Tavern has created an off the strip bar that could potentially cater to a younger crowd that would prefer a cool decor with outdoor activities which you might find in Downtown Las Vegas at The Gold Spike. Good concept - bad execution.   Kim was my server and she was great! She constantly checked in on my table, even for the remaining hour that I sat there not ordering more beer or food.   Beer: As my friend mark stated in a different review of the same establishment, "there is a lot of beer", just not good beer. I tried his Dogfish Head 90 minute which he insisted was no good, I agree that that's no 90 minute. It was malty and resembled the taste of any IPA that goes bad over time. I was excited to see that the season Grapefruit Sculpin from Ballast Point was on the beer menu, but unfortunately they ran out. Therefore, I opted for the regular Sculpin.   Food: The best thing on the menu is the buffalo wings. I ordered a burger and it was alright, but it's my opinion that it's too big. They could save some money by making this dish smaller. The worst item was the pulled pork nachos. I was surprised to see that they use fresh jalapenos for their nachos, but I was even more surprised when the dish was served with cold cheese and meat.   Extras: The menu is four one-sided pages clipped to a plastic board. If they are going to continue the sports theme, a few things need to happen. 1. Get rid of the clip boards 2. Make the menus one page and two sided (you can still achieve the "coach" look this way 3. Never, and I mean never print another marketing material or menu again that doesn't take up both sides of the paper.

bxZF1VHtk9qSTmBPIqNZIQ.text: Unique place! Hard to describe..indoor/outdoor patio with full bar. Interior nice bar, tables and booths. TV's everywhere including each booth..nice! Parking lot set up for outdoors events.  Went there for a quick business meeting at lunch. Very Mellow, not very busy..  Incredible Beer list, one of the best in Vegas. at least a couple hundred... Everything for everybody. Also have monthly craft beer list. Tried a Russian River..was great..hard to find in Vegas.  1/2 pints..perfect for a lunch while on the clock.  Ordered The Mos Sliders - excellent! food quantity is large.. Sweet potato tater tots very good!  Going to join their rewards club - sign up ..get a shirt, a phone  app, every 50 beers get a prize..200 hundred beers - dinner for 6..etc..etc.  way cool!

ehtGpkP19GZ-v4TPLJJNXA.text: This is a cook who works at one of your locations. I'm seriously disgusted that you guys would allow someone like this to work at your establishment. It's horrible enough as to what happened and now we have disgusting people like this taking advantage of the shooting.

TakFMDiFMFE7QZWh4gH2tw.text: Came here with a group of 8 for the football season kick off this past Thursday night. We didn't have a reservation (it was super busy because football) but they were able to push some tables together to make space for us immediately, right next to a few huge tv screens which was perfect for watching the game! They had some pretty good specials on beer for the football games, although their food specials were lacking. We ordered almost everything off the food specials menu and nothing really stood out, plus the portions were really really small (for bar food). Overall a great experience, just wish the food was better.

IauddQu4YCQGym2UsWFZHw.text: They had one waitress serving the entire outdoor area during the GKs Winnepeg game 5. She handled herself well considering the amount of tables she had but it's a shame her management didn't recognize she would need help on such a busy and hot day. It took an hour to order food and another hour and 15 to actually get out good, only to be missing an entire entree which they actually charged us for. We also asked them to open a large umbrella which they agreed to then never did. Management needs to better understand business demands on peak days.

o79-rt7x97h9kkiyFPMZzA.text: I'll give this restaurant two stars because the food was good.   The service, however, was awful. It took forever for our waitress to bring us our drinks, our food, and the check. I wanted the s'mores pie for dessert to go, but I was told that they could not take it to go so I had to order something else. It was also loud, so it was nearly impossible to hear what our waitress was saying.

KXP0reeWqk0Q4hF52yXqIw.text: Nice sports bar to hang out at. They have a huge selection of beers, and the food is tasty, with some trendy unconventional options. Some of the booths have personal tvs, so you can switch it to whatever game or fight you're interested in.  They have pool tables,  a little bowling alley,  cornhole, and a giant jenga to play with too.

Q59Ggplr_IjXO2LaDzf0aA.text: Came out here two days ago to celebrate a friend's birthday.   How to describe the atmosphere....It's very much a sports bar. TVs and loud jocks everywhere mixed with a bunch of people on first dates.   The food and bowling were the best part about this place in my opinion. Many different beers to choose from.   The only reason I rate it 3 stars is because the service takes forever. I had to flag down our waitress 3 times to order food and drinks.

QEpGgG7JVhe6k310mFF8tg.text: I am writing this review due to a recent event that took place on a Saturday evening. My sister went out with her company to celebrate and they held a private section for their party. My brother, her husband, and I later came to help celebrate her promotion she recently received. My sister already had a few drinks in by the time we got there and we just received our drinks and food. A few minutes in her coworker brought her to our table  and sat for a bit when unfortunately she threw up a little at the table. Her coworker took her to the restroom while the rest of us cleaned up the mess she left, it wasn't a huge mess so a few napkins cleaned up most of it. After she took care of business in the restroom her husband and coworker took her out to the car while my brother and I tried to finish the rest of our food (albeit less than half was eaten).   One of the waitresses came by and asked if we were doing okay and noticed the pile of napkins. We tried to let her know what happened before she picked any of it up and she immediately looked disgusted and walked away. A few minutes later she came back passive aggressively giving us our check when we didn't even ask for it, dropped it off and left without saying anything whatsoever. I apologize now that it was irresponsible what ended up happening on my parties end, but the reaction we receive was downright disrespectful and bullshit. After what happened we didn't even want to finish our food or our drinks, we just paid the bill and left. I am disappointed at the service we received and really hope something will actually be done about this.  Just wanted to come out for a good time. Don't need any bad vibes. If you're gonna have an attitude leave that shit at home not in the "professional" scene. I cannot recommend this location to any friends or family looking to have a good time.

z502F6hM2roOt27dUH6yWA.text: I wasn't going to Yelp this place, but kept running into the pictures I took of the awful food.  My daughter ordered the Pizza (Al Pastor), I ordered a salad (dressing on the side), and my husband ordered a burger.  My daughter's pizza was inedible (pictures posted) because the meat was ALL FAT.  My salad came with tons of ranch dressing on it instead of the side, and my husband's burger was just okay.  The worst part was the waitress taking care of us was training someone and when we showed her the pizza she just looked at it and shrugged and gave a limp, "Sorry". She then had the girl she was training come back to take the plates with food that obviously had not been eaten a bit later.  We thought maybe they were just comping the pizza at least, but nope.  In the meantime the waitress who was training was goofing off with other employees and customers her age instead of coming back to fill our empty drinks that sat there for 15 minutes.    The place is fun for game day with lots to do, but don't order their food.  It's expensive and lousy.. Just go for the drinks and games if you go and eat beforehand.  Yuck  (My daughter read my review and reminded me they gave us a side of celery, carrots, and ranch dressing and we thought it was just part of the meal and found out we were charged $2.99 for it.  I told the waitress we didn't order that, but ate some not knowing it wasn't just part of the meal, and she still charged us for that too.)

wSvD6JRYgaZJ-IMrQb3ssQ.text: Just walked out. Walked in for lunch and to watch the game. Sat there for 15 minutes with no service. I went to the hostess and asked for a server. It took them another 10 minutes before she showed up. By that time we had decided to leave. During this time a number of servers were just standing around talking. This is the second time we had bad service. Never going back.

upmdpAOuaPU0skNAu_Alpw.text: This is a nice bar. The reason I am giving a one star rating is because of the following reason. I put $20 in a poker machine, bartender comped me my first beer. I hit four 7s right a way. I asked for a second beer, and I was amazed that she charged me for it. I didn't say anything until I lost all my money, I asked her why she is charging me for the beer when I was gambling. Her excuse was because I only gambled $20, I explained to her that I hit a 4 of a kind and lost it all. She said that it didn't matter??? I bartender for 13 years and never heard of this new rule. Never coming back.

H1JufDU0yU4kMAw_4nuCHQ.text: Worst experience in Vegas of my life!! Security called  "Terrance"denied my LEGAL ID because he, for whatever personal reasons didn't feel comfortable to even scan my I.D! I know I look young but I feel COMPLETELY discriminated against for not even taking the time to scan my Id ??!!!!!!! Paid for transportation there for no reason! Screw this place! Terrance, AND their white husky manager w glasses! They have no idea what they're doing!

3ZMzGcPYwSo7Laltm74phA.text: I would come here for years but lately it's not my cup of tea. The bartenders aren't really friendly and the management isn't much more hospitable than they are. I'd rather go to SG.

7kbHvMKyH2BkS0-KRyQi6A.text: The size of their sign sure matches the size of the bar. It's HUGE. With an indoor/outdoor (covered so it's bearable in the winter) section, there's never a lack of space. Want to run into those HS classmates you never wanted to see again? Come to PKWY. Want to run into your UPS driver? Come to PKWY. Want to run into your old HS english teacher? Come to PKWY. Want to run into a bunch of barely 21 UNLV kiddos? Come to PKWY. It really is a locals bar.  There is a huge selection of beer, dirt parking and games (beer pong, etc).There are 3 different ciders on tap (I'm usually stuck with one choice!) Stick to drinks instead of their food. There is video poker at the indoor bar.

RybRKw3Qx3e509dr4Fa4iw.text: I've always loved the nachos here. Tonight was the worst service I have ever received there. So my sister and I went in craving the nachos. We literally go there just for the nachos. Out of respect for the bar we got beers then told the server that we love the nachos here & were only here for the nachos. 45 minutes later the server still didn't stop to check on us and we saw four other tables receive their food before us. We had to wave down a busser to call our server over. She was standing at the podium and enjoying the music rather than checking on us. She came over to us a little later and said "I'm so sorry they're making the chips fresh".... I said "what do you mean you could have at least come to check on us it's been over 40 minutes" she replied "it not my fault". We paid for our 2 beers ($20) and left. They could have at least comped a beer off. I didn't even drink it all. We were so hungry by the time, we just couldn't wait any longer. On top of that it's Memorial Day, and you would think it was busy not no! I would understand if it was busy. But proper steps of service would go back and check on your table, check with the kitchen if the food is taking too long and never say it's not my fault, yes it's not your fault but there are ways to soften a hangry customer, offer some snacks something anything, a quick check in would have gone a long way!!!! The parking lot was empty and still the kitchen and server couldn't get their act together.  I've been on my feet all day with very little to eat and on top of that I was behind a bar as well, I know the feeling of pressure, girl u were not busy or under pressure at all, compared to the crap I go through. Learn some service etiquette and don't be so lazy.

2fJXDxgyzw87A8Yi9nTIsw.text: This bar is HUGE and offers entertainment in the way of a small bowling area, pool table area, and outside over sized games. The down side is it takes for ever to get a drink and its swarming with college kids all the time. They have lots of seating options and I love to come here to watch sports games with my friends but again it's always packed....also get to know your bartenders bc if u chat it up and become their friend they will serve you first. You dont know how many frustrating nights I was waiting to get a drink only to have a regular come up and be served before me, UGH! I personally prefer the parkway in Tivoli it attracts a different audience however it is smaller though.

B-9PUMm2WXBRuV0sNGFagw.text: Wow! I am amazed by this place. David the GM and his staff were amazing. I commend their great service and the taste of their food. This place is any persons bar. You have games to play and great drinks to have. When you come here ask for Mary she us a wonderful server. She made our day and had the greatest service. I am grateful for this place

IcUZpUG8WoSnYd1Ac7GoJw.text: Not impressed! My spring salad with chicken was missing my crumbed blue cheese and strawberries were borderline rotten. My wife's chicken wings that she asked for well well well done and crispy came out barely with a crust and gooey in the middle. We try to support local businesses in town and haven't been to this bar in quite a while but checking it off on our list of options.

FXADVVOIdcy_L6FlRltIYg.text: Came back here to see if the service improved, or the food got better -  It was pretty much the same, I guess the reviews here did not catch the owners attention.  I will say I went to SG, which is about 200 yards down Flamingo, and they were packed, and their food and service was better. If I was the owners or the franchise POC here at Parkway, I would take a look at the reviews....

hIcSTZXBx-tYDv19GiraJQ.text: The servers are plain rude and disrespectful on all levels. I do not know who does the interviews for the folk they hire but that individual needs to look into a different field of work, since he/she cant seem to judge caracter or do a firm background check. The servers always have an attitude, as if you're there to be their friend. I been here numerous  times and only 2 times have I had amazing service, but those servers are not there anymore  I have a feeling since they are all young women and deal with mainly a younger crowd they think that it's ok to be rude to all customers. Well the server staff word get out quick on the internet and if you keep it up, not only will your consumers stop coming in so to not so good reviews but also the ones that do will already know you suck at your jobs. So that will decline in you making your money.  I do however apologize to the bartending staff since they are always kind and at times hilarious. Since the place has opened I have never encountered a negative attitude bartender.  The ball in your court management.

roaCIpsH7YrI6UPZOoM3rA.text: I really like the venue because it's so laid back and there's so much room for a large group. The vibe is really fun too. There's always something going on to stimulate you. They have a live band on Tuesday nights.  For their happy hour, they have selected beers for $3.   They have hundreds of choices of beers which I love. I was so glad to know that they have Rogue dead guy which is one of my favorites!  I got their mozz burger. Honestly, it was so basic. I didn't find anything special to it. I could have eaten the mozzarella on its own and placed another type of cheese. The pesto on it was okay - couldn't really taste it. I got it medium rare but it was fully cooked. I didn't even bother to tell the server since I hardly saw her.  I would come here again with a group of friends just to hang out and play games - they have games in their patio area. I would grab a few drinks but I don't think I'd order food here.

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozz burger

ZrkN7V-gO-0g1bQqDVErIg.text: Came here last night and surprisingly it wasn't super busy. We had a big party so we grabbed a table inside and ordered food and drinks. One of our friends noticed they offered military discount for memorial day weekend which was cool.   I tried their strawberry beer since one of my friends said she was having one and I've never tried it before. It was pretty good but I didn't even know that it was $13 for one pint! That threw me off when we got the bill in the end.   Our server seemed super frustrated with us at first which was weird because it wasn't super packed. She rolled her eyes at us when she had to come back because we didn't know what we wanted to drink. The menu was pretty extensive and everyone was a bit overwhelmed looking at the different selections. She kept saying she was the only one on the floor and kinda rushed us into getting our drinks so she could move onto the next table. I didn't really appreciate how she rolled her eyes and expected us to know right away what we all wanted since some people came a little later than others.   The next time we plan on coming I hope the service is better and we won't be rushed into ordering our drinks and food.

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BLKhJjnyiQxLj3HIfS4lIQ.text: As the name of the establishment so clearly states it is a Tavern first and foremost and secondly it is a PKWY tavern. Yes a Parkway Tavern, as in, not a fine dining establishment or even a bar and grill much less anything upscale. Their claim to fame and unique value proposition is that it serves 250 beers. OK so I haven't verified the claim myself but they do have a "shipload" of beers.  (I'm on beer 16... I think...I know Amanda has been telling me to log them) I've had a different one every time. Amanda is doing a great job BTW always prompt service on top of everything. The space has an open and airy feel which seems very well lit. I found plenty of seating space, every Friday night, inside or outside on the patio even during VGK games. It draws a good crowd mostly younger people looking to get a buzzin good time to get the weekend started. Food is very good for a tavern style food. I mean I didn't have a bad bite, and I've ordered and eaten everything off their happy hour Menu. Then again I'm not expecting "cleaver steakhouse" level steak tartare or "IL Mulino" branzino. All these characters posting 1 star or 2 star reviews commenting on the size of burgers or the dryness of pork in their slider...get over yourselves and order another beer with that burger so it goes down easier! While you're at it realize you're in a tavern eating tavern food and drinking beer, not experiencing a fine dining haute cuisine experience. It's hands down a 5 star tavern establishment with 250 beers.

HNOuY-oELLaA5e0FR7Mfrw.text: My friends and I stopped in here for dinner after running a marathon that took place on the I-215 West Beltway Trail just right behind the tavern. It was a nice spot to celebrate an accomplishment and recover with food and drinks. They had plenty of TV screens, so it looked to be a good spot to catch a game. However the Superbowl was next weekend and baseball season hasn't start yet, so there wasn't much on. I ordered an Arnold Palmer and their Hero Burger.  *Arnold Palmer* This has been my go-to drink since quitting alcohol. I like lemonade and I like iced tea, so might as well have both at the same time!  *Hero Burger* The only thing that made it a "hero" was that it was served on a toasted hoagie roll instead of the traditional burger buns. Otherwise it was a pretty standard burger. It came with a choice of side and I went with tater tots! I can never say no to tater tots!  The service was nice, quick, and friendly. We were a pretty big group and she did a great job making sure we had everything we needed.  Overall with decent food and good service, I wouldn't hesitate to come back here again. Even though I don't drink alcohol anymore, I did see some of my old favorites (e.g. Left Hand Milk Stout Nitro, Rogue Hazelnut Brown Nectar, Ballast Point Sculpin IPA) on their tap list. They had a very decent selection of beers available.

Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hero Burger with tater tots

92SirLk5LQe7rO1bn-3WYA.text: Im sorry but this is not a pizza I dont even know how to call this monstrosity  Just got a lil sick when i got it. Vibe is good nd drinks Are cool But common try better on food

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AgW7mKy5Pgv6pkRvJ_0zoA.text: First and last visit. Service was decent especially considering how busy it was, food was nothing special, mediocre, small portions and drinks overpriced(6.00 for a bottle of bud) it's like Airport security at the door with a search. The age demographic is 20's to early 30's, much like a nightclub-type establishment atmosphere.  If your 25 and have low expectations on food and lots of money for alcohol? Then this is your place!

ZSdRJ5xanIB1N1MiWtZ5Xg.text: Well, I was happy until the waitress never brought back my change. I was going to tip her but she decided to tip herself without letting me know. So be careful if you do come here, make sure you get your change back. Found it very rude that she decided to just keep my change. I'm lucky it was only $5. Can't imagine what would have happened if I would have paid with a $100 instead of a $20. I'll still be back but I'll order from the bartender not a waitress.

QclJ5g8jCig475NDeCUR4A.text: Amanda and Cameron gave my group the best customer service we've ever experienced here. Both are so nice and attentive. We really appreciated it!

sHokYsN0qm8RWzxaIBCBLg.text: This place is a rip off. It smells putrid like sour ass beer right by the bar. Ordered an angry ball shot and was given the whole beer. It wasn't poured in front of me so I don't even know if it has fireball in it. I don't know about you, but in this town I really don't trust things unless it's right in front of me so I know what's going in my drink. Pretty shitty service. A waste of working 1.5 hours to spend on this place.

Pybl-w3vPF-_Ne0X12DxCw.text: PKWY Tavern has evolved from Roadrunner to cater to the college crowd. It's essentially the Gold Spike of the west side. There's corn hole, beer pong, darts, billiards, giant jenga and connect four, and even a miniature bowling alley. However, their main selling point is 250+ beers to choose from which I LOVE! I've had the opportunity to order food and can say everything I've ordered is quality considering it's mainly bar food. But the downside to such an awesome place..  It was only a matter of time before pkwy tavern got too popular for its own good. Thinking about coming here on a weekend? Forget about enjoying yourself. If you enjoy muscling your way to the front of the bar to order a drink then having no where to stand, then come on a Friday or Saturday night. Being a college friendly bar, I've seen too many examples of customers who should've been cut off from the bar a long time ago.  There's nothing like PKWY Tavern on this side of town, and the beer selection is unmatched. I like this place, but it's hard to enjoy myself when there's literally no room for your own personal space. I almost wouldn't mind if they started charging a cover on the weekends.

Edv35NqjNLBX3XI422SEnw.text: Went here for happy hour on a Friday and even though it was nice out and not too hot there were a lot of flies in their patio area.   It was actually annoying.  Once the sun went down though they disappeared.  Not sure why they seem to be more prominent here.  We've been to Sedona next door, sat on their patio and there wasn't a fly in site.    They have great drink and food specials.  I love the giant Jenga too.  We didn't play, but it was fun watching two ladies go at it, as it towered over them.  This place is pretty popular.  By the time we left the place was packed.

oG30AyahPpBeksor8bpWvg.text: Starting with the staff, I found them to be very friendly and very nice. They were thankful that we were there and did everything they could to accommodate us and a rather large group.  This is a very hard-working staff as they go out of their way to ensure that you are being served properly and are happy.   The food is tasty, although it is probably bad for you, but that's OK because what are you expecting anyway.  I recommend the chicken fingers they are good, I also recommend the nachos, those were pretty yummy as well.   If you are there for beers you will probably be OK with the selection they have. However if you are there for well drinks Move on, find another place. Their drinks are watered down. Although the prices seem to be OK on those well drinks, the reality is that you're not getting much of a punch out of them.  And while their food and craft beer selection is pretty good, this was such a disappointing aspect of this place I was really hoping for something a little better on those well drinks.   I gave them two stars because of their service and because of their pretty decently tasting food. However I had a big issue with their well drinks.

KHLdjLW71KcagUeAGkOsDg.text: Food was decent but this spot is better for sports and drinking. What a difference from the old Roadrunner! I had the basic breakfast. Eggs over medium, sausage patties, tots and Texas toast. Nothing outstanding but simple fare. Definitely could use an upgrade on the coffee as well.   Ok, that being said, staff was super friendly and I can't beat the views for football.

Hq4hZd4HRRz3bS0SfvnC2w.text: Fantastic beer selection! If you are coming to sit at the bar and enjoy the beer variety, it will be a great experience. If you are expecting, at the very least,  decent food and service, you will be sorely disappointed.  Our poor waitress forgot which beers we ordered twice, had to send my nachos back once and brought full pints for my wife when she continued to order 1/2 pints.  This was our first time here and we would not be compelled to come back as there are other bars closer to home that operate "better" as a bar.  To top it all off, it appears payroll checks were being handed out during service. Is that normal? I would hope not as it is unprofessional to me (do it in the back, behind the scenes).  Overall, it seems like just another bar with a huge selection of beer choices.

Wto4qqLAj_6Q0H7JV8pI2Q.text: I continually try to goto this bar time after time and get terrible service 9 times out of 10, the patio is awesome the beer selection is great if they actually had any of the beers listed.  The food is awful, just bad food.  I ordered chicken skewers and it was about 4 oz of chicken with hot sauce on it for 14 dollars, my friend ordered a chicken quesadilla which was made with pre packaged shredded chicken.  The concept is great but it seems like half of the wait staff is dis sheveled loooking with terrible uniforms.  We will be seeing you on bar rescue!

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. this is supposed to be &#34;chicken skewers&#34;  Disgusting!

pHQVDnwAX9ng97G55TdXPw.text: Me and my girlfriend went to go eat there for lunch on a Wednesday. We sat down in the bar area. There was maybe 10 customers in the whole place. For about 7 to 10 min no one said hi, or anything. They made eye contact and would walk right by you. Just poor customer service. I could understand if it was busy but it was a ghost town and I could see the workers on there phone.

ZEXcJjCSzzCM4EgjORwpiw.text: The atmosphere is nice but the service is awful. Waited 20 mins to just get a drink order. After ordering drinks we had to go and ask for the waitress to come back to order food after  waiting another 20 mins.  We have come twice and the service unfortunately has been the same both times.

rAdpKA_FxwmsjIma3VfYXQ.text: Before I start, I want to be clear: Beer = 5 star, Food = 3 (at best).   This review is about the food.   Sat down and ordered beers, nachos with pulled pork and a West Coast flatbread. Flavors were great...when they finally arrived. Food came almost 50 minutes after we ordered. Wouldn't mind that much, except they weren't that busy, and I watched someone else sit, order the same thing and be served before I ever saw my food.   The chicken on the flatbread was getting cold, and the nachos were room temp. To make the nachos worse, they were dry as hell, since the cheese was cooked to a crisp and they had been sitting out.   I love the ambiance, beer and general service. Probably won't eat anytime soon.

m9B4z9RkiaZUuzeiRcysqg.text: have been to parkway many many times both when it was road runner and since it has been parkway.  tonight's experience was ridiculous.  we arrived at about 500 to watch the cowgirls and rams on tv.  it was not unusually crowded when we got there.  no hostess, no menus, we sat ourselves and got our own menus.  finally ordered drinks and ONE appetizer and food.  tried to order tastes of 2 beers and the waiter did not understand and brought 2 pint beers.  waited 1.5 hours with no food.  all of the other surrounding tables received their food and drinks and desserts and received nothing - not even the appetizer.  2 tables sat down an hour after us and were served promptly.  WTF?  finally after stopping every server and person who walked by we were informed by manager that this would be taken care of.  not sure what was being taken care of.  finally after almost 2 hours we were served the one appetizer (fired mozzerella) without marinara.  no silverware, no set up on the table. the food came shortly after, no salt or pepper on the table.  ordered a second round of drinks on the house and because VGK won were given shots.  we told we've have ""this taken care of"  still dont know what that meant.  ordered a dessert which was ok.  the food was ok.  the service SUCKED.  probably would never go here again on a busy sports day.  there are other places which actually serve food and have better service.

RvpgMv-U88TZYgIbafPQkw.text: Those two stars are for their pizza. Its the only salvation of our lunch trip. We went there around 11.30 am which was pretty empty. Took the waiter 10 minutes to got my root beer float. We ordered pizza, which was good. A cheeseburger sliders, which was OK. Its hard to messed up sliders. And raffle chicken sliders, which took 40 minutes to came and the chicken was way overcooked its almost burn. I didn't finished it. I don't think we are coming back.

duOSJj2Iv9f6SjuPyfJ80w.text: The establishment centers it's hype around having 250 types of beer. Either 100 on tap and 150 bottled beers or vice versa.  This used to be The Roadrunner Cowboy location. Much of the decor has been upgraded and changed out. There are some reminders of the old bar such as the RR is still used as door handles and other small things. The men's urinals are defiantly one creative addition. Right when you walk in there is a sign posted that states no smoking and yep as you guessed it, it didn't stop anyone from smoking, the dining area is separated from the bar area by a half wall and some beams so the smoke cruises right into the food area. They sport a lot of TV's for various sporting events. Glass style garage doors allow for air to flow through the premise to an atrium style are where one might toss some corn-holes around.  At 7:30pm The crowd was very light but had a wide age range mix, 20's all the way up to mid 60's plus. Heard two elderly gentlemen in their mid sixties actually complain because there weren't enough women and actually asked if there's a ladies night...I feel bad for you 20-40 something women these two sharks are on the prowl.  The reason it's receiving 2 stars today is they only had about 20 beers on tap. If your establishment centers around a product or type of product you dang well better deliver day one when you open. Could you imagine Disneyland opening up and only offering balloons and food and wild toads magic ride, no Mattahorn, Space or thunder Mountain? The bar definitely is now set up for over 100 drafts. So when we asked two employees when the draft/250 beers is going to be available they both said they had no idea, in fact they seemed irritated like they were tired of people asking. The beer selection was mediocre their one wheat beer was blue moon and they had one IPA.  I will not be back until it's confirmed they have all the other brews available. Once this happens then it will give other establishments that offer a lot of different types a beer ( Aces&Ales/ Yardhouse) a run for its money. I will also most likely change my rating of this place once they are actually open.

ppPBW0HMw32dyh13LbURqg.text: What a horrible frat house!! This place is run by  Neanderthals! It's ridiculous how the bouncers talk to women. This place needs more female staff because the idiots who are now working there don't understand anything. I should have called the cops on these assholes. I will not return ever.

76Uy6C43Rvj9O1VY9IGbjA.text: Dirty Bathrooms Cool bar, it's nice that they have games but don't get to drunk because sanitation is the Achilles heel of this establishment. No toilet seat covers and sinks that didn't have soap when I used it. I hope they get their cleanliness on because this could be a cool spot if it wasn't so dirty. They have games, best of which, bowling is always out of order.

JWBKBsdHrLCyKXp4LV5Iuw.text: Trashy. Food greasy. Snotty people. If you can't afford uber to go somewhere else and/or want to listen to hip hop ONLY this is your place. (Correction, they played Justin Bieber too) Two fights in an hour.

tL0pUGjW9Zzea3i0A_Inyw.text: My husband & I love this place! We also might likely have ADD, so what a great environment!  We live the flashbacks to our childhoods with the 80s board games, lifesize Jenga & other games.   The one thing is that the waitresses need to step up their game. They, and the entire restaurant, would make more money if they were more attentive.   But, other than that, I tell everyone to go there!

HudiEY3a3jOTCjFWQRsHrA.text: The good: Our server Kim was awesome. She was friendly, and super helpful since it was our first time. The wings were quality - although out of the 20 wings we ordered, we only got 2 drums. (Not the end of the world)   The bad: PKWY advertises 250 beers and has a beer club that rewards customers for drinking lots of different beers. However, for a self-described beer bar, the selection was big. Just big - not great. Most of the beers offered are available at stores in Las Vegas -- for obviously far less money.  The ugly: The Dogfish Head 90-minute pint I ordered tasted awful - either bad lines (which would be strange for a new place) or old beer (also strange for a new place), not sure which. Sent it back. First server (before awesome Kim) seemed confused by the menu, and not helpful. His shift was ending - which turned out to be good for both of us.  Ordered nachos with pulled pork. Both the pulled pork and cheese sauce were ice cold when the nachos arrived. Sent them back. Burgers were just okay, served on a very large, dry bulkie roll.   Owner was floating around flirting with female guests and staff. I never once saw him check on any other guests. I walked in/out three times, and host never acknowledged that I was there.  Won't go back. Sorry Kim.

Saef0YY_Fe66muIJ7tefVg.text: Four of us went to happy hour and had a really great experience. Christina was our server and she was awesome. We never had an empty beer or water glass, our food was brought out quickly, and she was very friendly and funny.   The jalapeno poppers were delicious! We also had the chicken fingers and the sliders which were good. The chili con queso is awful. It is basically ground up chili with no cheese flavor whatsoever.   The reason this is not a five star review is because there was a booth with four women next to us and all four of them lit up cigarettes at the same time. I wish they wouldn't allow smoking where the food is.

EYN5TV0dCOOC1s7xpGjuRg.text: Horrible service and ok food. I have been in restaurant and company w me was dressed in management clothes for a restaurant and NO refills unless sat for 30 min and had to ask...$80 tab for this will never return! Too many options in Vegas to have attitude and no service!

hWe_mygkXVtPAnMGP42u3Q.text: This is just your upgraded typical local bar. I really liked the fact that they have a long happy hour, 4 PM to 7 PM discounts on drinks and half off appetizers. But the best thing is the fact that they carry a large selection of beers, 250 to be exact.  The atmosphere is pretty laid back. They have an outside patio with games like beer pong, jenga and bags.  Food wise you will find normal bar food. There was nothing extraordinary except for the loaded fries! You can never go wrong with that!  I'm glad to finally see a cool bar in the summerlin area. Good prices and good atmosphere.
