Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firecracker Shrimp

Dw8NyOIvDJIhQqGmPR8uHQ.text: Great food great service great entertainment. I really recommend this  place. Want to have a good time, chill with friends, this is the spot and if you like sports this is the spot also.

iL1rJ-W573MHJQDFK45w8A.text: Toto, we aren't in Downtown Las Vegas anymore! PKWY Tavern reminds me of Gold Spike. I dub it, "Gold Spike on the West." You step foot in here and it's like whoa, we aren't in DTLV but it sure does have a Gold Spikey vibe to it.   I love Gold Spike so that certainly is not a bad thing.  Nonetheless, I like PKWY Tavern for two main reasons:  1) It's on the West side :) Ergo, it's more local and closer to my house. 2) BEER -- SO MUCH BEER. MUCH. SELECTION.  You can find this located off of 215 and Flamingo next to the LVAC. You can actually see the building as you drive by the freeway, so you really can't miss it.   Its ambience is just like Gold Spike -- casual, fun, quirky, relaxed. Tons of things to keep you busy here including games like jenga and bowling. It has a younger crowd/vibe going on to keep it lively.  This place advertises its 250+ selection of beers. Talk about "all you can drink." If you ARE on this side of town and like to frequent bars, I recommend joining their loyalty program. They have rewards for customers that drink x amount of different kinds of beer! And yes, I do mean you can get things like t-shirts and mugs, but I was told that you can get your own personalized party if you are that hardcore!  Their selection of beers means that there is one for EVERY single person. I like beer, but I LOVE cider. With that said, all you cider lovers should get the raspberry cider! I can't get enough of it.  Besides all that, service here was kind of slow and the bartenders on the inside seemed like they didn't want to be there. Regardless, I did have a great time with my friends here and will be coming back! You just need to bring your patience as the service always seems to be a little on the slow side.

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mos sliders

RQYHzQQKapJIBrDz4gVgpQ.text: The WTF fries are the business! Such a cool atmosphere for knights games and great food!

vhDLOh6bzp4TWpU_ZbLmag.text: Food was great! What you'd hope from comfort, bar food! The portion size was great and same for the beer selection, as they carry sours! Try the giant pretzel! It's giant. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pmCFap-x7_g89lTNo_T-Fg.text: This place is great. All the beers and munchies we require and a great bill at the end. (Medical professionals receive 30% off) this place is a must. Great vibes.

yuVZUf-2G7EQBtOu2eX4-w.text: This place is so fuuuuun! It's like a Gold Spike but on the West siiiiiiide. It has Jenga and Corn Hole, etc.  LOTS of TV's and many BIG screens. Could be awesome for watching games.  Outside area is pretty spacious as well with it's own bar.  Awesome bartenders.  Huge beer selection if you're into that.  And a decent food menu.  I'm a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u8zkAQrFQJ5CPtZj1ktX1Q.text: Fun vibe and place to meet up with friends old and new! The atmosphere is what I really like about this place. It is not overly formal like a sit down place. Its really just a chill place that people can go who don't drink can go and not feel awkward and still have fun with all of the games and activities that are available. Don't expect crazy creative cocktails or flame throwing bar tenders but do expect a pretty decent beer selection and a variety of other food and drinks that will keep everyone happy.   Pro tip:  Make sure and check the happy hour specials before you go.

SxhpMeyJ_PB3CLqx4NZYKA.text: This place is super fun! The bartenders are fast fast fast! We sat outside and had great service. I'm not sure why people are so crazy on here. We've always had a great time.

uRW8oNzSXHp8aRoR-r3byg.text: Yep, the service is awful.  10 minutes to get a server to take your order.  15 later minutes to get your drink.  20 minutes to get your water.  But the happy hour (Mon-Fri 4-7pm) is bumping and at $3 for a house wine, well drink or garbage domestic beer,  I have few complaints. Order 2-3 drinks at a time and they will accommodate you.  The food is a great accompaniment to getting drunk because it is loaded with carbs but not too greasy. Happy Hour highlights are the corn fritters (do not miss these), and the cheese sticks. Get a booth cause you will be waiting for a while, but what you actually get is a very good value for the money.

KDvkQ59kkdvmIhSNDBgFIw.text: Went there on sat around 930. Place was great . Only thing Is the service was terrible. Rude bartenders at the outside bar. Inside was not much better . Played for 20 min at a machine before I was asked if I wanted a drink.

E92myjlPRhSnqvzDArRYcg.text: What a fun place dropped in for 20 minutes had a couple of beers and put 20 bucks in the slot machine and ended up leaving with $1000. That's not the real reason I like the place they really have fun bartenders and it's a cool atmosphere

0dmb530bFjrurg3YPc5iyg.text: I always hear about this bar it's not to far from me and i was disappointed a bit. The food was good and drinks were good but the customer service really sucked. She was unhelpful and awkward. And every time we would try to call her to order drinks she was always looking the opposite of our direction as if she was avoiding us. She didn't make us feel comfortable unfortunately.

7HeAI8hgVAKmwWpUYrP3VA.text: This is a good place to watch UFC. They have it playing everywhere, and they only make you order $25 per person in food or beer. That's a great deal, in my opinion.   The place is huge and open. And it's usually packed full of people. So get there early if you're wanting good seats.   If you're not coming here for UFC or some other event, there are games to play and just good seating to come with a group to chill.   The service was good and they also have a huge selection of beers on tap, in a can or in the bottle. But their tap selection was impressive.   The only reason why I gave it 3 stars: Their food. It's pretty meh. It's your typical bar food. Which I suppose is to be expected. And if that's what you're looking for, that's great. If not, you're going to pay for some cheap ingredient food that's probably better tasting when you're drunk. There are some awesome bars in Vegas with great food and drinks.  The Cuban was okay. They hardly had any pork on it, and the ham tasted like pre-packaged deli meat. It was cold as well. The wings were very overcooked and too crispy.   Overall, we'll be back for sporting events, I'm sure.

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuban. Merh. A lot of grocery store ham on that sammich...

jVYqq-wn_UW6hhULZ583Yw.text: Was kicked out for another table throwing coasters at my table. Security came up and said I threw food even though my back was turned away from said table. Everyone around me said it was another table. I was at the restaurant for 2+  hours keeping to my self. When I asked to review CCTV security said there was no need to. When I asked if they even had CCTV they said Jonathan Fine owns this place of course there is. I was asked to leave for becoming "hostile". When I was escorted out security said someone had to be blamed and gave me a card for the operations manager Kelly Gray and said they would buy me drinks and dinner on my next visit. Security has no training. Will blame anyone to make them seem as if they are doing something.  BBB will be notified and will update with outcome. Stay away from this establishment.

Ctt73U1Lb0c6ldD8HduVHA.text: Just came back from my first 21+ Vegas trip and was really glad to stumble upon PKWY Tavern! The indoor bar area was spacious and the outdoor patio was cutely lit. It was a super fun sports bar to check out and they had a wide selection of games. My friends and I played the jumbo jenga and beer pong (ask the servers inside for cups and balls!) Bless these types of bars with games because they make getting drunk 10x more fun. My friends and I ordered beers and various appetizers to share. They have a wide selection of beers and their appetizers were quite tasty. We shared the mini corndogs, beer poached wings with buffalo sauce, and fries. Perfect drunchies!  Overall, I really enjoyed the relaxed and fun vibe of PKWY Tavern. It was a really great alternative to hanging out on the crowded/noisy strip, and a lot cheaper too!

mPjNyC9fhuwcskDq35YXxA.text: The food was good. But the service was horrible. My friend and I sat here waiting for our checks for 20 minutes.

Mq-PGuTh552W6oz6BzT60w.text: Why did this place become so understaffed? It takes forever to get taken care of here no matter what part of Parkway you're at. Also, the women's restroom is always horrible. What happened Parkway?!

6T9767cHTMrEmE8nvcXsJA.text: It was a great night until we had to speak to the bouncer at the door who belittled and and downgraded your own staff. It's pretty sad to see an employee feel that he is more important than a hostess or waitress. Shame on him. It's awful for one employee to ruin an entire evening of fun on your way out the door. After this I will question coming back. Especially if I have to see his face and feel uncomfortable coming back.

vtqoJ9kqmsYBHv1sYOa-cQ.text: The bar is a lot of fun simply because it's so packed every night and has a great clientele. But, the bar really is nothing special. Carly Rae Jepsen is played on repeat and the bartenders are kind of lame. I'll definitely go back, I had a good time, I just wish there were better places to go in that area of Vegas!

bCy5GzQFsYapRGP2u1hpoQ.text: I'M NOT NORMALLY THE PERSON WHO SAYS DON'T READ THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS, BUT DON'T read the negative reviews. This place is so unique, delicious, and entertaining. The food selection is expansive and nothing is less than tasty, the drink list is infinite, and the games are so much fun.   Hatersgonnahate (erroneously)

zq3rrqLDXgrXdiAOvZ0KVg.text: I have been to this place a few times every time the service is so so. Takes forever to get a drink. They push their app pretty hard. Bouncers are power Hungary and I believe alittle racist. I was targeted a few times for no reason. This could be a great chill local spot, but with the service there i wouldn't be back. I had a large group there and many people had an issue with the service.

whi7qh_-fNFV9Z4fiRavbA.text: This is a great bar and restaurant and such a fun place to go to watch a sporting event or hang with friends.   We like to go sit in the Mark Fine red room for UNLV rebel games.   I love the app and all the technology they've incorporated into the business and I think PKWY is awesome and the owner is a genius.

MEvoj5RCzTu1CNzoZhGo_g.text: Absolute sht customer service. Rude btch waitresses and unless you have a pair of tits forget about getting a drink at the bar outside. F this place. Go here if you want to feel like being ignored and to be treated like you're a ghost. Stupid azz bar, I'll never return.

gkS5XMNlEdDYca1GFqGmPw.text: This is a cool place for the younger crowd and sports fans. TVs everywhere to watch a multitude of sports. I love the fact that they have games to play (e.g. huge Connect Four, Beer Pong, bowling, pool, etc...)  The food is great and reasonably priced. I'm a huge fan of the Firecracker Shrimp which is less than $7. I keep reading these reviews about the security and I must say, it's all wrong from my personal experience there. Yes, they seem very serious but what people fail to realize, they're there to protect the guests. I have seen them kick people out but it was definitely warranted. When people get drunk, they tend to grow a set and get out of hand sometimes. It doesn't matter what race someone is, I see them treat everyone equally. My friends that go there said the security is very friendly but if you get out of hand, they have no problems handling the situation.  As for the rest of the place, it's definitely a chill place to hang out on the weekends. The two Irish bartenders are Awesome and very entertaining. I would highly recommend visiting this place, at least once and form your own opinions.  After all, everyone is entitled to their own opinions and if they had a bad experience, I'd ask, well what did you do to deserve it. I do admit, service sucks a little, then again, it all depends on who you get as your server. Some are very attentive and there are some who are not. FORM YOUR OWN OPINIONS!!!

XTq0m2N8e6MWF3OiyAvArg.text: Im quite upset. Me and my friend were playing the bowling game... $6 each. $12 total. Both times all 3 balls got lost and by the time they came to retrieve them, we lost frames. Never offered any kind of reprieve such as a free game or anything.... This place doesnt care is what I realized.

pgJC2vq5X-tUuuXKq5bOrw.text: I work down the street from here, so I do their happy hour once in awhile. Happy hour starts at 4. Apparently, I ordered my food at 3:58 so I was charged full price. You think the waitress would've told me or just waited 2 minutes to put my order in?

efp4ztsXdRgspmFHkuWsog.text: Great bar right off the 215 and Flamingo. Drinks are cheap, video poker is plentiful, and there are tons of TVs for your viewing pleasure. Even though it's right off the 215, it's really well insulated from noise with their courtyard. There are tons of games to play while you sip one of 50+ beers on tap. Darts, arcade games, cornhole, beer pong, Jenga, bowling, and more. Definitely worth stopping on, especially during happy hour.

xH4yNfJsGhCRFfH2QG576Q.text: Came in tonight for a highly anticipated NBA finals rematch with some friends in the industry. Place was busy as usual. Service was terribly unacceptable. Server took our drink order. After nearly 20 minutes later our drinks were delivered to our table and some were missing. Manager who delivered the drinks used profanity while commenting how "the server doesn't know how to ring in drinks." Found that really offensive and unprofessional. Manager came back to drop drinks off, now everyone finally had a beverage. Server came back with another round of drinks stating that "guess this was a double order." We finally placed our food order. Food took over 30 minutes we timed it. When our food finally came, we all were so hungry we forced ourselves to eat the items ordered because we were obviously that hungry and to just bare the dryness of our sliders and chicken wraps we requested more sauce. It was obvious our food sat in the back for a long period of time. No apology, no follow up from the manager. When the bill came which was the most awkward part of the dinner we realize that all of our meal was charged to us. Find that kind of odd how nothing was addressed or done to make up for such a horrible display of service and management. Didn't want to come here to begin with, but after tonight it will indeed be the last. Explains why the business is at a 3 star ranking. Actually find that inaccurate. Cheap food, cheap drinks, below par service. Suggestion, bring on more staff for peak nights, address customer issues, take care of your locals.

wmSjL0KlRPBoCPrTiZF90g.text: Me and my wife think this Bar is awsome food is amazing only thing that needs work is customer service from your bartender in the out side patio.. 5/27/16 10pm. it is hard to get there attention to place a drink order after he asked us what we wanted. After just looking at him he comes back I place my order again, a yung lady appears next to me and all services turned to her. Come on! I thought he need a good tip after two drinks and I gave him a ten. When we where done playing the beanbag game I go up to the same bartender witch happen to be there again looks at me with the beanbags to grab my license but wait? Of course another yung lady appears after I was waiting for 5 minutes ignores me. Makes the yung lady her drink looks at me again I'm thinking that good tip I gave him he might be nicer nope looks at the guy next to me and walks away to the other end of the bar well would you look again pretty girls at the end of the bar.me and the other guy waiting for his order just walks away. Not what I would expect from a bar that has everything but customer service!! Do not get me wrong there is good bartenders but that one needs to get classes for customer service or needs another job. I will be going back but not to that bartender.. less flirting more working bud! Sorry tavern it only takes one!

mtJIpje-80JDuEvp3I1uHg.text: If you want a nice atmosphere, good beer, and decent food...go for it, but the service is HORRIBLE! Our waitress was nice enough, but she was working pretty much the entire section while the other waitress was seen sparingly. Hire more staff.

kXIwdPGKMelbgj14Il3Kaw.text: Typical bar food or filler food as we call it. Service was mediocre. Decent atmosphere. I would go back for a beer with friends but pass on the food.

ISx01-Z04mXDEV4A51Gxnw.text: This is the shittiest 5 star you will ever get. Almost every bartender is SUPER cool and energetic. This doesn't matter if you are playing or not. I play pretty hard but not last night. Employee 2016 Charles from my receipt (dark haired, shorter bartender) seems like a real jerk.  I kind of judge the bar how they treat you before dropping dime in the machines. He failed majorly. I hope this cavalier attitude isn't contagious. Because that would bring this place right back to Road Runner status. I am really hoping not, being a local patron from right down the street. Mr Fine are you reading your reviews?

OPr8z9Rd0D4AiPyXAXzeQw.text: Pretty awesome place. They have an amazing happy hour deals!! They also have an outside bar with a giant connect four game

MFOn8TU7c4vpj-kiLrMMWg.text: Can't say enough about my bar! If you're looking for great food, great beer selection and great customer service.....then this is your place! Bowling, corn hole, shuffleboard, UFC fights, massive beer selection, outdoor bar, board games, etc etc etc.   This place has come such a long way since the renovation and I will continue to make this my neighborhood bar. Jess, Dave & Lauren are the best bartenders you could ask for and Travis is always a blast to hang with as well. Great people and great atmosphere. Can't ask for much more.  Keep up the great work guys....and gals!

O-rXzn5Rq7Y1EygNC6oa4A.text: Anne Marie is AMAZING! She knew all of our names & we had at least 13 people. She is very personable, knowledgeable, & just overall outstanding! Strong servers are hard to find, a diamond in the ruff! The support staff was terrific too. This place is fun & entertaining. New favorite spot! Thank you so much!

nUR_kYwEmtA0yKEVcogbgw.text: This place is way cool. It gets really busy at night so if you aren't looking for a party don't come. Drinks can be hard to get from the bar when it's busy but to be expected. All the novelty games available are awesome and great time wasters.

MP00SRRByKWRHB7NZeyK7A.text: My husband and I are regulars. They have a great beer selection, a kickass loyalty program and awesome bartenders.

WMjp5RmzPqxp0kcfCzEzrg.text: I get that its late at night and there's A LOT of people here but it took so long to get our checks or even get an acknowledgement. The food was okay. It's fun cause it's like going downtown but the service still sucks. Drinks are an okay price.

G-R6PH1Sy0j2mt-bENJBgA.text: I don't understand some of the poor reviews for this place. It's newly remodeled and I'm sure much busier than they expected. Give them some time to get everything worked out and I'm sure Nathan and his staff will have Parkway doing much better.

qXkJzxmKRrowRGTDb2t1RA.text: Atmosphere was good execution was horrible.  Stale potato chips on my "nachos" they remade them but still not good ,but still payed for them. Service was slow. Don't think I will be in hurry to be back.

gnahMTGcR8qvhNRw7Yx0RA.text: We went here with high hopes and soon figured out not so much. I pretty much stick to my beer basics so I ordered a corona bottle.  First off it felt like it was just put in the cooler. Just cool and not cold. Then I didn't even get a lime. My husband asked to join the beer club and the response we got was "I'll bring the ipad" and we never got the ipad! The service was terribly slow and when we asked questions about the happy hour it took over 5 min to get an answer. No fault to the waitress who was new (but isn't this restaurant pretty new?) I put blame on the managers who don't train the staff properly and when there are only 4 tables occupied in the whole place you should at least touch every one and see how things are going. We were going to order food but we just wanted to get out of there so I can't comment on that.  We went on a Thursday afternoon at around 2 hoping it would be our new spot to grab a drink and a bite but not so much!

VIthQt8r5xIXHEafG4xtkw.text: Just awful. Not a bartender to be found. We actualy tipped the bar tender before we ordered because we heard service was terrible. We still recieved terrible service. This place will be for rent soon.

D9ya8D_itLPiXPoS6cyduQ.text: What an awesome place: Fun Atmosphere, Great Prices on Beverages/Beers, Awesome Game Selection, Cool Fun Vibe, Wide Open and Colorful, Friendly Service and  Good Food! Love THIS NEW PLACE I JUST DISCOVERED...Can't Wait to try it out for a UFC event! THANK YOU, DON'T CHANGE A THING!!!!!!

uJoyUjg6IAqE97_gtXrUKg.text: The service was terrible! Walked in and stood at the host desk for a few minutes and was not contacted by any employees. Two employees were out in the patio area (not far from where we were standing) smoking and drinking alcohol. We decided to seat ourselves. Table was sticky. Two waitresses walked by and did not say a word. There were only two other families in the dining area, so it's not like they were busy. Finally the third waitress stopped. She brought our menu's; they were nastier then the table! Mine was so sticky that there were a few pieces of human hair stuck to the front. The inside had some yellow substance dried on it. Looked like nacho cheese. We were ready to place our order, however the waitress kept walking by and looking the other way when she passed us. We were finally able to place our order. I ordered "Smoked" prime rib and my wife ordered Mahi Mahi sandwich. It took 30 minutes (not exaggerating) for us to get our food. Mind you the dining area was empty as earlier mentioned. Furthermore, we had a view into the kitchen and there was a burger sitting window waiting to be served for approximately 15 minutes. Meanwhile the group of employees (some of whom appeared to be management) continued drinking and smoking out in the patio. My prime rib (if you can call it that) was extremely oily! I've never had any meat that was smoked come out oily... It tasted like processed meat. NASTY! The Mahi Mahi was extremely dry and rubbery! As we ate, our glasses were empty as servers continued to walk by ignoring our empty glasses. Most of our meals were still on our plates when we placed our napkins on our plates. Indicating we were done. The waitress came over and I assumed she would ask how everything was. Not so much. She grabbed our plates and I asked for our check. She brought the check right back. Fastest service we had all afternoon! Needless to saw we will NOT ever step foot back in that place. It's always packed at night when we drive by, so we decided to give it a shot. It's definitely not packed for its food or service! I gave this place one star because zero stars was not an option!!!

AsDa0MwzXGEPU9mQcY8p6A.text: The worst customer service my friends and I have experienced. We all work in customer service and can't begin to understand why someone would be allowed to get away with such attitude. We sat ourselves in a booth in the main inside area and waited 10 minutes to be acknowledged/given menus. The waitress automatically started off with a piss poor attitude. We saw a Placard on the table that had happy hour specials during 'football games', so since there was a game on, we assumed it was happy hour right? No. Only what they deem as 'important games' constitute happy hour prices.  We got a condescending remark from the waitress and said she'd be back. Then when we ordered "$1 vodka and punch shots" as advertised by our waitress, she came back and said they were actually 2 for $3. At this point we're all already pissed off and had ordered a pizza. We ordered three rounds of 2 shots. She came back with 2 rounds of 2 shots and a hell of an attitude. We decided to bother a different waitress to cancel our pizza order. I am a manager of a cafe and I would fire anyone who treated nice customers like she treated us. She treated us like we were somehow infringing on her evening. Don't go here.

q2xT6xGSnUIRAIvM_s84NQ.text: Having been driving by the PKWY for a couple of months.  After a HOT and THIRSTY round of golf, we decided to stop and check it out.  We were greeted immediately by our bartender (Amber) who promptly offered us the "Beer Menu" and after making our choices, she immediately informed us about their Brew T.E.A.M. membership.  After a quick sign-up we were given our free PKWY t-shirts.  Cool!  We then ordered Potato Skins that came quickly and they were hot, crispy and delicious.  The atmosphere in the bar itself is very open and has very interesting lighting all consisting of different beer bottles.  There are lots of games to play and even board games on the tables.  And for the guys there is an interesting twist in the restroom (according to my husband).  Overall a great first experience.  We will be back. Especially looking forward to bringing my son and his college buddies there when he comes home for a visit.  They will enjoy it!

UMAZr7EzQ7QdEpXSxf9gNw.text: What happened to this place ??? After you walk through all the trash , broken glass in the parking lot you get inside. What a dump!  When it was the RoadRunner it was awesome!!   We walked in to see a girl just staring down at her IPad behind the bar, did not even acknowledge us. Then a very friendly gal got our beers and told us for each beer we need to put $20 in the Machine even if we are winning  or run a tab.  I ordered a "lunch" size philly sandwich ($8)and it was horrible, old meat, no Cheese, canned mushrooms with limp fries . Very disappointing.

ctTAYtotLewBTvuINAiTiQ.text: J-effin-C what an awful experience.  Stopped in tonight to watch the playoff game - they only had one half of the TVs in the room on the game.  We asked if they could change one on our side - they said no because they "have to keep the in-house advertisements on the screen" .. yeah I'm already here, I don't need to see your advertisements.  Also, you could have switched out with one of the TVs on the other side of the room if you actually gave a shit about your customers.  Then, and this is my favorite part, it took them 90 minutes to get us a plate of 5 mozzarella sticks.  **90 MINUTES!!**  Another table came in 20 mins after us - they received a round of drinks, then their appetizers, then their entrees ... while we still sat there with just drinks.  They had 7 people at their table, we had 2.  Tell me how you managed that??  After pointing out to our server that everything about our experience sucked, he finally sent the manager over.  She told us "they made a mistake on your order".  It took 90 minutes to get 1 plate of mozz sticks - thats not a "mistake", thats incompetent management.  It took close to 2 hours to get our entrees.  Even if you screwed up our order (1 sandwich, 1 hamburger) how tf did it take you almost 2 hours to serve a friggin hamburger??  The manager half-assed apologized and did comp the food it took 2 hours to get, but I'll never come here again.  I don't mind a mistake, but 2 hours to get a burger at a bar is a fucking joke - never happens at PTs.  There didn't seem to be a shortage of staff either.  Plenty of people walking around doing next to nothing.  Oh, and btw, when we finally did get our food, it wasn't even hot.  How did you manage that??

o8ce2mieQ1wln-fW0dWyiA.text: It's a chain bar and in line with the food and drinks you'd expect. Staff were attentive and honored the Educator discount even though I didn't have my business card. Fine for game watching and grabbing a drink. Parking was limited however

JyQQa3olW4GYhbBC8KNpdQ.text: Wasted potential. Pkwy sports bar is a cool atmosphere. My favorite part is the outside patio with the lights, grass and picnic tables. We reserved two tables for our large party. The tables were in the perfect spot because we had multiple views of the Knight's game on multiple screens. I am not really a hockey fan but the excitement was palpable with the huge crowd. Now your probably wondering why 2 stars and it is because of the service. Our waitress was horrible. My party was there at 7pm and did not receive drinks until 730 not even water. When our food came there were no utensils, napkins, or condiments. My friend had to go and get our items herself. Another person ordered a Pepsi around 7:10 and no joke did not receive it until 7:50. When the waitress finally would come around everyone treated her like a unicorn and was trying to get her attention. If they were short staff the guys handing out the food should have helped out. When we asked for water they were like ask your waitress.   Everyone at the table was upset with the service but still had a good time around the game. This place has a lot of potential to be awesome but need to work on customer service and execution of large events.

LjZUMptrLsVPztGi1brzaQ.text: Tried to have breakfast... walked in and there was no host so we assumed you could sit at a table... we sat at a booth, the bartender had a clear view of us and we sat there for 10 minutes without anyone every speaking to us or coming to the table. We got up and left and still she didn't say anything.

6rJ7C4PkXp1IBPixneHnlw.text: So you could come to PKWY and have two completely different experiences depending on the time of day/night that you come.  Let's start with the positive things here that don't change though: they have a TON of beers (and good ones), they have decent food, the staff is always friendly, and they are a craft beer bar that is located in a part of town where there aren't many choices in the area of beer. Seriously though, have you ever tried to find a cool crafty beer spot or brewery when in summerlin!?!...it's like your only option.   If you make it here during daylight for a bit of day off day drinking, it's super fun! Chill ambiance, lots of attention from bartenders, good solid crowd. A great place to hang with some friends and enjoy a day baseball game on tv.   If you happen to get here after about 8pm...like any night...you better either be in college, or really want to go back to that time in your life when you had no responsibilities, no money and no manners...because this bar legit turns into a 25 and under establishment very quickly. Not that there's anything wrong with young drinkers...but nothing will make you feel old more than a ravenous group of kids acting like it's spring break, and spilling drinks on your Givenchy handbag.

6fiZS3YpYQiGUhwPIHEoxg.text: So I've been to this location time after time because my friends like it. Meh. I'd much rather go to the Tivoli Village location. I've waited way too long for service every single time I've come here. In fact, I don't think there was a single time I waited at the bar for under 15 minutes to order a drink, no matter how busy or slow the bar was. The bartenders are rude, unless they're flirting with you, which is apparently the only way to order a drink here. So if you're not a model, you may never get to order. Oh, and it's also extremely loud and crowded after 10pm. You might as well go to a nightclub because that's the type of atmosphere this bar gives.

JIz6y9KUIHoaQPTdavrfhg.text: Service is the worst.  Ton of staff yet you wait FOREVER for them to realize you are there.  Never again

i95dBwv77Ip47G8h0xHybw.text: WHOA! So the bar food here is pretty darn good! I've been meaning to go to PKWY Tavern for a minute. It's one of those places that's been on my radar and I just couldn't get to.  Well once I did, I went back the very next day :) Let's see, the things I enjoyed: - Pretzel with beer cheese - warm + salty = perfect! - Breakfast pizza - the dough is perfectly fluffy and the egg makes all of the difference. Loaded with cheese too. - Pepperoni pizza - I missed the egg but the cheesiness made up for it. - Fried mushrooms - YAASSS!! They were small mushrooms, each deep friend. Not cut up portobello fries like everywhere else. - Buffalo wings - comes with fries. Really good flavor and good sized. Non food - All of the games. - Extensive beer menu. - Separate sitting areas. - Awesome staff. - Fast service. Now the things that are, Meh - Cuban sandwich - it's just OK. I may have had overly high expectations since someone told me it was amazing. - Lack of specialty drinks. I realize it's a beer spot but with everything else it offers, specialty drinks would seal the deal!

Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar Bacon Sliders

-W9ZRp2ht_aFsIflxb0_gQ.text: We were here on a slow Friday afternoon, large party. The sun was out and after asking 3 people to move the umbrella for us, nothing. Our first server was on it, second girl was a ditz. We asked for our check and 20 mins later, nothing. Foods sucks. Don't bother with this place.

vHHUjvufNdvbxDKB3n50ww.text: This place is definitely a good go to happy hour place for beers, hangout, and to watch sports. However the food is not as great. But if you are just looking for a great hangout place with decently priced beer and bar food then this is a great place to go.   We went for happy hour and I thought service was good. We hung out a bit after we finished our meal and they told us to take our time but cleared out our table super fast. Usually I like some food to be left on the table. Even if we stopped eating now doesn't mean I won't munch on it 30 mins later so I wished they weren't so efficient at taking away all of our plates and utensils before we even paid the bill.   I thought some of the food was pretty decent. Standard happy hour fried fare. The tator tots and mini corn dogs were good. Nice and crispy. The hh wings were a good portion size too. However I ordered the pork belly tacos and didn't enjoy them. The skin wasn't cooked enough so it was rubbery and super tough. Basically inedible so I had to take it out. The tacos came with only the pork belly, a balsamic tasting sauce and vinegared onions. I wished the condiments were different.

aZtUSPICRTGqpn7WKXBTDA.text: Love this place. I love that I can come here on the weekends or come to watch the VGK game. The vibe is always great and staff seems to enjoy working here. Food was delicious. Only suggestion would be more attentive. Totally understand we were there to watch the game and the server probably didn't want to interrupt, but she never came over to check on us and see if we wanted anything to eat after she dropped off our drinks. Suggesting apps/food increases the bill which increases the overall tip. Other than that I still suggest this bar to everyone.

XQD9iO-B8pC3gGwJ2XukFw.text: This place is trash! I used to love going here but the wannabe "top flight" security TERRENCE doesn't know how to do his job. My sister-in-law-had her real ID and he didn't let her in. Didn't even scan her ID..When we asked for the manager the manager was like "whatever Terrence says goes" like are you the manager or is Terrence the manager .... the manager didn't even look to give his second opinion. Screw this place.

e1ly0iK1zdQJ27NrU-gBqw.text: So I come here pretty regularly since I moved to the area and am new to Vegas in general. I've noticed a lot of gaming bars the service is mediocre at best. The rest of the local bars all seem to be here and only give you the time of day if you're making big wins and handing out big tips. If you're just drinking... ignored for the most part. Not here tho!!!!!!! Let me tell ya about this these tenders. Bruce and Karla (with a K!!) are fantastic. Always say hi, always give the BEST service; quick, attentive, and just all around the reason I end up swingin' in after shift. I'm a bartender from Cali so we didn't have gaming and it was always service forward so coming here was quite the shock. These two and a couple others (Justin? I think was his name) are all about the customer and make me feel right at home. Thanks guys for always being F-in best!!! Xoxo   Heads up if you wanna party go on a Friday/Saturday. Get here before 11/12

47fJAJp4ZxAHo2HD1lfHSA.text: For work I had to throw a last minute party for 40 people and Kimberly Palmer was able to accommodate all of my party needs last minute, from pre-ordering off the menu, allowing me to come in early and decorate, to making sure there was enough staff to ensure great customer service. The wait staff was excellent and friendly. The party went great and because of all the great service the people at work could not tell that it was a last minute celebration. I will definitely be a return customer with my company and personally. It has a fun atmosphere, craft beers, great food, and good place to watch sports.  Lisa Arriola  Aristocrat Technologies

UUAsyNBnDYenhHGfAxIMRQ.text: Came in on a Saturday for March Madness. Service was horrible. Took at least 10 minutes to be greeted and have our order taken. Took another 10 minutes to get our drinks. Another 30 for food. I had to flag the waitresses every time I needed a refill. The waitresses never asked how our meal was or checked if we were ok. I Also had to hunt down the waitress for our check. I had to find her again to settle the bill which then took another 5-10 minutes to get my card back. The place was slow, no reason for the poor service. Waitresses totally didn't appear to care about customer service.

7cS_gEQA065OL-vxGhOv5w.text: What horrible policies they have here. It's the NBA season opener and also game 5 of the NLCS but they decide to turn EVERY tv to the NHL Vegas knights game. The manager refused to turn on and baseball or nba game even though some people requested it. The service is abysmal as the waitresses would rather chit chat in a corner instead of coming to the tables to see if their customers want anything. O ya, the food was crap but there were a lot of beers to chose from. Would've been nice to try another one if the waitress ever come around. And this is considered to be a sports bar?!?

gVe5cpVxyGmr5lh84Ud-9w.text: PKWY used to be fun, it's definitely regressed. The problem is when you arrive you either don't get greeted or the hostess leaves her position to socialize with friends. I'm just speaking about this location the other property at Tivoli is a little smaller but it's a lot friendlier  and they are more attentive to guests.

hWIr2wRyxKYqu_zv6QOfSQ.text: Loved this Place !! Great atmosphere and the service was awesome ! Really cool inside with over 200 beers on Tap !! Food was great ! After three long days of travel decided to stop by taking my mom with me and we both enjoyed the experience!  Our Waitress was very nice and I got a free shirt for signing up with their app! Get the app and after so many points / beers you win some pretty awesome stuff!!   We both just had Chicken Caesar salads but very good with a sampler of beer !! The sampler had five tasters and they were great !   They have a really cool outdoor area with picnic tables, large Jenga, Corn Hole and A large connect four ! Trust me ... this is where you will want to hang out with fake grass and misters !!   They have Pool and Bowling inside and the decor is pretty awesome ! Definitely a place to take a group and hang out !!

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer Menu !!

3_QyuasLzYsj1nqbrbjgtA.text: Bad service, don't bother coming here.  Lots of beers, but try ordering one......Rude bartenders, unhelpful management, they just don't care here.

ZiPKRDzhJ2_pvYhoFlfTzg.text: "Dear sky, don't cry for me. Be the hope I could never reach. Cold sea, please don't let me sink, wrap your arms around me and carry me home."  There are two reasons you visit PKWY Tavern:  1. You need a place in this immediate area with a huge list of beers.  2. You are with a group of friends looking to play corn hole, beer pong, darts, shuffleboard, bowling, ping pong and board games in an accommodating front lawn meets patio environment bar.  The food is typical bar fare...nothing special...nothing worth coming in for. The beers are ample but overpriced. The staff is not trained or educated on the extensive list of beers so it's not a great place to explore beers or breweries that you're not familiar with.  Fans of the old Road Runner that was previously in this location probably won't like this younger feel and crowd PKWY is catering to.  I can understand the 1 stars reviews, but the bar games in the nice inside/outside patio setting and beer list are enough to bump it up a star in my mind...but you won't find me rushing back here.

S9CP00Fb82M_APO_yAkbRw.text: PKWY is a great place to party.  2nd Superbowl at this spot and absolutely the best service and atmosphere in Vegas.  Theres a reason why all the locals are there!

16Qdey_4XIQJPFboSSrGTw.text: Bad customer service and food even worse. The place is fun, however is missing the other two major factors. Potential to do better.

EQNqTxQpLqP9UXyVz42A8g.text: This bar is pretty much a smaller gold spike. It was fun and a cool place to locally hangout. It definitely isn't ghetto and is located on flamingo and 215 at the old roadrunner location. It's cute because it's very open and large and there is corn hole and giant jenga!  The food is okay, it's your typical bar food. Their drinks on the other hand are very reasonably priced and the service was very quick. Our waitress was seriously a ninja, our drinks would appear without her presence. The crowd is kind of weird because it's a lot of older cougars preying on younger boys and old men. But it's also a high school/college reunion everytime I come now because it's such an incredible hangout spot! Love this place

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yup, I love this place.

HcLg7y-6coVx0oUAh2ofCw.text: I would give this place about 3.5 stars, but I rounded up because I had a good time. Came here to watch the UFC fight with some friends, we heard they don't charge cover so figured we'd check it out. Got there really early and were told everything was reserved except for the outside bar, so we sat there. It was really hot at 4:30 on an August day, so we did try to get something inside, but the staff wasn't very interested and just said we were out of luck for anything inside, which is understandable since it was a fight night, but I do think they could have been nicer about it. Anyway we almost left and went somewhere else because we were so hot, but we decided to stick it out and I'm glad we did. Soon after people started piling in and we realized that we actually had prime real estate! It ended up getting packed! They really needed 2 bartenders behind that bar instead of 1. For food I had the shredded chicken wrap and it was really good. My friends all got a hot dog/fries/PBR special for $7. We also signed up for their beer club and got free t-shirts. This was a great place to watch the fight and I would come back again.

0hRi9CUvS-LSQ_IJqqdI6Q.text: LOVE IT!!! Puts Hooter's to shame.  The wings are better, the sauce is better, 250 beers on tap, and more games.  This is my go to place for wings, sports and fight nights.  They also have a Hot Wing Challenge.  It sounds crazy.  I tried a sauce that was half as spicy, and it was burning me up.  I can take spicy stuff pretty well, but I won't be attempting this challenge.

7RkzwrRzgOYKmT-H-ltoCA.text: So it kinda reminds me of gold spike but i like it cause its minus the whole downtown chaos.  First time I came here was last week which was early october 2015 :) The bar staff are pretty nice & they have something for everyone. Games, drinks, more games.. & more drinks. Drinks are just a little pricey if you ask me, especially if we were to compare it to PTs but other than that, I would definitely come back.  They just need a pool table! Unless I totally missed that from being buzzed hahah

oAp4Aanwh9Xj0jQ13jb_pw.text: This used to be a frequent stop for my cousin and I. A year ago, the weekend music was awesome, the vibe was fun and comfortable, people danced, drank, and had a freaking blast. Oh! And a cup of water was free.  In the past year, they've changed for the worst. The Friday night DJ sucks, plays literally nothing but 90s and early 2000s rap all night, and when asked why he doesn't play anything newer, will say because "most of it is trash anyway." Very seldom are people as active in dancing as they were before.   Oh and worst of all, they've started charging for water. Now, I don't drink, which bestows upon me automatic DD duties. So now I have to pay $4 for a bottle of water with my sober self that they used to give me in a cup for free. It's almost as if they're encouraging drunk driving and trying to get a dram shop liability lawsuit.   Oh and the food is a solid 6/10.

TqkbJep57y4BIhOiWVKIqA.text: Do you miss those college days of beer pong, getting wasted, and hanging out? Do you want to show your niece and nephew what college means? Or better yet, your international guests can get a grasp of the American college lifestyle by stopping by pkwy tavern.   I entered into this mad house and was surprised how the entire college campus had migrated over to this one establishment. Where did they come from? It's a flashback to sorority/fraternity parties. At the entry, you see people smoking as though they're in their college house backyard, then there's the groups of boys at beer pong tables.   A great place for the 21-25 year old age range, but you'll find yourself in a nostalgic state otherwise.   I love that they have different games available. I saw Jenga. It's a fun environment if you come with a good group of friends. Drinks on tap were vast in selection. Prices are slightly on the steeper end.   We got plastic cups after they ran out of real glass. Talk about a True fraternity party. The only difference was that they were clear cups, not the red solos.   I'd come back here again to play a game, but I'd rather do that at home. Service was average, and the mango habanero wings were okay.

-0pw4_fWGz6JizvMemlsYw.text: One of my husband and I's favorite places to eat since moving to Las Vegas. Tons of different beers to try..games outside and live music. The food is fantastic!!

kRdCnYE8ymmwkNgSvSpMQg.text: One of my new favorite bars ive already been here several times and dragged my friends because the beer selection is one of the largest in town and the food is good not to mention there are games to play.

u3F9vyV3gIjhYl78EhoMuw.text: I had the worst service ever on 1/6/18 at the outside bar the bartenders were rude and lied about drink prices trying to over charge us. Derek was the rudest of them all.

Plus (of course) I got the wrong card back so if your name is Kayla please contact me.  Update: it's been two weeks and I have yet to get my money back from PKWY. I got my bank involved and got the money back from them instead. PAY CASH & DONT GIVE THEM YOUR CREDIT CARD.

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders....3 for $7.95...Go to Sagos...3 sliders for $5 plus they include fries!!!

lh1vDXyax_U91EqdsnHjHw.text: I came here with my cousins one night while visiting and we all had so much fun here! Such a great place to just play some games and drink. I really liked the outside area that still somehow made you feel like you were indoors. Perfect place to come with a big group or if you're just looking to play games and have a great time

aZyRf8QBDc38ZifWwgi-Mg.text: Worst seevice i have ever had in my 5 decades of life! I was with a party of 7 and most of the time we had empty drinks waiting for our waitress. I felt like the waitresses felt put out when they had to take an order.  I do not recommend this bar.  There are much better bars nearby and this was our first and last time there.

TsQDJR_GaQJMO2u-4gWVug.text: Niall is my favorite bartendar! The atmosphere is great, the food is great (specially when drunk) and the drinks are cheap! Great life size games to play too! Wonderful place for locals

OgPydQx3SxPHlCh_MaD7_A.text: I have tried multiple times to like this place. Went there tonight. After 45 minutes still did not get our spinach dip. Manager's excuse was they were making it from scratch. Were they growing the spinach? It is always slow service there.

u871ttb3zY5S8IpygZR6rw.text: I think this place is legit. Amazing games, good brews, and beautiful people! They show UFC fights too; in fact, I was late to the venue one night and asked the manager if he could replay the fight, and he was more than cordial! Also, in my experience, the bouncers are nice, reasonable dudes. They have a tough job so don't be surprised if they give you the boot if you do something against policy. It's not personal people. It's for everyone's safety and good time. Overall I like this place a lot, and I have a great time when I go!

_5NDkvFVK1mXTKxmgCSMNw.text: Love this place! All the games are on, great specials, great food, and lots of other entertainment. Staff is great and lots and lots of beers! Thankful for a good place for locals in the area.

y8VDx1G1WLgujt8wZMQaXg.text: Great place except for your miserable server JEANETTE! I'm not sure what her problem is but it's pretty clear that she shouldn't be working there with her horrible attitude and lack of customer service. Last night, she took 25 minutes to get our drinks because she forgot to pick them up at the bar, then later she brought us the wrong drinks, acted super annoyed when we asked for more napkins, and when we asked for extra ranch she brought back a small condiment cup that was less than a quarter full. vgDgJPnp2PpLRyrEJVD2IQ.text: Pathetic. Literally walked in to this place for an early dinner and drinks hoping for the best because I loved going to the Road Runner in this location. But, after sitting down at the table and waiting for over 20 min, we were not even ACKNOWLEDGED by any server, bartender, or manager. Even after asking the hostess if there was anyone covering our section, and being reassured that there was indeed someone, we proceeded to wait another 10 min. and of course were not even acknowledged... Walked out never being served.  Would not recommend this place at all.

tYGl5EEcz3XnbC0SiJAlsQ.text: I just love this place!!!  The food is great. I can get 20 delicious, meaty, juicy wings during happy hour for $10!  You can't beat that price.  I have had both Kim and Rebecca as my server. Both are amazing. Everyone that I have encountered at this establishment has been friendly. The idea of having a card to use each time I drink a beer to go towards a free item is genius!  This will be my weekly spot!

OojDc3ZsfAF81GBv-wA0UQ.text: Came here for breakfast before work. Was amazing! Had egg white omlette and a much needed coffee...all while listening to Janis Joplin playing. Perfect start to my day!

IALduuu-GWosy6BqzGylbQ.text: Before my best friend, her boyfriend and I left this bar we were hanging out on his tailgate just chilling and some guy sitting in a black camaro with his window rolled down started yelling homophobic things at me. Calling me a faggot and many other things. I just overlooked it but my best friend is a very passionate person. I tried my darndest to hold her back because really what some asshole says doesn't matter to me. This asshole GOT OUT OF HIS CAR AND PUSHED HER TO THE GROUND. Now I'm a VERY mom-confrontational sort of guy, never been in a fight and this was all so surreal. Her boyfriend went over to this guy who was bigger than all three of us and he started getting wailed on! I ran up behind him and got him from behind to the ground when the security came out. We tried to explain what happened and that HE ATTACKED A SMALL 110 LB FEMALE, They said he was a regular at the bar and that he would never say such things. So we left and they let him stay. We were leaving anyways but it's the principle. Up to that point the bar was very fun. Pretty pricey but I enjoyed it. I could never go back to a place that supported homophobia the way that they did.

F5VVGBYRORJ42fXtBm7pIQ.text: I love going to parkway for their great food and drinks and I always get excellent  service from Kara Shrader!! Me and my friends always have a great time and I highly recommend this place to anyone!

VdtgeCOAvVCUCPbt0u8XzQ.text: Pkwy Tavern has a chill and laid back atmosphere. Their menu has a wide variety of drinks. I regret not getting up from the table and checking out the surroundings. There were tons of TVs that showed sports/entertainment and various activities that include pool, darts, bowling, etc. The only downside of this place was the customer service...   I mean, I could see slow service due to a large capacity of guests. But, when my friends and I got there, the tables were barely filled... We were sat at a table and were pretty much forgotten about. Sat there for over 25min. Got a bit fed up so we asked for someone to help us take some orders. It took another 10-15min. for someone to tend to us... Not too pleased with my first visit here...   If you're looking for prompt service, this is not the place for you. But, I will for sure give Pkwy Tavern another shot when the time comes.

5-DYWhw5EOdW5TF-8JUuFA.text: PKWY Tavern aided me in hosting a community mixer for my group.  Dave, Becca, and Nathan all attended to my guests needs and were very attentive.  It's location and abundance of tv monitors make it a great after-work hangout and also a nice place to host community gatherings.  Happy Hour pricing is generous and Becca is ON POINT when it comes to service!

GOsxkHtKrGr6DEXwOZdEXQ.text: Pkwy Tavern is excellent. Life-sized gaming, a free shirt for downloading their smartphone app and prizes/rewards for your craft beer consumption. Oh, and a bartender named Carla.

t9C2pBBnYueoOdUW3tPv4g.text: Always a fun place. Great games outside. Fun atmosphere. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars and not 5 is the bartender outside is not the friendliest. Wednesday nights are packed though!

sbEhNvWqN5__MKPlYAlG2g.text: The games are awesome don't get me wrong. Unfortunately my boyfriend and I ordered BBQ wings they were mostly raw like 6 out of 10. :/ the drinks were good. I'm disappointed and wish we could come again but due to the service of our brunette waitress, I can't come again and be ignored. Thanks for the good food and beer selection. There are lots of things to keep you entertained on the patio like beer pong and other fun drinking games. They have pool tables inside and mini bowling. They have a really large selection of beers on tap. The food I've tried isn't the best but it's good enough for drinking food. I don't eat beef or pork so the foods I have tried aren't many but others I've gone with each time have said the same about their food. The food isn't horrible just not the best out there.

8teqtC8nSW_y_MTrYcCM4g.text: We tried this out with a $20. Groupon.  Ordered the fried mushrooms made from giant portobellos chopped up.  Good dipping sauce and a good beer batter.  Hubby had a beer I had a soda.  Hubby got fish and chips.  Fries ice cold, but were replaced.  Fish tasty, lightly battered.  I got the disappointing smoked turkey sandwich, supposedly smoked on site.  No way.  Sandwich was something I could make at home, not served like a traditional club.  No bread choice but wheat.  Not impressive.  Pasta salad was dried out, like it sat out.  We ate in  the Rebel Room,  nobody in the restaurant, and it was tough to get service.  In the end it was $46.00 with tip for this meal. Luckily we had the groupon, I would have screamed.

LmriiHbcHinI4P4iMcwz8g.text: There are plenty of beers to choose from & good food  to pair. The jalapeno poppers & grilled cheese are always a good choice. But that's were the problem lies, good luck trying to get a server to bring you anything. I have been there on different days but it's always the same, waitresses just walk by & don't acknowledge you.

OhxKhYuSYj4A3Aj-V7YrQw.text: Best bar in Vegas hands down! Great customer service and well priced! Kelley is the freaking man. Had a blast!!

XdMzRd0o_mJ4IX-A3aWF3w.text: I had to update my review.  I've come here 3 more times since writing my original and my experiences have been marketably better.  Great beer selections, reasonable prices, rotating selections, and dozens of TVs offering any sporting event you're into, local or not.  The thing I learned about PKWY is that the best way to get service is to sit at the bar.  Sitting outside will be tough to get a waitress' attention.  Sitting at a table inside is hit or miss.  At the bar, no trouble at all.    The staff is relatively knowledgable about the beer offerings and the food is the typical bar food.  The place itself has a very laid-back, playful vibe with darts, bowling, ping pong, and games.  This will be my new summer hangout spot in town, just remember to go to the bar to order.

k3_9MzMsCfpLvOuE86RAnQ.text: Always a great time at Parkway! Between beer pong, bowling, darts and other games, PKWY is always great to get a group of friends together and party. Weve come here on very busy nights and super slow days and its always fun! We have tried a few things on the menu as well.  Poutine Tater Tots (Stout gravy and feta cheese) Beer Battered Shrooms (Portobello mushrooms battered in beer tempura and chipotle sauce) WTF Fries (Cincinnati chili, shredded cheddar cheese, bacon, guacamole, pickled jalapenos, sour cream and a fried egg)  All great! Amazing drunk food haha If you havent been to this bar I highly suggest it. Just watch out for the douche bag guys (theyre typically in Affliction shirts)

Zeidsgxkkbw1wTiHzDgA2g.text: I have heard good things about this place, and when I finally got to try the place out, nothing really impressed me. It was a local version of Gold Spike.  Their service failed me the most. The bar was chaotic, but I understand. Its a bar on a saturday night. But we tried to sit at one of their tables while we were waiting for the rest of the group, but no one showed up a good time. It seemed like a waiting area where no one is available to attend you at all. Funny thing is there was no one at the door when we walked in, so we never got our IDs checked either the whole night. However, finally a server shower up, but there was no greeting or anything. So if you are here to actually grab something to eat and have some drinks, go to PT's or yardhouse where they actually serve you. This place wasnt so ideal for table seating.   Two good sides of this place was that it seemed like people cant smoke, at leadt indoor. I dont think i actually smelled cigarette there. But maybe it could have just been that night. Also their drinks were pretty reasonably priced. Irish car bombs and AMFs were 8 dollars each. Not so bad.   I would come back if there is a large group of friends wanting to hang out, but it wouldnt really be a place for me to give frequent visits to. But overall, it had good vibes, i just wish they offered friendlier service to their patrons.

-MZkdUbFMwlywLuM2PGCGw.text: Let me start by saying that I REALLY wanted to like this place. I came because I read the reviews saying this place was like Goldspike. I also read the reviews saying that this place had terrible service, but thought to myself, "It can't be that bad, right??"  Well I was wrong. The visit started very pleasantly. Ordered the fried pickles and Jalapeno Popper Egg Rolls. Poppers were waaaay too cheesy. Decided to order a beer. Waitress comes back to tell me that they no longer offer the beer I ordered, no big deal. Order another and am introduced to the PKWY App where you can log your beers for prizes. Instantly get excited for this and download the app. First order goes great and I pay my tab and have everything logged. And then things started to spiral.  Go inside and start another tab. Ask about how to play some of the games around the bar, none of the wait staff knew how they worked, cost, etc. Ordered a few more drinks before the waitress serving me let me know her shift was ending and asked if she could close out with me. I did so that I could throw a tip her way and asked about logging the stuff I ordered. She assured me that she would log all of it as she took my money and promptly left. I eventually managed to find another waitress and asked if she could log everything for me, since I wanted credit for what I had bought and also wanted to leave. After waiting 20 minutes for her to find an Ipad to log everything, she informed me that she was unable to log anything because I had already been checked out.  It seems to me that if your gimmick is logging beers and giving away prizes, you'd have the method down to a science. It honestly seems like the wait staff is instructed to make it as hard as possible to decrease the amount of prizes that the bar has to give out. Shady business. I won't be back.

tkWfuidNfyEVvlt6nRIg9A.text: Meh.  This place reminds me of Gold Spike except stupidly more crowded and 101347982374% worse service. I mean, the cool thing about it is it's a different environment, that's all. Yes, apparently they have over 250 beers (I say apparently because 1) I obviously didn't try them all - even though I felt like I had the next day - and 2) I've read that the '250 beers' thing isn't True since most of the time they are "out" of a lot beers) and there are games and whatnot but it didn't really set itself apart from other places I've been to.  I was surprised to see tables available when we got there since the parking lot was full and people were parked in red zones next to fire hydrants. We got moved around a bit because there was a larger party that needed two tables put together and unfortunately we get sat at the table that has something spilled on the floor and I was wearing flip-flops so my foot was sticky :( It took about 15 mins to get anyone's attention so I could have a wet cloth because ew.  Our waitress wasn't...bad...except the service was stupidly slow. Like, I had to ask for a beer three times before I got one. My friend's boyfriend got the wrong beer. Someone else at the table didn't like the beer, period (the name was Icky...go figure). It was loud, the tables were crowded. There were people playing beer pong at tables that weren't even meant for beer pong.You're allowed to smoke in some areas but those areas are where the corn hole and bar are located so if you're going to smoke, expect to be uncomfortable and watch out for the flying bean sacks (or is it corn)? I think for the price - seven beers and our bill was $62 - definitely not worth it. I mean, I'd come back if I had to but I wouldn't be too excited about it.

5KFbqTdOxVWM6p6ZcvY-WQ.text: I have never in my life given any restuarant a one star review but this restaurant was a mess.  My wife and I came for lunch and every table we looked at was filthy.  I ended up ordering a Philly Steak sandwich that I ate two bites and took home the meat for the dog who in turn puked it up.  I had onion rings that were okay.  My wife had a burger and fries and said it was a thumbs down.  I hope we hit the place on a bad day.  We may try it again someday.

7aDM7O9YSpKJvnvKaTM3DQ.text: Came to PKWY Tavern one night with a group of coworkers. What is great about PKWY Tavern is that they have a huge list of beers. So if you're a beer loving person, this place is for you! What's even better is that they have a list of beers that constantly rotate every so often. They also have large sized games for you and your group of friends to play with -- it's pretty much like Gold Spike.   When we went, I only had two glasses of beer. I didn't bother to try their food so I can't say how their food is. The different selection of beers was amazing. The service, on the other hand, is horrible. Service is REALLY slow. I would probably suggest that if you just want a drink, just order and pay for it at the bar. It's much faster even if you have to take the time to squeeze into the bar area.   Not only was the service slow, our particular waitress was a little sarcastic with some people in our party .. so that was definitely not appreciated.   I personally would probably not return here unless my friends or coworkers want to go. I didn't really care for the atmosphere -- it was really rowdy. It made me feel like I was at Mcfaddens.   They also have a rewards program, sort of. But you can only get credit for five beers a day and the beer needs to be different. You can't order the same beer five times and get full credit. If you get a certain amount of points, you get a free party or something to that nature. But hey, free to join and beer!

pLY6IOf8W3KZyFCrkXxQYA.text: I really like this place. Yes, it's a little nuts with lots of customers and 20 simultaneous sporting events and indoor-outdoor spaces full of random bar games (even ping pong) - but if you know that going into this, you should have a great time. Just watch out for stray balls, darts, and cornhole bags.  PKWY's food is measurably better than decent - it's actually *good* and a *good value*, surprisingly. From some of the early Yelp reviews I was deceived into thinking otherwise. Since when is $2.95 for a delicious personal basket of sweet potato tots "pricey". Sheesh! That's like 1990s prices, and like totally awesome. Stay home, uber-cheapos!  The grilled chicken on the happy hour salad was actually *warm* and tender and perfectly seasoned. Blue cheese dressing was very chunky and quality; delicious.   Hundreds of craft beers are also very reasonably priced ($4.50-$7ish). Funny, a Bud Light is also $5, but in a way maybe that's PKWY's way of saying, "Don't order Bud Light, asshole"? Whoever said the beers here are "expensive" must be referring to the domestic light beer pricing, which is the *same* as a craft beer. So what? Shouldn't be an issue. Tailgate all the Bud Light out of your F-150 in the parking lot, and then come in and have a Ballast Point something-or-other.  Cheers and welcome to the neighborhood, PKWY!

TyZ-lko6WnUMAMMZw9bVzg.text: I was not very happy at all on Thursday night when I went. I think the staff and bartenders did not handle our situation right at all.   Towards the end of the night we had a altercation with someone. The guy came up to one of our friends and started a fight. Then his friends were all trying to fight us? Of course it got loud and I told the bartenders what happened and they said they'll handle it.  You know how they handled it? They kicked all of us out! Not to pull the racial card but they kicked all of us Asians out! The bouncer told us they will kick those guys out once we left. Come to find out that they never got kicked out when it was their fault?   I don't understand at all why we had to leave when it was their fault? They even kicked out our friends that had nothing to do with what happened.   Very unfair.

ZRxYh_7lMDmNaZgqZxH0wQ.text: Amazing ! The food the customer service the food especially you never really expect places like this to have good food but they did especially the spinach dip it was so much fun .. good music , definitely coming back here with some more friends.

PDfhcVbFQmKrdNF0HHQs6w.text: The place has such potential to be awesome, but the staff is and will continue to be the reason this place with never be anything better than mediocre.  The service is so slow, I could place a drink order here, probably run across the street to a different bar order and finish my drink, all before my drink is even ready.  The waitresses like to add in their own tip or charge you for things you didn't order.  Security, someone please tell me why I have to get a stamp EVERY TIME I go in and out of this bar. Isn't one stamp suppose to show that I've already been in and I'm good for re-entry? Also why are the "doorman's" there so RUDE?   Do yourself a favor and head down to Gold Spike on Freemont, way better atmosphere.

o6pmru5z9B_zJVfy6JP1ig.text: I HAD been going to Parkway Tavern for the past year.  When I first began going, the service staff was friendly and attentive.  Parkway had some of the best bar food around and what a novel concept with a bar with a bowling alley and so many bar games.  However, I have been three times within the past 4 months and it has been a different story.  They changed the menu and food is not as good.  It is so hard to get served.  On one trip, the waitress brought the bill and never came back, so I went to the bar and paid it.    My last and final visit was on September 17, 2016.  I was seated by the hostess in the bar area around 4pm.  There were not that many patrons in the place.  There was ample staff working.  I sat for 15 minutes and never got service.  I told the hostess that this was the third time that I had experienced issues with getting served and I would not be back.  She just said she was sorry.  I am too. Not sure sure if there is new management but the place has went down.  There are too many other awesome choices for food and fun in Las Vegas.

4eOvobTLAV6OKtprlnePWg.text: Why does Las Vegas have such limited number of high quality Beer Bars?   Going in, we expected:  Slow service:  yep,  really slow.  Almost have to Order two drinks at a time and the place was not busy at all.  food:  it was okay.  Nothing special.  Beer list:  while the selection is diverse, it's okay.    Would we return? Meh.

eCJWzz0Y_HyFkPXD1y1qVg.text: We had a really difficult experience. The food was good but the service was so slow we had to leave our table to go get our own drinks from the bar. We saw the waitress once every 45 minutes. Super disappointing as I come here a lot at night, but coming during the day is a no no.

R7ho-91bBkUUqbWAC2PmMw.text: Had a really great time here last night with my coworkers.   First off, this place has a HUUUGE beer selection.  And I love me some beer.   The price was about $4-6 per pint, depending on which beers you choose.  I highly recommend trying a few different types.  Variety is the spice of life.   The atmosphere is very cool! There were lamps and chandeliers made of recycled beer bottles.  Most of the larger, bench-style tables have random board-games for everyone to play with.  We played operation. Haha.   Outside on the patio, they have Giant Jenga, and corn hole games.  Inside, the have Duck Bowling (tiny bowling).   All-in-all, this place is very fun and affordable.  We had a great night!

When I spoke to waitress she said she was the manager sort of I told her about the food and she said that's how it came and that she couldn't do anything about it that's how everybody likes it so I sent the food back I told her I would pay for it whenever I didn't want it I didn't want to order anything else from that place my daughter was with me she ordered the Philly cheese steak and onion rings and she was brought back the Philly cheese steak with french fries we said we ordered onion rings and the waitress said okay let me go get those for you and she never brought those back when she came to give us the check I said to her I said so first we ordered this and he brought it to me raw I said and now we ordered the Philly cheese steak with onion rings and you said you bring back the onion rings and you never did she told me she was busy I said you it's us and two other tables I go what are you going to do when the place is full she just looked at me no apology no nothing I will never go to the Parkway Tavern for anything again

8t8lptJq1fMZxPoPcrikVg.text: Great things about this bar: -food (100%) you will get your food even in the busiest time under -5minutes and its tasty and fresh. -beer selection: it truly is amazing how many beers they are offering. I tried the mexican chocolate peanut butter beer and it was amazing. I also tried the mango cider and it was BOMB!The prices were also very reasonable. -vibe and location: it is a fun bar with outside patio and games. Very good location for groups and watching sport events.  Not so great things: - it is very busy most of the times it cause some difficulties like you have 3-4 different servers while you stay there. They are constantly asking you what is the name on the tab or if you have one, they dont really know if you were playing or not, cant keep track on the complimentary drinks. Every member of the staff is really nice its just hard for them to keep track among so many people.   - if you dont arrive in time means 2hours before the event you will probably wont be seated. Reservations highly recommended!   -fries :(( they were a disappointment, really soggy and burnt :(   All in all i had a great experience, i will definitely come back to try more

oNVq_lH6q2SVUYWbelCHIQ.text: This was my second time here. We came here last night with a friend from out of town, there was a live band and the place was packed due to the hockey game. The crowd was very social and the scene was pretty hipster.   There are pool tables, a little two lane bowling alley, an outside area, bar area and table seating. They have breakfast 24/7. The beer selections have so many choices. I decided on a strawberry beer as I like the fruity drinks.  We like their Beer Poached wings~  in-house beer poached chicken wings, served with choice of dipping sauce.   Among other things we try their Pretzel and beer cheese ~ a giant warm pretzel, served with beer cheese sauce. It comes hanging on a stand and looks cute.  Service was really friendly and prompt.

QBOTi4N77x58Dw_UILdahQ.text: Three years and countless visits later I'm still overall a fan of this PKWY location. Yes the crowd tends to get rowdy and somewhat ratchet at times, but there's still nothing quite with the same vibe and feel as PKWY on the southwest side of town.   I came here for the Superbowl and the Stanley cup playoffs and this place was packed for both! I highly recommend making a reservation for big games to ensure you have a table. They typically do fun promos during big games like beer towers or free shots. On typical football games they have a menu with some drink & food specials. If you have a larger group you can ask to sit in the red room and they'll put your team on in there for you.  The food is consistently pretty good. They change their menu up quite often, but some of my recent favorites are the Jalapeno Popper Eggrolls and the Veggie Burger. They feature a happy hour from 4-7 pm during the weekdays and offer discounts to the medical field workers.   The service is hit or miss, sometimes our waitress is outstanding and super friendly and other times it's a disaster. It's sort of a roll of the dice on that aspect. I recommend reviewing your receipt each time to make sure they charged you correctly for everything.   Don't forget to sign up for their rewards app & log your beers too! You can win free beers and sometimes promo t shirts!

_5Qf3wwF99QE0015S3tU5w.text: Soooooo they have Golden Monkey (my favorite beer) which automatically makes them a favorite in my book. It's also pretty busy most weekend nights, especially Saturday. And even as big as this place is, it still gets packed. Both bars can be busy but the bartenders are awesome.  There is an inside and outside bar area so there's plenty of room to move around should you want to. There are two mini bowling lanes indoor and some games outside like Connect Four, Bag Toss and so on. Last night the Dj was outside but I've seen them indoors as well. There are lots of tables to fit groups and plenty of room at the bar. Like I said though, it's busy so spots fill up quick.   I LOVE that they have so many beers on tap! It's not crazy expensive but it's definitely more affordable than other places in Vegas. Honestly, the food is okay from what I've had. I tried the pretzel last night and it was good but I wouldn't go to PKWY specifically for food. Also, I really like that they offer brunch with bottomless mimosas. When I last went though it was definitely not one of the cheaper brunch options!  Overall, it's a fun bar if you want to get away from the strip and/or want a bar to visit that's not divey. If you're looking for some place to turn up, wait until Friday or Saturday night. I'm sure you could catch some games here as well since there are TVs everywhere.

sJ7taVf7j8RZv-4NvxMZvA.text: Thank you Daniel Klimp great customer service!! This place was on it!!plenty to drink and was able to have fun.

H6MVH8TD2sNyWbElxn5dbw.text: Came in about 6 on a Sunday. Wasnt busy at all we sat down and waited 15 mins for anyone to even look at us... They checked on the table next to us 2 times but never even got our drink orders, finally we just walked out. I'll stick to THEBAR around the corner

tBq8q2Vi5HlAtD5sWohs-g.text: I always tell people some of the best hangouts in Las Vegas is outside of the Vegas strip and this place furthers that belief.  One of my friends who's a local brought me here to hangout. He swore I'd like the beer selections and he was right. 250 beers on tap to get through, I have my work cut out for me. For the most part this was an IPA night with Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA and New Belgium Voodoo Ranger making the bulk of my drinks.   I wasn't going to have a night of beers without at least one pint of Modern Times so grabbed a City Of The Sun as well.   In addition to good beers the atmosphere was awesome even with the ice cold weather. The music was great, the crowd was live and there was lots of games going on ranging from giant Jenga towers to skee ball, to beer pong.  I had a blast and am looking forward to coming back for more beers. Will be giving the food menu a shot as well.  Drinks 1/27/2018
