NMzXGxIfJLhulzcF-WFEgA.text: First and last time here. We sat waiting for a waitress for over 15-20 minutes, in between that time we walk over to the bar to see if we can order there but were told that we have to wait for a waitress. Cool! After another ten minutes of watching the waitresses laugh and play around the registers my fiance walked to them and ask would they send someone over to take our orders. As we're ordering the waitress has somewhat of an attitude but whatever. She wasn't knowledgeable about the menu at all. She came back with our totals saying I need your card( threw me for a loop bc you normally pay after you received your food) payed her and she instantly comes back to pick up her tip. 30 minutes later our food finally arrives and the order is completely wrong. Partially the waitress fault for not understanding what we were asking for a combo sauce mix of hot and bbq and the other half was on the cooks. I tried to get her attention but the only person that would stop was the guy cleaning up glasses off the table. I asked for a manager but I wasn't approached by the manager instead approached by our waitress saying the managers were the cooks and no one was available At this time I informed her of the issues and asked for a refund. I loved the atmosphere but the service here is AWFUL! I would NOT be returning and I'll be waiting on my transaction to be reversed back to my card  Update: A week later I have not been refunded my money. So there is now a dispute being put in against these guys!

You dont need to go to SUR. Restaurant and bar in West Hollywood CA. It's right here in Nevada!!  How can you beat that. Try it you will not just like you will love it!

5xhVF1UasHWvwLGfLvSLtw.text: I was excited to come here! But this is probably the worse service I've had & negative review I've ever written. I met a group there, ended up sitting in the bar the whole night. Sat on the side with the two most horrible bartenders! Where do I start ... took forever to order a drink, mind you we were sitting right in front of them, made eye contact & neither of them cared or made an effort to acknowledge us. The vibe is great there & it's really loud, so I had to raise my voice to get their attention. Ordered a round of altas tequila, bartender rolled his eyes & we weren't even done ordering. He definitely didn't know how to pour because when one asked for tequila on the rocks, he filled a whole rocks glass of tequila hahahahahahah. Anyways we continued to stay there because we really wanted to try their beers. The service was just horrible, never checked up on us, no sense of urgency, they were too occupied messing with their handheld device. Mind you, their side of the bar wasn't even crazy busy. It got to the point where we felt uncomfortable to even ask for drinks. And I never heard of a (rude) barback who doesn't pour drinks. Maybe he got his job title mixed up as a busser instead. Anyways, When we did ask for another round one of the bartenders kept asking if we had a tab opened. Yes! We've been there for 2 hours & you still don't recognize us! Especially since we've been sitting there the whole time, gambling & never moved. They must've confused us as college kids like the rest of the crowd. I can probably run circles around these two bartenders; being in the industry. Mgmt, where did you find these two bartenders? Arkansas?

RZDpPnmozf-nmX6MEhhZTw.text: Dude. It's Sunday 3 pm during football games and THIS PLACE SUCKS! We have been here 45 minutes and managed to get ONE drink! It took me 10 minutes to cash out my gambling ticket and then we moved to the dining area and NO ONE for 20 minutes came to take our order! And then when the girl came AFTER we flagged her down she was rude and like 'oh did you guys need drinks??' Like wtf? No we needed food! And she was unapologetic and really she was acting super odd. Drugs? Maybe. I don't know. I just bought a house down the street and was hoping this may be my neighborhood bar but by our bad experience here makes me think NOPE!!! Save your money and go to The Bar right down the street where you get attention, good food and machines. This place is clearly for fresh 21 year olds who know no better.

Ws8RDtPQhisuIssQIMT-XA.text: Horrible service and the food was not good. Servers ignored our table until it was "past their time to be cut"  leaving us to order at the bar. 2jEugMvLghwR0r4rwBPAFQ.text: This was the WORST dining experience I have ever had! Myself and 2 friends went for dinner and cocktails on Friday evening. We sat for 15 minutes and nobody came to see if we needed menus. I had to walk up to the bar to order drinks and ask for a waitress, I was finally able to place a food order with one of the managers. On top of this our glasses were empty for 30 minutes. When I asked to speak with a manager so we could get out bill and explain the problem he proceeded to want to get in a fight with me and I was told that it wasn't that big of deal!! WILL NEVER GO THERE AGAIN! Nor would I recommend anybody to waste their money there.

ba8Wv2Ltc21nSvxh2aPUNg.text: First time going for a coworkers birthday and it was a blast!! The fries were good, they have a long list of beers so it can be a bit overwhelming if you don't know what you like. All the 3 different kinds of beers I tried I really liked! So no complaint there. The food( at least the appetizer part) was delicious and filling. I stepped outside to the patio and our server sought me out there to let me know that they came so that they wouldn't be cold by the time I went back in. Big thumbs up for Chelsea? on that. She was very attentive to our group and we were never without a beer for more than five minutes. Great job guys!! Love the games and the heater outside too! What a great place to get together with friends to have a good time with! Dave, the manager, was just as awesome, going around making sure everything was ok with our group. Thanks for a fantastic first experience! We will definitely be going back!

PxlPA8HDcKuuhVnE9z4DeA.text: This place blows...the staff especially. Service industry capital of the world and this bar manages to fuck it up. Secondly, the crowd that goes here kinda mirrors the workers...if you're into shitty service and douchey bros slapping hands every 5 seconds over janga this is your spot.

VASdOe1Y_aJ8DX38zQw0Wg.text: Decided to give this a try after it converted from roadrunner. They've done a great on remodeling. Nice place to kick back, relax and have any number of beers.  Tried the blackened salmon salad which was a little dry but otherwise delicious! The kettle chips are fantastic, as are the chicken fingers (we tried the BBQ flavor). I was surprised to read the bad reviews about bad service. Our service was great, and a huge improvement from the terrible service when it was roadrunner! Overall, a great experience! I will be back.

6xyWI4lfJvK3PsQVstyysw.text: Just got over a bout food poisoning. Guess it's to hard for the cooks to wash their hands after taking a crap. Thanks parkway tavern.... Service was good though

dh7OtEIbTJHgaCjFftGytg.text: Went here for my friend's birthday and I was semi excited since I've heard good things about the new and improved bar that used to be roadrunner. Let me start off by saying the concept they have was a cool idea with all the fun games you can play while sipping on some good brew. The place was packed because it really is a good spot to hang out with your friends. There were quite a few downfalls though. They have this huge menu with an awesome selection of microbrews that you can't get at any other bar, but their list needs to be updated. My friends tried ordering multiple beers that they somehow didn't have. Why are they even on the menu? That's just disappointing. One of my friends tried ordering five in a row that they just didn't have. That just looks all bad. I ordered a hot toddy with extra honey because I'm sick at the moment and it took a total of 20 minutes for it to show up. That's how long it should take for food to show up. On top of it, she handed me the mug with tea in it with the shot glass of whiskey on the side and lied to me and said she put some whiskey in the tea already but she brought me more on the side. The tea had no alcohol in it and no honey either. My friends drinks didn't arrive very quickly either and they ordered beer that simply needs to be poured in a glass. Talk about shitty customer service... I'm a server and I would never slack that hard or lie to my customers if I made a mistake like forgetting to put whiskey in a hot toddy. I would just make them a new one because I have this thing called common sense. The best thing I have to say about this place is that the atmosphere was cool and they had yummy house made chips. This place has potential but needs improvement in service and needs to have an accurate menu.

rLGg6yXm9O6jBhr_xsyOGg.text: Haven't been to this place in Months and they charged my card today for $50. My buddy had a $10 tab and they charged him $200. Make sure you pay cash, they clearly don't have things figured out.

GZWxK5gY_DREso4DbTpg4Q.text: I've been here a few times and had a great experience. Not tonight.  Got seated, a server walked by us about 6 times and complained about what a "shit storm" it was there to another server and constantly complained. She  finally came over  then decided to have a seat next to me...really. Started to complain about how busy she is.  Not one apology about making us wait. Told her to get up then she got an attitude for it, basically threw a temper tantrum.   We order and she kept walking by, talking to other servers and smirking,etc. An hour later still didn't get our food.  Went to leave and the waitress told us to have a good night with a smirk on her face. Then after telling her to fuck off so kindly the table she was at obviously already knew what happened and started yell at us and called my husband and asshole. Really,  this is how you treat people!?!  Well Mr. Fine, if you are ok with servers talking down about customers to other customers then I guess your ok with your patrons talking down about you and your family to others around Las Vegas.  So disappointed by this.  If your servers are that vindictive for us asking her to get up from our table I can imagine what they do when they get their feelings hurt.

6_kiUjdZt8fAgh9nuUtcEw.text: After my initial visit, I returned several times to PKWY. On one occasion I made a reservation for a party of 8 in the patio on a Sunday evening and upon arrival the hostesses knew nothing about the reso. The drinks took FOREVER on this night as the outdoor bar was not open and our sever had 0 personality.   My most recent visit to PKWY definitely left a sour  taste in my mouth as we were denied entry into the venue. We had a group of about 20 people... Half the party were already inside and half were waiting for the rest of the party. There were 2 people in our party who took a swig from a bottle of liquor at their car and when we proceeded to walk to the entrance the security rudely shouted that he would not be allowing any of us into his bar because we were drinking in the parking lot. He then proceeded to mutter some other rude comments to our group. I understand rules are rules and perhaps he was just doing his job, however there was no reason for him to treat us or speak to us in the manner that he did especially since he is a representative of PKWY Tavern and therefore we are his customers/patrons. I thought it was also quite a bit racist of him to then ask every Asian person walking to the door if they were in our party... Wth.  Anyways we took our party of 20 to Born & Raised (BAR) on Warmsprings and Buffalo and had a fabulous night!   I would avoid PKWY on their "busy nights" as it seems like it is a complete $h*t show with security men going on power hungry tirades... Not to mention I probably ruined my tires having to drive over rocks in their overflow parking lot.

_x6hDvmH63veCeIvbt2MDQ.text: I'm so disappointed with last night. This is one of our favorite bars to go to for both drinking and eating. It's so fun, they have so many games like pool, bowling, jumbo jenga, and more! It's great for birthdays. They also have multiple bars in here. There's one out doors where there's sometimes live performances, and inside! It's in the perfect spot too. Right off Flamingo and 215. One of my favorite parts too is that there's a pokestop there too haha. If you don't like loud music, don't come here. .3  After a rough and tiring day at work (for both my boyfriend and I) we decided to come here for food and a beer. Most of the time, eating out is about 45 minutes anywhere we go. We got here at 11:50 and didn't leave til 1:20. After sitting, it took over 10 minutes to get a hi from our server. Another 5 for menus from a busser. She came by right after and took our drink orders It took about 5-10 to get our drinks. She took our food order right after. My boyfriend got a michelada and ask for it to be extra spicy. It wasn't spicy at all so he let it sit for 10 minutes before we were able to get someones attention. It took us 20 minutes after ordering to get our appetizer (we were about 40 minutes in at this point). 2 minutes after that to get plates and silverware. The meals came out about 10 minutes after which is just standard. After we ate, it took about 5 minutes to get the bill and 15 for her to swipe the card. By this point it wasn't busy anymore and I was annoyed again. We just wanted a decently quick meal and it was taking forever for even the check out process.   For the appetizer, we got the poutine tater tots. It had gravy and feta cheese. The gravy needed more salt, but it's nothing we can't do ourselves. The feta made the whole dish. I thought it was such an odd combination, but it worked out really well! I was craving nachos, but the stout stroganoff was calling my name. My man got the monte cristo. The stroganoff was soo worth that wait. The egg noodles were cooked perfectly. The meat was prime rib, it had amazing mushrooms, and had onions! The sauce was just amazing. Huge portion! The monte cristo was amazing as well. The jelly made it for me. It has swiss, ham, turkey, bacon, and jelly! It had a side of potatoes and they were very crispy and delicious.   It was busy, I understand. I'm not mad at the server Ashley. My boyfriend had her surprise him with what beer to put in the michelada and she put the most expensive beer which is a great way to hit sales marks and upsell. I blame management for not properly scheduling people. She was so over worked. One server, 1 or 2 bus men, and I think a manager (he was in a green shirt.) Really? They know this place is always busy. Coming from two people who have worked in restaurants for years, it's easier to over staff and cut some hours than to have one server take care of the whole inside area. Over staffing won't kill you. The company will make the money back the day after.

9onbSsA2w2bCnFwE36ayoA.text: For how popular and packed PKWY gets during the weekend, I'm very surprised at their current 3 star rating!   Location is right off of the 215 and Flamingo. This is in the boonies compared to where I live (30+ min drive) but every once in a while for a special occasion (friend's birthday celebration or a coworker's going away party) I'll make the journey out here.  The inside is ginormous. Literally a huge tavern. There's inside seating, bars, and games (pool, bowling, etc.) and an small area outside with a bar and more games (corn hole, beer pong, etc.) The first time I came to PKWY I felt like I was in a frat house. Very young crowd - like being back in college. People say this place is similar to Gold Spike downtown because of the games but the outside area at GoldSpike is MUCH larger than at PKYWY.  I haven't tried the food here and the drinks are a little pricier than the average local spot. I went last Saturday and ordered 4 beers and 2 cocktails. My tab was around $50 averaging a little over $8/drink.  Justin was working at the bar and he was awesome! They were crazy busy but it didn't phase him and he made it seem like he was actually having fun. It really makes a difference when your bartender's pleasant every time you order a drink at a packed bar. The other times I've been to PKWY I've never had an issue with the service. Bartenders are pretty attentive to anyone who approaches the bar and it's not a difficult task to get another drink as it can be at other busy bars.   The ambiance and energy here is fun and I've enjoyed PKWY Tavern the few times I've been. Would I go every weekend? No, but I personally think they're doing a great job of attracting the type of clientele who will enjoy this spot regularly!

_Yr53wR39mlbEltcCpO4ew.text: PKWY is just like Gold Spike, not as big and awesome but closer to home. They get so busy, you don't really get to enjoy a game since another party is waiting to use it next. They should definitely offer more outdoor seating since it gets awkward just standing around waiting for a table. The food is actually decent...can't go wrong with bar food while enjoying a few drinks! The service lacks big time, I always feel like I wait longer than usual for drinks, menus, to be served...everything. In fact, the lovely lady who helps out in the bathroom has way better customer service skills than most staff there.

8gR0FrNLLd4_nNXR36JGow.text: Really cool place it was our first time and we're leaving with a new app, T-shirts and a reservation for the UFC 199 on Saturday.   Positives: the fish and chips and the corn dog app the mustard is good though to swim in!!! #amazing, all the beers are cool, join the pkwy team and get the app it's 1000% worth it.   Negative: the mozzarella cheese app was blah at best and it was weird to find green peppers in the quesadilla, maybe it's just me.   Helpful note: Wait to make a reservation for anything until after u get all the welcome emails from signing up for the app! We signed up then 10 minutes later reserved and paid $140 ($100 minimum +$40 in fees) for a table that we could have gotten for no min, could have saved $40, i'm assuming. :(  All in all your paying for the awesome atmosphere and knowledge of your waiter/waitress.   **update** We went today for the hockey game and Ufc fight. I have to say I'm not a fan of the food. I got chicken and waffles and the chicken tasted like deep fried hockey pucks. You'll also find the "chef" or whom ever really likes their food spicy, which is a drag for someone who doesn't like everything that enters my mouth to be spicy. Lost a star since the food today and the other day wasn't great...I guess I'll stick to the corndogs!!

uiHoYGgkdFZSZhs0A_4GEA.text: If it weren't for being the "in" place right now I probably wouldn't come here.  Parking is always a mess, the bartenders are sarcastic, rude, and not attentive what so ever, and it's always overcrowded.    Need I mention that when I was at the bar a girl next to me was closing out her tab and the bartender didn't even ask for the name just pulled out all of the credit cards he had and she said "that one".  It looked like mine because we both have southwest credit cards.  This was extremely worrisome as i had a tab open and if this is the way the bartenders handle credit cards, something needs to be reevaluated.  I'm a beverage manager and if my bartenders acted this way there would be a serious problem.    The drinks are reasonably priced and the crowd is always fun, that's the plus.    There are games so a lot of people would compare this to Gold Spike, I don't see it personally.  Also, the security staff is worthless.  My first night coming here there was someone that was beyond intoxicated, we were even thinking he was maybe on drugs because it was so bad, we notified security and they didn't do anything.  Finally they saw he was out of control and they did something and then an hour later he was back in the place.    If you haven't been i would check it out to make your own opinion, but I don't think I'll be back.

XhwgTSgc1ur4q99SMLnUyw.text: Wow! Near my house! Probably one of my favorite bars in the world! It's always alive! So many people.  Food is decent for a bar.... You have tons of stuff to do Mega jenga, ping pong, pool tables, mini bowling alleys, and more! Awesome place Crowd is mixed If your looking for a real place with real people and real atmosphere that is the right place for you.

8nPTvcvRdO455Zh3uUDdWg.text: PKWY on Flamingo is a fantastic neighborhood tavern to hang out.  The vibe varies from the chill morning/day experience to the fun party scene at night.  The bartenders, servers, bussers, cooks, security staff and managers are all super friendly and attentive.  The beer club and patio games have been an awesome way to get to meet so many new friends - every time we come in we see friendly faces.  You can pretty much see any game you want on their tv's.  All this makes it the best bar on the west side. Luckily for the rest of the Valley there's another PKWY Tavern at Tivoli Village and on Marks Street in Henderson. Both of those locations have awesome staff as well. If you haven't been, you're missing out!! If you come in and see me come say hi.

sErJZS8tteMSjffCWvmREQ.text: I'm very surprised at myself that I have yet to leave a review of this spot yet. I guess since the last time I was there before this past weekend was probably my high school reunion in June (which if you need to plan an event, highly recommend them! They were awesome to work with and gave us SO much space exclusively!).  This location is a bit far for us, but up until a couple years ago (pre-friends having babies and getting weird work schedules), my friend and I frequented this location almost every weekend. After 10 p.m., it definitely turns into a party with a loud DJ, hipster-cool kid vibes, etc. We happened to come for their pre-Life is Beautiful event this past weekend. They had a block party vibe going on, which was pretty cool. There was a ball pit, some cool light up things you could sit on (though they kind of looked like they could also tip over at any given point given some drunken shenanigans), and even a waterslide, which I don't think was super popular, seeing as how the venue is a bar, not a waterpark LOL.  All in all, we definitely have enjoyed some really great times and amazing memories. One of my best friend's even met her fiance here a few years ago, so you just never know! This place has a special place in my heart, too, just because it's really a fun place to drink and hang out with friends. Highly recommend, especially if you're in your twenties or thirties!

59aQe9w0jiQDNhPcHnOTZA.text: I was hoping this could be a new "go to spot" since we are moving close by. We stood around waiting to se if we were supposed to seat ourselves or wait for a server/host. No one was there & no signage. Nice outdoor patio at least but its 113 degrees water mist wouldnt even be comfortable in this heat! We then continued to "wait" with no server for awhile which is always frustrating. People walked by but no one came to tell us they were our server. Finally someone came over but she was unfortunately frazzled the entire time so it was stressful for us the patrons as well. The manager said they were trying to help her out but i mean it was dead inside so...maybe thats just not your calling if you cant handle three tables. You arent in the weeds.  Got our food-jalapeno popper egg rolls, decent tasting but not w the jelly. Maybe ranch or something else. We never got any refills bc our waitress was non existent so the host came and did it for us which was appreciated. I got chicken fingers and tater tots. I asked if the chicken for the sliders was frozen or fresh she didnt seem to know she said they come frozen so...I wish staff was educated regarding all facets of the food so they know the answers. No buffalo sauce had to ask again for that then my guest asked for extra sliced pickled on his burger and it came w one pickle spear snd then was told "oh we dont even have those pickles" wait  so you let him order extra of something you dont even HAVE? gISnWcCHHLQrmNLtrUYQfw.text: My friends and I came here for their karaoke night. It was super fun! They had a DJ that played music with music videos in between people who sang karaoke. It was a very vibrant and fun atmosphere.  If you weren't singing you could also play with giant jenga blocks.  We ordered some appetizers that were pretty good. The bbq chicken wings were SO spicy so it was hard to eat but they were tasty. The jalapeno egg roll poppers weren't spicy - more cheesy - but they were okay. _wBGy_W2tbZ6LIbS4aCw7g.text: Finally made it out to the infamous PKWY tavern..  I came on a weeknight and it was surprisingly somewhat busy. PKWY seems more like a sports bar combined with a bar/club scene (more so on the weekends.) I'd say there were about 20-30 other people, mainly in the bar area. I'm sure on the weekends it gets much more packed. They have a variety of card/board games, bowling, pool, and some other games outside that I didn't get to see since it was raining.   DRINKS: If you enjoy various types of craft beer then PKWY should be right up your alley. The menu was packed with different IPAs, ciders, stouts, etc. There were some unique variations (Mango, strawberry, marshmallow??) as well as a few local breweries.   FOOD: I got an order of their fried pickles and these are different than the ones I've had before. I was expecting sliced pickles but they give you long, quartered pickles instead. I actually like this a lot better! The batter is more of a tempura batter, light and crispy. 9/10 recommend trying.   SERVICE: I was expecting the lackluster service you get at crowded bars but all of our servers were extra attentive. They checked up on us almost every 10 minutes, refilling our waters and drinks. Maybe it's because I came on a slower night but our servers had no trouble being efficient and quick.   TIP: They have various events throughout the month so be sure to check out their calendar. There's a Stoplight Valentines party, Ladies Night on Thursday's... oh and all the events have cheap drink specials too!   Another cool thing I noticed was their electric car charging ports! So if you wanna swing by in your Tesla then you can charge while you grab a beer haha.  All in all this place seems like a step up above your average pub. I'll be back on a weekend to see what it's like then.

p6N_1p3o_2VTV3Ia1kDjtA.text: Food is horrible.   Ambiance: Music on the clock radio speakers is really loud. Music selection is horrible like food.   I'm pretty sure we swore this place off two years ago after going there for food and the subsequent trip(s) to the bathroom. Silly on our part to forget this level of awfulness.   Do not order the Philly Cheesesteak. 'Meat' is weird and cheese probably is of the "just add water" verity. They could take this sandwich off the menu and that alone would bump my review up to 2 stars.

1riF06u5hRyn2OLungbUTQ.text: Thank you for the manager to response to the review. I appreciate that you do concern. We are planning to go back soon.

lCjS46Is_uidQrrp_nEiYg.text: We used to go to this place when it was Roadrunner saloon so we thought we would try out the new place. First thing that hits you when you walk in is the college type atmosphere. The entire patio is Astroturf where you can play games or beer pong while you drink. Although that isn't really my kind of scene I was willing to give the food a try since the menu looked decent. The menu is pretty basic, burgers, wraps, salads etc. Although if you want a steak salad be ready to fork over $18! We ordered fried pickles, the big Texan burger and chipotle chicken sliders. First the negatives...the pickles were burnt, the burger way too salty and both the onions and jalapenos on it were fried so there was no variety of texture, the chicken sliders were dry and not seasoned very well. The positives... The waitress was great and they have 250 different kinds of beer. Bottom line if you're looking for somewhere to drink with a good variety of beer and you like the college vibe you will probably like this place. If you are looking for a good meal...you should probably keep looking.

yUFnB3qo60tabxL9GCpSMQ.text: I decided to come here simply because of the hype, I've heard nothing but good things about this place so I obviously had high expectations. I wish I had no expectations because it's not everything I imagined. For starters, there's a patio in the front with picnic tables where picnic type games can be played, it's got a downtown/Goldspike feel to it, which if I were to go anywhere for that, I would prefer downtown. Inside though, there is a small bowling lane (2 lanes I think!) and a couple pool tables which is nice for the large amount of crowds they bring in..now speaking of the crowds, this place looks like it's for a young crowd but there was a very diverse group when I went. When we went to grab a seat at the bar, it looked like the only seats available were gaming chairs so we grabbed a booth instead. Now I know all bars aren't stocked with supplies for specialty drinks but they just had a plain old regular bar so I got a Moscow Mule with Goose in it and ordered some food. Now for the food, I give 4.5 stars, no complaints but definitely not 5 star worthy. The drinks, I give a 2, and for the lack of better options, and next time I'll definitely go with beer! They have little beer dispensers you can purchase for your table which would be awesome especially for large groups of people. I wouldn't ever voluntarily come here again, but I wouldn't mind coming to grab a quick beer.

vkLiLa3d45NAmiDhCAbKFA.text: Ordered the bacon cheeseburger sliders and the chicken & waffle sliders and they were AMAZING. Chicken was perfectly crispy and the cheeseburgers were sooo good. Both a lot better than anticipated! Definitely will order again.

M02R7JdscUmfLjDFqRAZ7g.text: Love this bar! 24 hours! If you've ever been, i would compare it a mini Gold Spike from Downtown. The bar/ restaurant is both inside and outside. There's lots of tv's mainly inside and some outside too, which is great for watching sports and they even play UFC and other fights too! The parking lot is kind of small compared to the huge crowd this place brings so expect to park on the dirt most of the times. Huge beer selection! And their food is ur basic American cuisine such as burgers, wings, sandwiches, etc. I tried the Cheesy Potato Skins, they were actually really good that we ordered and second plate lol. The only thing i would change from this place is for them to have more appetizer options. Just because a lot of people come here mainly to drink and not so much for a full meal, so just kind of wished they had more shareable options or small playes.

I've been to PKWY Tavern twice and both times were not busy at all. I was sitting in the middle of the restaurant and just ordered beers. I was constantly having to flag down the waitresses just trying to get them to acknowledge me at all. They walked by our table all the time, but never stopped. And when we did get to finally order, it would be another eon of waiting before we got our beers. NNquCyfAcH_VIpnGceF-hg.text: I'm so terribly disappointed in this place. I spent my birthday here and had a great experience with the bar service. But I came back tonight and waited for 15 minutes before I left. I was sitting at a booth with my hubby and we were ignored by at least 4 waitresses. Not even an offer of water. Evidently a party out on the patio for some big shot couldn't even muster up decent service, let alone good service. So thank you PKWY Tavern, I won't be back. I'll take my money to establishments that are more appreciative of my patronage.

cT9diBGqLqgj-qGzp213aQ.text: Well...thought it would be a new place to try. The amount of flies is very off-putting.  They could at least hang some tape to capture the flies. My hubby ordered soup and salad and I just wanted a simple grilled cheese with soup. It comes with Texas toast. I asked for it to be made with whole grain toast Instead and our waiter said there's absolutely no exceptions. Something so simple to change right? Guess it's asking too much. Oh and if you need a high chair for your child (because holding your toddler in your hand with a handbag and a baby bag clearly doesn't indicate that you may need one ) you will have to go get it yourself in the back almost entering the kitchen area.

xFRfyzd8bLG4qvGSN-7FeA.text: Service is very slow. We were there 3 hours for chicken wings and 2 burgers.  The "featured beers" are out of stock. No soup on the menu. Basic bar food. Don't sit on the patio. They will forget you are there even if you track the waitstaff down and tell them. And then they forget your order. Manager is a jerk. Very not helpful. Definitely NOT a dog friendly patio. Just don't go. Lots of other great beer places in town.

gBazXNydLro11QFwhZ0W7g.text: I have yet to eat here so take it with a grain of salt. Great place with a Gold Spike vibe, expect  a WAY better beer selection. Bartenders are quick and move a ton of drinks! Great location, prices, and staff! Will be back!

Q2nBZ-pIHRmiCuakFXyvhw.text: I walked up to the bar finishing off a delicious glazed donut and the man checking our ids told me I needed to finish the donut outside before I walked in so I hurried and shoved it in my mouth and chocked! We had to call the ambulance and I almost died! I will never come back here again!

g2r4CsUHIhFa0KaibTOkWw.text: This bar has it all... Someone put a lot of thought and work into this establishment. I would have left five stars except for the fact that they need to work on their waitresses / customer service. As soon as this waitress walked up there was no introduction it was " what can I get you?" We ordered some appetizers and drinks... The onion rings were so good that we ordered an extra side... At that point she made the face as if we were some blobs ordering excessively. No more than five minutes later they knew set of guests sat next to us. At that point she did what I have never seen. Instead of going and getting them of fresh set of menus see straight looked over at us took our menus and gave them to the guest. Keep in mind we haven't even ordered yet. We gave her a face like what the hell just happened. Noticing us she looked at us as if we were unreasonable replied "I'll get you new menus". So we finally ordered and waited patiently... After about 15 minutes I got my hamburger but still have not gotten my wife's  fish and chips. Thinking it would be out within the next 5 minutes we waited... Finally we decided to ask her what's going on with the rest of the meal and she gave me the oh crap look and replied with " let me check on those for you" (crap I forgot. .let me put them in). Another 15 minutes later we get the rest of our meal. We needed a little salt and I was regretting having to ask her... When I finally did there was another weird face as if we were asking way too much. Long story short this waitress needs a serious retraining or a pep talk to brighten up her day. Restaurant and atmosphere was superb. I don't want to say any names ** cough Kara cough**.

hKmsD86YTuLi5-IcIoSqSg.text: The service here is awful.  I don't want to blame it on the staff because I  always  get the excuse; "We are short staffed," or "I am brand new." The food is hit or miss...and  they just changed the menu! The only constant is the beer. The beer and selection is great.  They have also done a great job with the atmosphere. Need to work on improving on customer and quality of service.

oBW39hq1D8G32KEHzuZYZg.text: This is my second time here. I really love it here. They have EVERYTHING okay! They have ping pong table, pool tables, Jenga, live music, flat screen TVs. Food is good. Good vibes. The service was awesome, especially Lauren. She's really nice. Will be back again for sure since it's nearby where I live.

2ryNowkUsEF1q01F7aFcKA.text: I literally live right down the street from PKWY so it is a very convenient bar for me to go to. The prices for food and drinks are average. The craft beer prices may be a little on the high side but that's how it is in Vegas everywhere. I would definitely recommended the chicken fingers. They are by far the best bar food choice on the menu. The best nights to go are Wednesday's, Friday's, and Saturdays. It can get crowded but not matter what it is a good time. UFC nights are also very busy but they show them for free so what do you expect. They need to pave the parking lot and the inside could use some disinfecting. Overall it is a great bar with a great atmosphere.

E4lqVz7J10tyM4ZAx28wMQ.text: Worst food ever. Salmon is dry as a plank of wood, flat bread is greasy and yuck, chicken fingers tasted like there's cinnamon in it. And it's dry and crusty. Plus we had no silverware. No napkins. Terrible.

_8aa6fahCewLk6xuwFnCFg.text: Poor service, EVERYTIME! Food is OK, go when it's slow. Gaming is ok. Big screens for watching sports. They are known for their beers so if you are a wine drinker, they have the worst. The service is just so bad, I don't know if the company is just too cheap to hire more people or what!

n_eiOQ25OybsiktPMfZ2QA.text: I don't know why people give this place a lower rating than 5 stars? My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our evening here tonight....the happy hour hour food and drink specials were great! Our server...I forgot her name but she was very friendly and fast!  We'll be back very soon....can't wait!

8-mSqb_D83TLNwVzTxz7Nw.text: Came here during Happy Hour (by myself...)  Was seated at a booth.    Server #1 asked what I'd like to drink, I said do you have a beer list, she said she'd bring one.  Never saw her again.  Server #2 stopped by, asked what I'd like to drink.  Said I was waiting for a beer list.  Never saw her again.  Server #3 stopped by, asked what I'd like to drink.  Said I was waiting for a beer list.  She said they were "short" on beer lists, but that I could download one from an app.  She left.  I started gathering my things together to leave...  Server #4 stopped by, asked what I'd like to drink.  Told her I was in the process of leaving, as apparently they have no beer lists.  She said they were short on beer lists, but within 15 seconds she appeared with one.  Server #5 stopped by (after I had a beer in front of me), said "nice to see you again"???  [Unbelievably] before I left, Server #6 stopped by, to ask if everything was ok?  Too many "cooks" in the kitchen... except they weren't in the kitchen.  PS And a Stella during Happy Hour was an incredible $7.79...

vFFk_TfzgAPH9g3igIX0Zw.text: This place is always busy. If you're into beer pong this is your spot. I really hate the parking lot I think they should work on that. The hostesses are friendly and the waitress was nice but the food is mediocre. I ordered the chicken and waffle sliders and they were very dry and the chicken had no flavor my friend got the buffalo sliders and those were very bland too. The fries were good but you can get fries anywhere. I think I'll be back just to have drinks next time.

Mx7WS2bDo7LQsG9L4YJBeA.text: This was a great vibe. I loved the games. The nachos were some of the most delicious nachos I've had in a while. The beer was yummy and the bartender was really cool. All around great vibe..... the only reason this was not 5 Stars was because the DJ was very rude to me. I was there last Thursday. I'm hoping he is not there next time I go back. WVC-IEGyIMDOqEBNeMcAmw.text: I have been here several times and had ok service, tonight? THE. WORST. SERVICE. EVER!!!!  Ok, it's a Knights game and somewhat busy (been here when it was way busier). Got there at 6:10pm, ordered food at 6:30, 7:20 rolls around and I finally tell our waitress we are starving, she says "do you want to order food?"  Seriously? We ordered food 50 minutes ago!!! This place is a joke & the menu actually sucks as far as decent bar food goes. They have busboys running around with food and they have no idea where it's going. The wait staff is not on top of anything. To top things off we had to sit on the patio and it was really cold out. Do you think they could turn the heaters on? Nope!! WILL NOT BE BACK!!!

OEnxnl9iccULzBTgw050WA.text: I want to love this place.  It has lots of TVs, games, and cool decor, not to mention it is close to home, but they make it impossible.  My first few visits weren't terrible, but not fantastic either.  The food was average, but edible.  The staff seemed to have an arrogance about them that was slightly irritating, but tolerable.  I went for lunch about a month ago and had a good experience.  Food was good, and service great.    Since then, it has been horrible.  The day after my lunch there, I went for dinner.  I had the worst burger I can remember.  It was so badly overcooked, it was like a hockey puck, even though I ordered it medium rare.  The pork belly was also way overcooked.  At least the service was decent.  My next visit, the food was decent, but the service was so bad, my friends and I now have this to compare all bad service with.  She set the new low standard!  After a couple weeks away, I returned.  I figured that I would just avoid sitting in that terrible server's section.  I sat in a set in being served by someone new to me.  Wow, she must be friends with the other one.  Bad service twins!  Actually, to be fair, she wasn't as bad as the other one, but she was bad enough for inspire me to write this review.  These incidents are enough to show that they have a management problem.  One bad apple is one too many.  When there are multiple, that is enough to bankrupt a business. As a manager in the customer service industry, it is obvious to me that they have a culture that is poisonous.  While they probably feel that they are busy and don't need all the business they can get, they are seriously wrong.  It doesn't take much for the tide to shift.    Just check the Yelp ratings.  Three stars with a few hundred reviews is something to be embarrassed about.  All of those customers can't be wrong.

iCpqVYOCl_GkcyMEVMhzKw.text: PKWY Tavern is a fun Vegas locals bar with an impressive list of beer (over 250 named), decent bar food, and dozens of inside and outside games laid out to get you fraternizing with others.  We Uber'd here with a large group of friends this past Saturday night. They were surprised how cheap the drink prices were and had fun perusing the beer list while trying their best to win at everything.   We were able to play mini bowling on PKWY's two lanes with 7 people. Super fun, but at $3 per round per person I may not call for a rematch, but still I'd say it's worth it for atleast one go. After a few more drinks I may not have cared.   PKWY Tavern has created a pretty interactive phone app where you can log in, track how many drinks you've ordered against their local leaderboard, get prizes for using the app and tallying drinks ordered, and follow which beers you've tried and recommendations of others to try in the future. You get a free shirt just for downloading the app and scanning in with your server.   They seemed to have perfected the socialization of the bar, but my only recommendation is to clean their outside tables and games more regularly. Though he may have been joking, I had a friend turn down an offer to play giant Jenga for fear of transmittable disease. Albeit it was sticky from prior players.   With that being said, this is the best late night bar around for 20 somethings to 30 somethings.

fMdknhQnQvViItth9vX_dA.text: Very beautiful spot really fun great bartenders fun music and the crowd is great awsome spot to hang out with a group of friends

ArBQXLQ1Lc40dMs0aOlv7Q.text: They allow smoking inside...enough said. Beautiful patio and our friends go outside the parking lot wall to smoke and this place allows smoking inside the restaurant...while you're eating. Guess they can slide by the no smoking inside law

jOVtHbfc7O1qJFIQwTOefQ.text: Not what I expected.  Got there and didn't see any staff with a smile.  Half the patrons sitting at gaming machines were even playing and bartenders that didn't care that I wanted to gamble, drink and tip them while I played.  Was told this was the place to watch a Bronco game , guess not.  Sorry folks but they are right when they say only complainers do Yelp. But I say don't make us complainers.

svyMNQ5dcqTcQ2ayL0Zazw.text: Don't go there when there is a major sports game, such as the Golden Knights playoffs, I went there around 6:30 pm and game was going to start at 7:00 pm, 90% of the tables were empty with a reserved sign. You can't even buy the table, they said all tables were reserved from the previous game. We asked the waiterss  if she can find us somewhere to sit, and for the time being we sat down at a dirty table just to see if she can find us a table, the waitress said  let me check with the manager, a security guy walked up to us and looked like he is ready to punch someone, and asked us to leave the table,  I replied that she is checking with the manager if she can find us a table. His reply  "I'm the manager and you gotta leave" so yeah we left.  Decided to check another bar, end up going down the road to SG bar and they sat us right away, the manager Dan at SG was very nice and actually looked like a manager that cares about the business and not like someone trying to pick up a fight.  #GOKNIGHTSGO

o9Jsvp0nGcLYvo_dZyE7iw.text: This place is probably now in my TOP 3 for local bars in Las Vegas!  This place used to be a roadrunner and man oh man they upgraded this place!  So this place took a bit of Gold Spike and they have over sized Jenga, Pool, a deer hunting game, Mini Bowling -- you read that correctly ..... and a ping pong table.  The beer selection is too crazy to type out here.  A lot of craft beers and a lot of options for food.  Speaking of food I had some sliders and fries and it was actually pretty good.  This place is pretty big but it needs to be because its always crowded.    There is a UNLV Running Rebels section which I thought was pretty awesome.  There is also a nice courtyard area thats on your right when you first walk in.  It was winter time while I was out there but I bet its super cool (Like a biergarten) in the spring and summer.  Theres a little mini bar outside.  BTW The bartender that hooked it up with the ping pong balls thank you for being cool as f***.  This place is super fun.... My only complaint is they need to knock a wall down because its too small for the crowd they get.  This place is big so you can imagine how many peeps are there.  I want to say there is at least 100-150 people there around 2100-TBD.  Even if you aren't a local I recommend this place to get away from the strip and see an awesome sports bar!  Bangkok, like Las Vegas, sounds like a place where you make bad decisions. - Todd Phillips

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dear sweet friend Patty lost a bet so She must wear my Packers Ugly sweater and my cheadlocks . Great Sport
Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar Sliders w/ fries!

UAtrtvEX2tiiDJKF71PiOQ.text: I've been looking forward to trying this place since a few friends mentioned it. We sat in the dining area to avoid the football crowd for breakfast. We were seated fast and ordered drinks. It wasn't that busy but took a long time to get. The menu was reasonable and decided on steak and eggs. The food was delivered faster because they have a food runner, not the slower waitress/cocktail server. I ordered rare and my wife medium. When the food arrived they were both medium rare, I guess that's all they could manage that day. I was looking forward to trying the breakfast potatoes but  was sadly disappointed. They were cold and tasted like they had been sitting awhile.  After the waitress finally came back to the table and asked if we wanted anything more while clearing the table, we said no. We sat for more than a reasonable amount of time had to ask another server for the check. Maybe we just caught them on a bad day and may try again for lunch or dinner another time, but not promising.

wg81nLFWZzgddU_DKdf00g.text: Went and met a bunch of friends last night at PKWY Tavern. The place is very popular, especially during the VGK games! There were definitely some hiccups with the service our party received after the game had finished. The servers here are extremely overwhelmed. Members of our party had ordered appetizers...only half of them were delivered to the table. Drinks were mixed incorrectly, and one of my friends (who was the first to order anything in our group) did not receive her food order or her drink for almost an hour. Also, finding a manager for a medical or teacher discount is like asking the bartenders to move mountains. Would definitely eat something at home before coming here on a Friday night!

8L7v_N3P8jvx39FaOoCT7A.text: Whatever you do, do not go here for lunch during the week. We have been here twice now and both times have been bad service. It's almost as if the ownership doesn't want to be open for lunch. No host/hostess both times. 1 wait staff for the whole place while the bartenders just sat there chatting and not helping in any way. At least run the damn drinks for the poor waitress who was obviously overwhelmed. Took 15 min for the waitress to come to our table, another 15 to get drinks, and then a good 30 min to finally get our lunch. The manager or whatever he is was busy staring at some report or God know what while his patrons were being underserved. We won't be back. Advertising join them for the Superbowl..yeah if you want 1 drink the entire game. Place has great potential but is being run by obvious uncaring or incompetent staff. Good luck!

afT1t2Xz0QYYk8rPaEGoBA.text: I usually love coming to this place -- this is my third time here -- I went on 4/9/2017 at around 1pm... The hostess was very friendly and seated us very quickly. We waited a good amount of time and our "server" never arrived. We asked someone cleaning a table if we could get someone. After some time, no one ever came to our table.   I saw TWO servers walk in and out of the kitchen multiple times (they didn't have food or trays either times). I can understand if the restaurant/bar portion was packed or super busy and having to wait a significant amount of time. Sadly, no one ever came to our table. This was the first time that I have ever walked out of an establishment (we didn't even have water). We left our menus on the hostess table and ate another restaurant.   I asked my friend this morning if she has ever had lunch here and she said "yes, but the service is really bad" and I didn't even tell her about what had happened yet. I gave this place two stars, because the food I have had there is actually very good. However, the service is something that needs to be worked on.   I don't think I will be returning to this establishment, until the service is improved.

Pwz1kLnBlywf31gscdHOoA.text: Absolutely terrible experience every time we went. No more. fr_Onww_BmWbSxvkvfnuFA.text: This place is awesome!!! Very large space with multiple bars, plenty of seating room, and a wonderful patio with picnic style tables that you can gather around with your friends and play a wide selection of board games that they offer! The food is good too - typical (slightly heavy but fresh and tasty) bar food which is great when you've been drinking!

gxepzPzmNnRQJfgN_T5ZjA.text: We were curious how the renovation came out, so we stopped in for lunch and was not impressed.  I could see this place as a big hangout during football season, for the food is mostly bar type food and indoor and outdoor seating can handle big groups, but we won't be returning anytime soon.  There are two pool tables, bowling, a large connect four, wooden jenga, and ping pong to keep you busy, and plenty of parking.  We ordered the chicken strips and pulled pork sandwich.  The chicken strips were really good, but the onion rings were fried with a weak batter and did not taste good. The cole slaw had that plastic taste like it was poured from a container, not fresh.  The pulled pork sandwich was tasty, or at least the sauce was, but the meat was dry.  We also ordered jalapeno poppers, which I really love, but these were Velveeta cheese placed in a dough cone, and jalapeno so small I beg to find the jalapeno.  You weren't biting into a jalapeno at all, just cheese siphoned into a dough wrap.  Some really cool drink specials are advertised for happy hour which I see as big hits, but we won't be returning for lunch or dinner anytime soon.

VB1UMk1ZOLB6v8eu0e9kmQ.text: Spent my birthday here last night and it was crowded inside, the outdoor patio is where I wanted to be but it was closed. I asked if it could open and since I had 20 people there they gladly turned on the heaters and set it up for us to be outside. It was as if we had our own party there just for us!!! It was so much fun. Large connect four, JENGA, beer pong. So many fun things to do! The staff was great and the SHRIMP IS SOOOO GOOD!!! The variety of beers is amazing. Wells banana nut bread beer is my absolute favorite and I've never had it on tap! I highly recommend this place and I WILL be back for future events! Thank you to the staff for making my birthday a great one.

db-HeP_S-2QnQH8xuRdd-Q.text: I really wanted to like this place based on the beer selection alone.   The service was some of the slowest I've ever had. It took better than 20 minutes to get the beer we ordered, even though we were assured it was on it's way out about 5 minutes after it was ordered. The second beer we ordered was even worse with the wait time. We order, she leaves, presumably to put the order in, then comes back to tell us the beers are "on the way out," then COMES BACK to the table to tell us that one of the beers ordered is no longer offered... So what was on the way out?!  The food was... okay at best. It wasn't horrible at all, but it wasn't anything to go crazy over either. While we were there (on a Saturday afternoon), we saw at least 2 parties come in, seat themselves, then leave because nobody came over to wait on them.  The place itself seems like it could be a really cool spot to hang out. Lots of TVs, some pool tables, some crazy bowling alley thing, and the patio all looked like a good time, but something has got to be done about the speed of service there. I could overlook the mediocre food if everything else is in line.  All in all, I may go back, just not anytime soon.

mKKvVwwSaNZ9WAkAzU4y8A.text: The beer must be amazing because the food sure wasn't. We happened to stop by for some wings and humus. The wings were ok but the humus and fries were terrible. How can you mess that up?!? How about never again. Service was good but the food was not.

zQFhQ3BaADN9U73tAM6xoA.text: I've been going to pkwy tavern since it opened. I always go in to get my five. I visited the outside bar yesterday to see Madison. She always has a smile and is one of my favorite bartenders. She is attentive to all my needs and even though it's hot as hell outside I will sit out there to enjoy her company while enjoying my beers. Also the outside patio is the perfect place to watch the football games with every tv covering a different game as well as all the games to play during halftime.

VhWGIdTHV0ZRicCfNK1c5A.text: Great food, great beer. Just stay away on Friday night and Saturday night If you don't want to go to a "club". If you do want to go to a local spot this is the place. Not my favorite place to go on Friday night though. I go for some food and some different beer.

33Xw6A68vw9NrJYGjF1zBg.text: This place offers a great ambiance, a fun feel, and can accommodate large groups extremely well. Customer service is below average, and food floats right around average but is over priced.  I would come here with a large work group a lot and I was always surprised about how consistently bad service was.  Then I would get my check and feel annoyed.

etuh05OXkSEkYhc1lne7uw.text: Everything was so good, I'll definitely be coming back here again! The nachos were delish, as well as the mini sliders. The Dutch Baby desert is pretty good for the most part. Kinda reminded me of pancakes... Cool atmosphere.

4Xlc8d6ZoUrHXpNG1PV4Mg.text: The food was pretty good, the atmosphere was great, and the beer selection was amazing. I wanted to like this place so bad, but the service absolutely killed it. First off, let me say that our waitress was awesome. She seemed to be single handedly serving the outside seating area and was doing the best she could to service everyone. I think the problem lays with management. It appears that the establishment is severely understaffed; hire some more wait staff so that customers don't have to wait 20 minutes to be served and then have to be apologized to multiple times for the quality of service.   When our food finally came out, one person in our group ordered quesadillas with NO sour cream and a side of tater tots. His quesadilla was loaded with sour cream and and there were no tots to be seen. After sending the quesadilla back to be corrected he asked about his tots, the kitchen wait staff that was running he food out brought back a cup of salsa. After being told again that we were missing tater tots, then kitchen staff returned a second time with a cup of tarter sauce. Finally, after physically showing him the menu, tater tots were finally brought to the table.   Upper level management, based on our experience and the experience of other Yelp reviews, fix your problems. As for our waitress, AnneMari, was awesome. She's overworked. Give her a raise.

XFNQGgIKqjSUtU0dznSORA.text: Not sure why these reviews aren't very good, I love this place. Tons of games to play and usually pretty busy even on weekdays

TqXzEwppNW0jZVBpFvPEIA.text: Stopped in on a Wednesday for a quick drink with my buddy and stayed for more. The bartender Maracelia was not only friendly but very helpful in pointing us into the right direction for a great Beer. Our glasses were never empty. Great selection of beer. Great service. Will be back to sample some more great beers. Thanks to the Bar staff.

doGyMSZQyJplhvmYMTx2vA.text: Love this place! We went to the new location on marks and it was out first time.  How impressive! There is local music that plays on Tuesday nights and you can #logyourbeers on their app to earn rewards.  I even got a free shirt when I signed up, and I love sine free stuff!!!! Will definitely go again!

LHwIUNLbpbxLRWUL5iQ45Q.text: My husband had been wanting to try this place for months. We finally got a chance and he was so excited! Great vibe when you walk in lots of outdoor space and many TV screens to watch some football. The hostess gave us menus and sat us down fairly quickly. Sadly, thats where everything ended. It wasn't busy at all and there were about 4 waitresses behind the bar. And still received NO SERVICE!! We waited about 15 min then just left. Totally not worth our time. We'll stick with the Yardhouse

We had the steak quesadilla and the Cuban sandwich. Both were remarkably tasty. The seasoned fries with the Cuban were amazing.  A tad pricy for too often but definitely worth a splurge.

q80SNQlMMpexGZsZNuzE9w.text: My husband and I stopped in for the first time recently. The atmosphere is cool, but the bartender was not very attentive. It's not like he was busy, just wasn't on top of waiting on or engaging with guests. I was really hoping this was a cool spot near home.

3PVQH1TQ9hcaikORfeBjmw.text: Always way too crowded in here. Parking space is not great and the security guards can be very intimidating. Service is okay, bartenders are the best employees there in my opinion

CaiQAhKyNeJpLFkYAk0cWA.text: lots of tv's, good food, and I think it's open 24 hours.  I enjoyed my time there.

-LBcz7WfWRr1jB7lH4gGAQ.text: If you're looking for DTLV without being DT, this is your place. There is a sea of young Americans all hanging out after work or hustling the streets slanging their model head shots or club promoters or maybe even bros preaching about their Greek life playing pool, skee ball, darts ping pong, beer pong, or perhaps corn hole. Look at the bar and you might find your local wanna be cicerone drinking their nitro IPA. Outside you'll see games, and an hang out area to get bro out or get white girl wasted. On the back wall you'll see a beer list of 250 something beers, not all in stock of course (its really impossible to have such a large inventory and low prices). What they do have in stock are a mixture of local microbrews and bigger names like Firestone, Dogfish, Lindeman's or Lagunitas (pkwytavern.com/beer.php#...) and macrobrews (coors, blue moon, etc). Most of them are on draft so that is always cool! Probably not the place to look for an ultra rare beer. Prices for beers are "OK" more so on the pricey end, but someone has to pay to have this big inventory. Draft beers are either half pint or pint and average prices are $6-$10 depending on the beer. Will be a bit costly to get a decent buzz on.Food seems above average for bar food and breakfast is served all day. Although its always pretty packed here, there always seems to be space for table diners. I like that they have metal darts and not the cheap plastic kind, games are inexpensive, the bartenders work really hard and the wait for service hasn't been too bad for me. Parking sucks here because its packed all the time, so be prepared to park in the desert. Will come back when me or my friends are feeling ratchet.

bLDWiFF8qkv3CPocMo0ixQ.text: Used to love coming to this place but lately has been such a let down... We came for late night drinks tonight to celebrate a sports win and were treated by bartender who was SO rude. She wasn't wearing a name tag otherwise I would share her name to avoid. When we ordered drinks (finally) she seemed very uninterested like she wanted to be anywhere but here. Then we asked if there was a late night happy hour and she said "No why would we have that...". It was just very off putting. We enjoy the space but will probably avoid the inside bar moving forward.

dkS5EOiY1y63s5GPYSoHrw.text: A total kickback spot for anyone who enjoys drinking beers, mixed drinks, and having a good time. This easily grew to be a hangout spot for local college kids, especially on the weekends. A lot like Gold Spike, they have games such as cornhole, Jenga, and board games you can get for rent with an ID. I personally like their large selection of beers and that's what I like to drink when coming here. One annoying thing for me is that it can get packed on the weekends with college kids everywhere, and it can be a little too much. Other than that, itMs definitely a nice place to get some beers , catch up with some friends, and get some finger food to pass the time.

ykw35PtZF1zXswHc4VND0A.text: I can't stress enough what an amazing staff is at this place. Misty was knowledgeable, friendly, and overall amazing. Food and drinks were beyond exceptional. I will 100% be back. Sweet potato tots! Magical chicken strips. Great wine. Unreal assortment of beer options. This place is the best!

H2SUQSbpBRTzu89SsMZKxQ.text: I was debating not sharing my thoughts, but then I read several reviews with similar issues, so I figured I may as well do so as well.  My wife and I went in to PKWY on a UFC event, so it was understandably busy.  We walked by an empty host booth, and then walked into the main bar area.  We asked a busser if we were to seat ourselves, and his reply was "Sure, but it's fight night. You may, or may not get help."  Anyhow, we sat down, and a waitress by the name of Destiny came over and assisted us. To get it out of the way, Destiny was fantastic and salvaged the experience for us.  The first few beers we ordered were out of stock, but we still picked some good, but pricy, local beers.  My wife ordered a Caesar salad, and I ordered the chicken wings.  The food was down right horrid.  The wings were either cold or lukewarm, and the salad was room temperature with wilted lettuce, as if it had been sitting out all day.  To be fair, it was a busy night, but when you add up terrible food, overpriced beer (a local IPA shouldn't cost $7.50 a pint), and very suspect service, you get a bar that I don't see myself going back to.  Again, I will commend the waitress that ended up helping us out, because she tried hard to ensure that we were having a good experience.   I hope she finds herself at an establishment that matches her level of care and concern.

qyyfO8uu3LFvKXpsvmU1jg.text: The reason why this place is ranked low is because the workers suck. They are really short with customers. When we are paying customers. I'm glad they remodeled it here. But they need to change the staff. They slow. And the bartenders have a smart mouth. Only plus side is to this place is that cute girls come here. That's it. We saw 3 bus guys that ignored us and one waitress who was talking with a table like 5min.  Once she came to greet us with a snotty attitude from 15feet away stated "you can just seat yourselves". I asked the bartender for a Manhattan, she said it would be a minute (which is fine, obviously they're a beer bar but I just wasn't feeling beer), and she returns about 15 minutes later with a whiskey and water. Disappointing, because you can at least google what the drink is on your phone in that time.   Won't return b/c of that, and the crowd here is the worst. ujTKNVmbsWShYmX8zPSwSQ.text: Love this place! Awesome beer selection and great music. The service is always awesome, everyone is super friendly! I like that I can go there to sit and eat while having a couple drinks, or I can go on the weekends and play games and dance! I love that I can bring my friends here but I can also bring older family members and everyone has fun. When you download their app they give you a free t-shirt which is nice. And the app has a list of the many beers on tap. Their spinach dip is amazing. They give it with Pita bread which is way better than traditional tortilla chips. Their wings are also great and they come with ALOT. Love going here. It's always a great time.

e_2RScns6yuqUgRwoVVQvg.text: PKWY Tavern was always one of my favorite bars in Vegas, tonight I had a great time with friends and can I say that the bartenders and the security was very officiant and friendly , I had a women who was bartending me all night and she did a great job. I want to say that this business should have a 5 star rating but one worker ruined it for us tonight for my girlfriends birthday. Being someone who manages a restaurant business i noticed a certain employee that is capable of ruining their business . I will not mention names but I think I think they should look in how they train food runners.  I ordered food and drinks from the bartender tonight and when the food was dropped off I asked for two waters and was given a dirty look and he said "sure." I didn't think any of it and was waiting for my water then I see him at the podium looking at the customers and he obviously ignored our request for water. so I confront him and ask him what happened to the waters I asked for since we are eating and he says "that is not my job, that is the bartenders job" so I ended up going to the bar to get water . maybe I misunderstood or didn't realize that he doesn't normally get customers requests but he didn't give a care in the world. Even though it's not his job or if he hates his job isn't it common courtesy to tell us he can't give us water instead of ignoring our request ? I think this place needs to train their staff better or look into who they hire.

zPFR59_8lO-YXFx4f7EgvA.text: Customer service at this place really sucks. The employees don't look to thrilled to be there. The DJ is a total douche we were the only people in the outside area so we requested some music and he said he plays what HE wants HE gets to pick the genre and playlist for the night and denied our request. Not to mention his wife comes in and sits next to him during his shift I guess maybe she works there to? This place is really cool to hang out but they really need to step it up. 1 star for the environment.

LHosXPTJFAn5SvBq5kcbXg.text: This place is super casual and fun. It's a great place to watch sports (Go knights) but if you are going to a big game, make sure to reserve a table. It's standing room only if you don't. The bartenders are good, prices reasonable and they have a lot of games to play. I like going here because it's a good crowd usually full of locals.  The only negatives about this place come from the service. I have had multiple occasions here where I wait upwards of 30 minutes to an hour waiting on my check or for my card to be ran. Also, if you're there for a game, expect for your server to disappear for hours at a time. Luckily the hostesses are nice enough to help you when your waitress is no where to be found. We waited about an hour for our check and 20 minutes for our cards to be ran, our server checked on us twice during a 2 hour game, and though friendly, she not once apologized. As we had our cards ran, other people were trying to interrupt her since they were waiting forever too. I have worked in and respect the food industry so I understand completely how busy bars can get. But if understaffed, you should have more hands on deck during busy games. Also, they are constantly out of things on the food menu, and often serve their food differently than they explain on the menu. We once ordered fried pickles and they served ours with like some weird chunky sauce and our friends with ranch.  Then I ordered something that was supposed to come with honey mustard and it was just plain mustard. Lol. I even asked the server and she didn't know the difference. It's fine I still like this place, just hope they step up their service before I have to find somewhere else to go.

o7BjMz2jvUYOSlDRfseWaw.text: I am the leader of an alumni chapter here in town, and we have had the majority of our game watch events at this PKWY location. Being an east coast school, it was a little challenging to find a family friendly sports bar that is open for those 9 am (local time) games. Side note: do you know how weird it is to drink beer at 9 am when you are in your thirties? Thank you Bloody Marys!  The UNLV room is great for hosting small events, with comfortable seating for around 24 people. They can turn the sound on to your game, and have some shutters they can close when your team intercepts the ball, and runs 75 yards for a touch down, and things get a little "passionate."   Ann Marie has been our main server for many of these events and she with it!! Having that many separate checks can be challenging, but so far we haven't had any problems. I wish I knew the bus boy's name to recognize him, because he such a hard worker too. If you are looking to plan an event I would definitely recommend this place, the manager is very easy to work with!   I realize since all but one of my visits here was to organized events, that my experience might vary from someone just coming in to get a table (service-wise.) Food however, is the common denominator:  The Barcuterie app is really fun- who doesn't love a giant pretzel with cheese sauce and grainy mustard? Anything with their pulled pork is also really good. The biggest surprise on the menu for me, was their salmon salad. The salmon was cooked very well, and the greens were nice and fresh - the first time I ordered it, others at the table saw mine and ordered also. If you are a veggie burger fan, they make their own patties - no frozen Morningstar farms burgers here.   No matter what you order - get a side of their tots!

Super rude right from the beginning though, before we even ordered anything. I wouldn't go here if you're trying to have a good time with some friends. JP3Z6lrbrLO3r0UjSa7U1g.text: Christina G was amazing. She is so sweet and makes us feel like regulars... Cheers Style! I wish they posted HER schedule publically so we could come only when she is here. Orders are always right and she is fun.

_DU54vQtuARAhN1jiOkohA.text: When I first arrived to this place I was a little skeptical due to the fact that you have to park in the dirt! But there were a ton of cars so I knew it was going to be a fun place.  When I walked in there were so many things going on. If you make a right you will be in the outside patio where they have a bar and places to sit. There were beer pong games being played. There were people eating. As you continue to the back of the bar there is another bar with so many beers on tap it will make your head spin. I am unfortunatly not a beer drinker. And to the right of the bar there is a small bowling alley! I never played in there but it looked like a lot of fun.  The food is pretty alight. Its regular bar food you usually find. I had the taste of the wings, fries, onion rings. It was pretty good.  The bartenders were pretty fast and do their best to not ignore anyone when your at the bar even though this place gets REALLY packed during a weekend. Even on a Thursday night it was really full.  This place is a great place to hang out with friends. It is on the Southwest area which is not the side of town where regular hip bars are found usually its closer to downtown but I would travel over there to hang out again.

YNzQmy9P9w6LZPDyhfhg6Q.text: Ok so why am I only finding out about this place!? I've been here way back when we had a Yelp event and it was still Road Runner but never knew it turned into such a cool place. I'm a fan obviously because they have hundreds of different beers. And the fact that it has a Gold Spike vibe but in a more laid back smaller neighborhood sports bar atmosphere plus its on my side of town.  They have lots of ways to entertain yourself lots of TVs to watch a game, board games, darts, billiards, they're own bowlingo alley, and lots of people of all ages, mostly the 20s and 30s crowd. It starts getting packed later in the night like between 9 and 11. Indoor area, outdoor patio, and a rebel area, lots of places to sit or hang as long as you can find on open spot.  Sign up for their rewards program basically you get rewarded the more different beers you drink. The only bad thing about it is that they don't add your drink to your account as you order them. They do it at the end when you're paying the bill and you have grab one of the employees up in the front. They dont keep track of what you ordered, like no itemized receipt, and you're just guessing it. Doing this to how many customers a night just doesnt make sense. Pretty much skipped get rewarded the last 2 times there. Its a cool reward program, if you get your beers added to your account.  Foods your typical bar food. Tried the potato skips it was pretty over cooked, felt almost like eating some thick chips. Also tried some of the wings, not bad but not great.  Not a fan of the food I've tried, so far, but a fan of everything else about PKWY Tavern, except they way they add your beers to the reward program. I'll be back.  Oh yea when its busy you'll be stuck parking in the unpaved dirt area.

JtMx7KsS-iCNQqfG1H9fdA.text: I don't know why in the world this place got 3 stars overall?? Perhaps these people aren't ordering the RIGHT things?!   The Big Cheese(12.95$) is by far the best sandwich ever made in this world. Period. It comes with a side of super creamy tomato soup that I dip my sandwich in!   WTF fries (9.95$) couldn't get any better. A fried egg and guac and cheese and jalapenos and BACON?! All on top of deliciously fried fries? For this price the portion is more than enough for one person!   The beers here are good, you definitely need to come a few times to try a bunch or else you're not getting the full experience. The bartenders are awesome and they are fast!   Definitely a place to come to eat and drink and play some games! They have bowling, darts, pool, beer pong, life-size Jenga, and that one game where you throw a bag into a hole??   Lots of options here, I promise you will NEVER get bored!
