Ordered Mac and cheese, potato skins, salad and egg breakfast. We got our food all at the same time, with no silverware. Tried to track down a server. Finally got up and walked around to find silverware. Dug into the food and it was nasty. The salad was completely overdressed, the eggs looked like they were from McDonalds and the Mac and cheese was salty and just gross. We had ordered drinks and my husband got a shot, which he got after we were done as they never brought it out.   I really wanted to like this place. The patio seemed pretty cool with jenga on it and tvs. I haven't played jenga in forever and asked the server how to play and she kinda laughed at me. I would never go back here again. NEVER

ia0Icuq2JNsoVpSrv2_-Wg.text: The food was good. A little more expensive but I didn't have a good time because it is so loud. We were outside and the music was way too loud.  I had to yell just to speak to the person next to me. Sore throat by the end of diner. I wouldn't want to come back at all. Sorry.

yDemnR9bKaddaZPM0TJcnQ.text: I like this place minus the weird smells. When we walked in they had an interesting packaged salad smell and then the bathroom has a very horrendous smell. Even outside we would get whiffs of a very unpleasant odor.   Other than the occasional smell, this place is great. Love all the outdoor/indoor games. This is my type of place (minus the smells). I'm hoping that was just an one-time thing :)

_DlSxIHZFbE6XE1rZyKMPQ.text: I have been here four times & I would have to say my rating is consistent with each time I have been here. I believe the security guards are constantly on a high horse & arrogant... and I hate to say it, but the constant reviews regarding racism are True. I've experienced them first hand (whether they don't want to let you in, give my friends a hard time, or witnessing other groups harassed -- for no reason) and it's a shame, because that sets the tone of the place since it's the first part you have to deal with. And just like everyone else mentions, THE CUSTOMER SERVICE IS ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. Truly.  The plus sides? This place has a nice, chill ambiance... often described as a "mini Gold Spike," has the laid back atmosphere with a lot of games like corn hole, beer pong, darts, billiards, bowling, giant Jenga, etc. Located on 215 & Flamingo so it's away from the downtown chaos and usually has a good amount of people there. The drinks are cheap, food very reasonably priced... Not a place I would choose personally; If it weren't for my friends picking it due to it being close by, I would never go out of my way.

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; waffle sliders with chips.

Yatty-hmDHTSVsgFxiwtUQ.text: Damn, this place is great. Great food & beer, incredibly friendly staff, and lots of entertainment. It's the perfect place, away from the strip, to hang out for a beer or have a huge party with all your friends.   I discovered this PKWY while looking for a place to watch the UFC event - at the door it was $20, or No Cover if you're a member. When I heard "member" I thought, "WTF is that for?"  Not to worry friends, it is simply a sign-up to their mobile app, and it's free (more about this app later).   Once inside, it's awesome: outdoor backyard-style area with picnic tables and overhead string lighting; then the middle section that's kinda outdoorsy with garage style lift gates; and the inside, a huge bar of countless taps with several TV's and bar games on the side. There's even a private area that can be sectioned off.   We sat in the middle section of it all and had great views of the fight in every direction. There's even our own TV at our table, with a power outlet with USB underneath to charge your phone. Neat.   There's plenty of food on the menu, all reasonably priced and I definitely want to come back for the entrees. Today I ordered the Hummus Plate ($7.95, not a fan - pita/chips weren't beyond stale), Philly Pizza ($10.95, perfect for two, deliciously fire baked), and Buffalo Beer Poached Wings ($9.95, blazin' hot delicious - I wanna try the other flavors too).   I can't finish this review without mentioning the beer selection. HOLY SH*T they've got a ton of beer. I was handed the beer menu, saw the front and back and, "Wow you guys have a lot to choose from"... Our server Chelsea (super nice) goes, "That's not everything," takes the menu and opens it like a book to reveal two more full pages. Like I said before, holy sh*t.   PKWY Tavern helps you keep track of the beers you've had, the beers you like, and even the beers you request using the aforementioned mobile app. Not only can I track my drinking, but if I consume here frequently I can earn points toward drinks and special events.   I dig it. I already want to go back.

CDdMJb3pKY-XWdoftE67Fg.text: Before coming, I did read the previous reviews. It seems like there are mixed feelings about this place. Some people felt like they were treated differently and others felt like they had a blast. I wanted to watch the basketball game so I decided to come here with an open mind.    FOOD/DRINKS: I've only eaten the pickles and chili. Pickles are delicious and the chili is a bit oily in my opinion. The beer selection is great. Before coming, I suggest signing up for the beer club. You get rewarded for drinking beers basically.   PRICES: Appetizers and starters - $5-10 Entree - $8-15 Beers - $7-10  SERVICE:  I've been here twice and haven't had any issues so far - granted I come here between 7-10pm and by myself. I'm able to find a spot right at the bar and the service has been great. My basketball TV request gets fulfilled and the bartenders check on me frequently for refills.  ENVIRONMENT: I wouldn't say that this place is exactly child friendly, especially at night. They do offer activities such as skee-ball, bowling, oversized Jenna, and oversized Connect 4 but I feel that these are more for adult entertainment (like Dave n Busters). Smoking inside is permitted and in general, it's a bar. But I've seen children wandering around .   Overall, I would come back for drinks and sports. It seems like there are many groups that come here so arriving early would be best if you want a table or a booth.

r0pD3giMPidjyjFbxk9X0Q.text: Stop pretending to be a sports bar. You play music during the marquee games of the weekend (typically the 4:45 pst game) in favor of a dated playlist. Trust me your clientele prefers the game audio to this despite what your chef/manager might say.

6cH5JbUOTNuFHl6zsBCmLg.text: Love this place!   Logging new beers has kinda become an OCD thing for me!    If you download the app you can message the managers on new cool beers you want to see if they can carry.  I hate IPA's but they have a ton and my friends love that but I'm all over the hefs, whites and lagers!!  Try the buffalo shrimp tacos!!!!

iwrFtiuBWWSVUzxGm5aQhg.text: Went here last night with a friend for happy hour. Heard a lot about it. Walked in, no hostess. Sat ourselves outside at a gross, uncomfortable picnic table. Server came over pretty quickly with menus. Menus were wrinkled, had dried up food on them, not too appetizing.   Happy hour isn't as good as they try to make it seem. Yes, they have an incredible beer selection (I love beer), but the happy hour beer is shit beer like Miller & Bud. No thanks. The good beers are about $7/pint, no happy hour deal. My friend ordered vodka tonic. It had dried up old limes in it. She drank it & told the server it wasn't great. They thought maybe it was the tonic so second drink was a vodka soda. Still not good. Definitely not the tonic.   We ordered jalapeno poppers & spicy chicken tacos. The poppers weren't on the happy hour menu. They were egg roll wrappers with cheese, cream cheese, & a few jalapenos inside. Meh. Tacos were mediocre at best. Three corn tortillas with shredded spicy chicken inside.   They allow smoking which is a huge factor in my decision not to go there again. I see lots of reviews saying the service was bad. Our service was okay, not great but I've had worse. We each had two drinks (two well, two craft beers), and split the jalapeno things & the chicken tacos. Bill was $36 & change.   This place reminds me of an old college bar. I like the concept but it just misses. I dont love the picnic table thing. Food & crap stuck down in the cracks of the table. Yuck. I liked it better when it was the Roadrunner.

photos.caption: Photo of PKWY Tavern Flamingo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N7H0J9mJD_Rcs268xTBAZw.text: If you're trying to figure out what to do on a Friday, Saturday, or heck even a Thursday night - pull through here.  Yes, you weren't confused. Even on a THURSDAY night this place can draw in quite the crowd.  I'm still kind of confused on the 3-star rating because this place deserves nothing, but 5 stars. I brought my friend from San Diego (who use to live in Vegas) and she was pretty blown away at this place. She didn't know there were bars like this outside of the downtown area. The best way for me to describe this place is that it's very similar to Gold Spike without having to deal with downtown traffic. It looks like a decked out back yard party that someone decided to throw while the parents are out of town.  Anyways, they've got the outdoor area with picnic tables for playing beer pong, heater lamps (for those cold winter-y nights), corn hole boards, ping pong tablets, a dj, and a bar. Inside they have even MORE seating, a few arcade games, another bar, and a mini bowling alley. I also believe that's some darts in the far end of the room you can play.  I've gone here several times and will continue coming back several more times. I've always had awesome service and some unforgettable nights here. If you're in town for St. Patrick's Day or Cinco de Mayo, this place really knows how to celebrate those holidays.  I also have to praise this bar for having my favorite gin, Hendrick's. So do me a favor and drink a gin & tonic for me.

Q9gKXPUuqF45GqxYjPsoUA.text: Pros:  - Games. Lots of them. Darts, pool, bowling, jenga, etc.  - Spacious and airy - Large beer selection - Fairly attentive staff (depending on the crowd)  Cons: - Can get extremely busy on weekend nights. After 9 pm, prepare for sardine can-like crowds. - Lousy sound system. When they start cranking the tunes, it's annoyingly loud. There's good loud and there's bad loud. This is bad loud. - Food wasn't so great when we ate there. Could've been an off day, who knows. Not inedible by any means, just not very impressive.  Other notes:  -They do have a beer club (and mobile app to keep track). - I don't get the green wigs some bartenders wear?? They look like a Dr Suess nightmare. -They show UFC fights here for free. - Late nights, pretty much a twenty-something crowd.

2u3lWyIDVwUmRL3gcknsPg.text: Great spot. Atmosphere is really awesome, the servers are attentive, food is awesome and drinks are generous. Its mostly a local spot, but if your visiting from out of town and want to avoid the ridiculous costs of food and drinks at The Strip casinos, come here. The local hot women come here too, alot of eye candy. Remember, if you play video poker the drinks are discounted or your comped. Take care of the bartenders and they will go to bat for you. Stiff everyone and be prepared to cough up drink money. Play the double up poker machines, they are the best. Just a great spot to unwind and enjoy yourself. Couldnt recomend any higher !!!!!!!

MmX_5UcAlpObChpxnSs-WA.text: The good news is the security is great, the bad news is that they are required. Three visits later and this is definitely a young crowd establishment. Lots of bumping elbows and waiting for drinks.

VdndobnVJWt5iUDH1sFYjw.text: Great atmosphere for all sports. Horrible service. I thought it would change after switching from Road Runner, but I was wrong.   We sat outside for 25 minutes, asked the hostess and a bar back to have someone bring us menus. Waitress came by after 35 minutes took our drink order. 30 minutes later and still no drinks.   Don't come here if you're in a hurry or want service.

nH6Gj4iDV08q_jI1f2-Izw.text: I've heard good things about this place. I thought it would be a fun place to meet a buddy after work for happy hour. I was wrong. The service was terrible. I sat at my table for over 10 minutes before a server came over. The food did come out very fast. However when it came out nobody brought napkins or utensils. $6 for three tiny tacos and $7for two small overcooked sliders, seems way overpriced. My friend showed up late so I cashed out and we went somewhere else. I didn't want him to suffer as I did.

BTOvWpTHJRNEhyWuaf30_A.text: This place has a good selection of domestic beers, decent food, but bad service. Our group spent spent a good amount of money there but we were constantly searching for our waitress. When we finally got our drinks, they were the wrong beers on 3 occasions (2 different waitresses) in the same night. In addition to, we had a couple of people who came in later, ordered food and they came in to go containers twice. The table next to us made a reservation and we overheard them complaining that they received the wrong food as well.    Bartenders are awesome. Friendly, helpful and quick. If you go to this place, you're better off sitting at the bar or getting your drinks at the bar.

j0ub2DBJ-MONMoVOc0OF8Q.text: Had a great afternoon, there was awesome outdoor service from our waitress Annemari. This was my first time here and I were very impressed with her knowledge the different types of brews of tap.  The outdoor games, we're just an added bonus.

YbqkeijiYwUU9X6x1l00dA.text: I love this place! I come here all the time with every one of my friends. We specifically come on Wednesday nights for Derek. He knows our order which is nice. The food is delicious and the drinks are great and always consistent.

HYeaP87ghQjQirshjgeGPA.text: If you ever want to be ignored, especially on a slow weekday night, this is the place to be. Unless you are an obviously over-intoxicated female, stumbling to the bar, slurring your words, you will not be acknowledged. The food here is great, and conveniently located for so many locals, but there are still people who care about service when entering an establishment. I say this is my last time here, hopefully the memory from today will stick. Maybe the second location has employees who value someone without breasts.

We were looking for a fun place to get drinks and meet some new people, which this bar definitely provided that atmosphere. However,  I am taking time out of my day to give them ONE star for their service. I would prefer to give a ZERO if it were permissible. We had the worst service at this place and would never recommend to our friends or clients. The bartender (which we had to ask her name) I believe her name is Jenifer or Jen (shorter, medium body built with lighter hair) seemed more concerned about her own drinks rather then serving paying customers! In addition, would have been nice to not get charged while gambling. Whoever does the training for this place should pay more attention to the behavior of their bar staff and hire people that understands customer service. Or maybe a bartender that is polished.  POOR service don't waste your time here.

ujsk8H2Cz3EuKtHFwnT67w.text: Great service and fun games. This is the place you want to go to if you want to relax and have a good time. Dress casual and leave the problems at the door. cSYycRCP8OyL3DhAm34MrA.text: First time here so I was excited to check it out . Right off the bat parking was ridiculous, it was over crowded so people were parking in a dirt lot. We got to our table I'm not sure if they were short staffed but it took awhile for our waitress to come around . Once we got her attention we ordered our drinks, it was roughly 10 min for her to come back with the wrong drinks ! I didn't see it as a big deal alcohol is alcohol, so I just shrugged it off.   Here's the fun part about our night ! About 5 minuets after that we hear our car license plate number being called over the speakers. My boyfriend goes to see what's the problem. Turns out were being accused of doing donuts in the dirt parking lot! The more amazing part is that "we busted someone's windshield.". Security is saying that they had multiple witnesses, and if it wasn't us there security cameras would prove it. We would have to wait 3 days though cause they would have to put in a request to view them ?! As you can imagine I was already upset! We were waiting for the police to get there to file a report . Security kept on letting us know that we can leave, they already had all our information we didn't have to stay. Which I was like hell no ! They were being shady the whole time.   To make a long story short. It wasn't us! After that whole fiasco this place was a horrible first experience for us! Customer service is obviously not their main priority!

Ta2Ip5epQPjAbERF-uLCvA.text: I like this establishment because they provide a hometown/sports bar environment and deliver a great team. Savannah delivered exceptional service, I would recommend this business.

VaS3CE0gWf07aorUSFwrRQ.text: I really really want to love PKWY. I want it to be my goto neighborhood bar. I like coming here because the crowd and the ambience is always cool. I've been here many times since it's so close to my house but each and every time they fall short. The service is the worst. You are better off ordering your own drink at the bar and taking it to your table, which i usually do. Yeah its awesome that they have so many beers but last time i was there i was served 2 flat beers and then i switched to jameson and ginger and the gingerale was flat.  Really!? The menu has really improved but their turnover rate is ridiculous. They need better back of house staff.

rW-PFpT1t4RcnO3Z7FJqYQ.text: Visited this bar on a fairly busy Friday night. Service was kinda lacking at first, but it picked up. Food and drinks were served quick and it was fairly priced. Good place for locals who don't wanna go downtown. I liked that this place was clean and people were responsible for the most part. Cool little hang out spot outside kinda like gold spike, but smaller. If you just wanna hang out and relax this is a good place. Located next to the lvac on 215 and flamingo.

VcglAx_H3g0M_iYZt63upA.text: I've only been to this place twice and I haven't been too impressed either time. They get two stars because of the food, ambiance and the occasional good customer service.  The first time I went there were only like 5 people dining/drinking there yet the waitress still messed up when charging my card. She had to void it and it was fine after that but still..  The second time, I actually went for my birthday because I have a lot of friends who wanted to go there and I wanted to give them another chance. Well, that is the last time I'll go there. The waitress we had was good but that's about the only part of the night that was. Half of us went to play life size jenga and hang out outside. That was going fine until some idiot came over and literally kicked our game down because his friends dared him to. He was kicked out not long after. Then as our table was being cleared off, someone stole one of my birthday cards with a gift card inside. My friends and I brought it up to some staff and they were "checking on it" but never came back.  Not impressed, PKWY Tavern.

1rlLhMVGzvQKycTgme01AA.text: Just got back home Parkway Tavern where we celebrated my Husband's birthday. We've been here several times in the past. I enjoy the food and overall atmosphere. It is conveniently located off the 215. Although, this evening I did experience something upsetting (Enough for me to write about). I believe it was racism. We were with a large party and a friend mentioned that he didn't pay his tab, but our server said that everyone had closed out. I wanted to make sure that he was correct. I went to the servers' station. Our server was clearly busy on the register, so I stood there waiting.  A security guard inserted himself in between me and service station/ register area, as if he was blocking me from it. He just stood there, inches from my face, he didn't acknowledge me. He was essentially guarding the register area from me.  There was plenty of room. There was no need to be that close to me. Thank goodness our server turned around saw me and confirmed that all our tabs were indeed paid. Some of our friends paid more than their share. As I walked away, the security guard walked away with me. I didn't think much of it and went back to the party, but other events occurred tonight that led me to believe that there was a hint of racism at this place. It took some time for me to process it. It's hard not to feel insulted. It makes you wonder what you did in order to be identified as the "Person to keep an eye on." Or have the staff watch you. I wasn't unruly, wasn't loud, I wasn't even drinking alcohol. I'm glad I didn't. Otherwise, this post would be classified as the rant of a customer that had one too many. I don't think I'll ever go back, because of what happened this evening.    -S

h5DX2OlNjE7w17GTjhRvZw.text: Not good for gambling. Been a few of times and they can never get it right on the drink comps.sometimes they charge and sometimes they don't.everytime I go I usually play $100-$200 but since I play quick they don't think that sitting there for 20-30 mins justifies  2 or 3 free drinks.they lost my business and gaming $. there food btw is subpar and pricey as well, wings waaaay too much sauce and bland.better food down the street @ shucks or sierra gold.

FgOdqPljg6yvd_6xn_cP8Q.text: We decided to try out this place and see what the hype was all about. Brought a friends brother who just for back from a deployment over seas. He loved it! The theme of the bar is awesome! Very young and different from most bars in town. Loved the artificial grass outside and the benches and games. The only thing that really rained on our parade was our waitress, I maybe saw her twice our entire time. We ordered the nachos which were a little different with the chips but still good. She didn't come back to check if we were okay or needed anything, (our glasses were all empty.) so we decided we should just go outside to the patio area and just deal with the bar instead. Finally after waiving her down she brought our check and after specifically telling her how we wanted it split, we got one bill... The rest of the night was great after we paid and left the inside portion.   I advise if you go just order from the bar, it's a lot faster and they seem to actually want your money and want to make you drinks.

z_DLryGqvB-tPfVnTbNaKw.text: Came here on a Saturday night for Happy Hour.  There was about 12 of us so pretty decent size group.  No complaints about the food or drinks. They have great happy hour prices.  $3 wells and half off appetizers with generous portions.  Service was a little slow at times and our server, Rebecca, didn't check on us as often as we would have liked but it's a busy place.  Needless to say our bill was pretty hefty even with Happy Hour prices.  Because we all just threw in cash Rebecca's tip went above and beyond any sort of normal gratuity.  Four of us were still chatting at the table and a drink was ordered.  Given the tip amount we figured  Rebecca, might do us a solid and not even charge for that drink but nope bought a bill out for one beer.  I thought that was a poor customer service move on her part.  We walked out around 10 when the music volume increased and bathroom attendants appeared.

o2A-aA23u134bUvMt4AAUQ.text: Its Tuesday they're dead maybe 4 tables with people 30 minutes total to be seated and never saw a waiter/waitress that's pretty bad. I've been in the food service industry off and on my whole life if you intend to have a sign that reads " please wait for host " there should be a hostess waiting. The wait staff was to busy attending to friends than to take care patrons.saddest thing about the whole thing is that its one of the only places in Vegas that has firestone brewery 805 on tap might go back might not.

Hl6nBOAZzzDTRMi-I4tbdA.text: This was a great place to grab a drink with co worker  God forbid...  You have to use the restroom here. Such a great selection of beers leads to having a couple... So what I gotta pee #sueMe unfortunately I would rather get arrested for indecent exposure for peeing in public than use proper facilities.     Never have I ever been in a more foul place than the mens restroom@prkwytavern. #ew   If you would like some more perspective imagine going on a strenuous hike at Red Rock. You are exhausted and upon returning to the trail head it is time to use the jon...No matter how long ago the park rangers cleaned it it's not really that bad. You did your business. xB-gC1Z79NtO6cWO8ggk2A.text: This place definitely deserves to be above 3 stars for sure. I've only been once but the food was good, the atmosphere was popping, the beer selection is ridiculously awesome! But the service was definitely under manned. We had one waitress for a table of like 20 and she had about 5 other tables to worry about. I think she handled it well but there were other member of the parties that were upset, I think they were overreacting. The food came out really fast though, that was a big plus in my books. Sjt2CM7jh6mFX5TxF9r-hw.text: First I would give our server 5 stars, I'm pretty sure her name was Karen.  She was on top of things.  The beer selection gets 100 stars even though we did not have beer, it was lunch and we had to go to work.  I plan to go back, they have a huge selection.  The dining area itself I would give 3 stars.  It's not partitioned from the bar so you get that great smokey smell.  The food gets a 5.  We had chicken fingers and fish and chips.  It was not greasy which is a plus, the chips were ok.  We also had the onion rings and they were really good.  It looks like a fun place, pool tables, 2 bowling lanes, darts and jenga.  I could see this place getting crazy on the weekend.  As far as 11am on a Monday, it was quiet.
